loans.name: Dean

texts.en: Dean A., 27, pictured here with her husband, lives in the Kampong Cham province. She sells rice and makes US$2.50 per day, while her husband sells fish in the market. On average, he earns US$7.5 of profit per day. This couple has two young children. Mrs Dean A. is asking for a loan to purchase rice and fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase rice and fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow peanuts

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (1319051335) is a 24-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, H. owns and operates a business in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. H. has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, H. joined Kiva partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. H. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the fifth loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Candy Selene

texts.es:
La señora Candy S. F.   tiene 27 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios de secundaria completa, tiene 2hijos que dependen de ella económicamente.
Candy se dedica a la venta de cerveza en su domicilio.
Este es su primer crédito de 300 soles compro mas materiales como: hilos, telas, alambres, perlas, etc.  para que pueda hacer sus manualidades 
Con el crédito de 1.000 soles que será cancelado en 6meses, lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra de más cervezas.
Candy   tiene como sueño hacer una micro empresa de manualidades y almohadas con el apoyo de su madre y de sus hermanas.
texts.en:
Ms Candy is twenty-seven years old and lives in the community of Salaverry, in the Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. This businesswoman has completed her secondary education. She has two children who are economically dependent on her. Candy sells beer from her home. With her first loan, of three hundred soles, she bought materials such as thread, fabric, wire, pearls, etc. in order to make handicrafts. With the loan of one thousand soles, due in six months, she will invest in her business by buying more beer. Candy’s dream is to start a small business making handicrafts and pillows with the assistance of her mother and her sisters.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more cases of beer

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es: Martha Irene F. Pérez tiene 30 años. Es una mujer muy atenta, está felizmente casada y tiene 2 hijos. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. A ella le gusta mucho su humilde trabajo, Martha inicio ofreciendo cosméticos y poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario. Su sistema de venta es al contado y al crédito recuperando en abonos los días de pago, su clientela es variada tiene personas del sector y amigas de su hija que la apoya en esta digna actividad. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para niños, ropa para damas y ropa para caballeros. Su deseo es establecer una tienda, para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Martha Irene F. Pérez is 30 years old. She is a very attentive woman, is happily married, and has 2 children. She sells general merchandise and enjoys her humble work a lot. Martha began selling cosmetics and, little by little, increased her inventory. She sells her goods in cash and on credit, recovering payments in installments on specific days. She has a varied clientele and has people in her sector and friends of her daughters helping her in her business. The loan that she is requesting will be used as capital for her business so that she can buy clothes for children, women, and men. Her dream is to have a store and to support her children in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing sells charcoal at her house. She has been in this business for the past six years and she has been borrowing from LAPO for the past two years. Blessing is very determined and optimistic about the growth of her business and the prosperity of her family. She is 36 years old and married with seven children. Blessing hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more charcoal to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Akwesi

texts.en: Akwesi J. is single and has two children. He has completed junior high school. Akwesi sells phones and accessories in Elmina, and has been doing so since 2007. Akwesi uses his income to pay school fees for his children. Akwesi will use the loan to buy more cell phones and accessories for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Akwesi plans to save up to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cell phones and accessories for sale.

loans.name: 28 - Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
"TRân Kiều Thị T. (188) is a 58 year-old female living in the town of T. Hoá.  TRân is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 28 Nam Ngạn (17.08.28).


TRân is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, TRân shares & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business with another people in her family.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing electrical services to local community members.  TRân has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, TRân joined T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  TRân has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1963500 VND from T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  TRân plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Trường (184) is a 38 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a butcher shop.


2.  Vũ Thị Hương (166) is a 51 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


3.  T. M. Tú (187) is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


About T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for T. Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the T. Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


TRân Kiều Thị T. (188) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố T. Hoá.  TRân là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 28 Nam Ngạn (17.08.28).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ điện cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  TRân thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, TRân kiếm được khoảng 2000000 VND.  Vào 2008, TRân đã tham gia T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  TRân đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,963,500 VND từ T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vật tư cần thiết để cung cấp dịch vụ.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Trường (184) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.


2.  Vũ Thị Hương (166) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


3.  T. M. Tú (187) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo T. Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh T. Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."	
If you would like to translate the Vietnamese text above, please visit the  free online translator  offered by Vdict.com.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Dora Isabel

texts.es:
Dora es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Dora es soltera, tiene 48 años y 1 hijo, D. profesión docente D. secundaria, Dora tiene un taller D. confección D. prendas D. vestir, su local esta ubicado en el centro D. L. ciudad, cuenta con el apoyo D. personas.
Dora necesita un préstamo D. 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. telas e hilos.
Los sueños D. Dora son educar a sus hijos y construir un departamento.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the Triunfo Communal Bank. Dora is 48, single, and she has one child. By profession she is a high school teacher. Dora has a seamstress shop. Her shop is located in the center of the city, and she does have help from other people. Dora needs a loan for 1400 PEN to buy fabric and thread. Dora dreams of educating her child and building an apartment.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and thread

loans.name: María

texts.es: María G. es una mujer trabajadora y optimista, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, es madre de tres hijos de los cuales dos son mayores de edad, se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él es empleado público. Es socia del Banco Comunal “La Positiva” desde hace un año, El primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que invirtió en productos de belleza para vender de casa en casa, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1200 que será utilizado para comprar productos e insumos para su negocio de menús y también en la compra de manteles y sillas para esta actividad. La meta de María es llegar a tener un bazar y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María G. is a hardworking and optimistic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa which is in the Ucayali region. María has three adult children and sells food in the market. She has the support of her husband, who is a government employee.

María has been a member of the Communal Bank “La Positiva” for one year. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy beauty products that she sold house to house. She now needs a loan of 1200 soles to purchase products and supplies for her à la carte business. She will also buy tablecloths and chairs. María’s goal is to open a bazaar and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients, supplies, tablecloths, and chairs

loans.name: Fuerza Y Union Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
DELIA CELINDA R. S., es viuda,  hace poco tiempo perdió a su esposo, tiene 39 años D. edad y tiene 3 hijos D. 14, 10 y 2 años D. edad. Actualmente es L. Tesorera D. su Grupo denominado “Fuerza y unión hacia el Futuro” que cuenta con 10 integrantes.
L. Sra. Delia se dedica a L. venta D. comida, el cual funciona en un espacio D. su casa. ElL. se inició vendiendo gelatinas y chupetes, pudiendo reunir poco a poco un pequeño capital, el que le serviría para invertir en los menús que ofrecería al público.
Con L. pérdida D. su esposo, quien era su compañero y apoyo, se vio D. un momento a otro,  soL.. Al inicio fue muy duro y hasta estuvo a punto D. perder su negocio. Pero al ver que sus hijos L. necesitaban, toma valor y retoma el trabajo.
Actualmente, aparte D. su pequeño restaurant, iniciará su negocio D. venta D. productos D. limpieza, el cual espera le vaya bien.
Sin embargo, elL. siempre está pensando en el futuro D. sus hijos, trabajar mucho para poder darles una buena educación, es por eso que se ha planteado como una próxima meta invertir en L. venta D. jugos y yogurt, para lo cual ya se ha capacitado; y con su negocio actual empezará a juntar su capital.
texts.en:
Delia Celinda R. S. is a widow. She lost her husband only a short time ago. She is 39 years old and has three children of 14, 10 and 2 years of age. She is currently the treasurer of the group named “Fuerza y unión hacia el Futuro” (Strength and solidarity towards the future) which has ten members. Delia sells food from her home. She began by selling jellies and lollipops, and bit by bit she got a small capital together which she used to invest in set menus to offer to the public. The loss of her husband, her companion and support, saw her left alone from one moment to the next. At the beginning it was very hard and she was at the point of losing her business. But after seeing her children who needed her, she gathered her strength and took up her business again. Apart from her small restaurant, she is about to start up a business selling cleaning products, which she hopes will go well. However, she is always thinking about her children's future and she works hard to give them a good education. For this reason she has set her next goal to sell juices and yogurt which she has already completed training to do. With this initiative and with her current business she can begin to put together some capital.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for her future juice store

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia M. C. es una señora de 47 años de edad, quien vive con sus dos hijos y su hija,  en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada La Esperanza localizada en San José de Upala, Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y le che) y agricultura. 

Doña Lidia se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente desde hace un año a la siembra de platano. Dice que aunque ha sembrado en pequeñas cantidades el mercado para este producto es muy bueno. Comenta que gracias a este proyecto sus condiciones de vida han mejorado considerablemente y dice además que ha crecido como persona y ha adquirido mucho conocimiento, dice que se siente muy capaz y muy feliz de poder mantenerse activa.

En estos momentos doña Lidia desea agrandar su siembra por lo tanto quiere obtener un microcrédito  por ¢250,000 (doscientos cincuenta mil colones), para darle mantenimiento a su nueva cosecha además comprar fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos. Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha, con un producto de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto y así poder incrementar la producción y obtener mayores ingresos para su familia. 

Doña Lidia es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Mujeres la Esperanza; la cual está integrada solo por mujeres, ya que se especializa en apoyar a mujeres no profesionales y  jefas de hogar, es una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Lidia M. C. is 47 years old and the mother of two sons and a daughter. She lives in the small rural Costa Rican community of La Esperanza, which is located in San José de Upala, Alajuela Province. The main business development activities in the area are cattle breeding (for both beef and milk) and agriculture.

Doña Lidia is a farmer, specifically growing bananas within the past year. Even though she produces small quantities, she says the market for her product is very good. As a result of her work, Lidia’s living conditions have improved considerably. She also says she has grown as a person and has acquired much knowledge. Lidia feels very capable and is happy to remain active.

At the moment, Doña Lidia hopes to expand her farm so she is requesting a microloan of 250,000 colones. In order to maintain her latest crop of bananas, she will purchase fertilizers and other supplies. Lidia expects a good harvest from this investment. This crop usually commands a high selling price, so she wants to increase her production so that she can generate more income for her family.

Doña Lidia is a member of the Women’s Community Credit Enterprise of La Esperanza, which is composed solely of women. This microfinance institute specializes in supporting women who are heads of households but not professionals. It is one of 100 partner organizations that comprise EDESA in Costa Rica. This is Lidia’s second loan and she hopes to continue growing personally and financially. She is also an active participant of her local credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & supplies to maintain her banana crop

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
La señora Viviana L. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en los anteriores créditos los cuales han sido para su negocio. 
En esté momento ha ella y a su esposo el señor Anival Suárez, es están ofreciendo un terreno a muy buen preció y en un buen lugar para poder poner otro taller de reparación de autos, pero en esté momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para poder pagar el enganche y así poder obtener el terreno y establecer el negocio, para darles empleo a otras dos personas mas. 
Con las ganancias de los negocios pagaran el crédito, ya que los gastos familiares los cubrirá la señora Viviana con su ingreso de su trabaja como enfermera de un hospital.
La persona que aparece en la foto es el señor Anival Suárez ya que la señora de encontraba en la casa cuidando al niño.
texts.en:
Mrs. Viviana L. is very appreciative for the loans she has received in the past for her business. At this time, she and her husband, Mr. Anival Suárez, have been offered a well priced plot of land, located in a good area in order to construct another auto repair shop. However, right now they do not have the financial resources to pay the down payment to get the plot and establish the business, so they can offer employment to two more people. With the earnings from the businesses, they will pay the loan, as the household expenses are covered by Mrs. Viviana, with her income from working as a hospital nurse. The person who appears in the picture is Mr. Anival Suárez as Viviana is inside the house taking care of the child.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a space for another business

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeun N. is a villager in Tuol Svay village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. On this plantation she faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil and it is far from the irrigation system. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a water pump and fertilizers to support her rice field.

Mrs. Thoeun N. is 38 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Pun Try, is a fisherman and is shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and fertilizers to support her rice field

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Zavkhan province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two oldest children, 21 and 17, both attend university while the youngest child, 10, attends a local secondary school. 

Narantuya and her husband operate an iron goods making service in their town. She makes stoves, tongs, and other metal goods which are used in both houses and gers. She began her business in 2006, and since then, she has been able to contribute greatly to her family’s finances with her monthly profits of 80,000-150,000 MNT.  She hopes to keep growing her profits so that her children can continue their education. She says, “I want to save some money for my children’s education.”  Narantuya is requesting a 200,000 MNT loan in order to purchase iron and other metals for her business.

loans.use: to purchase iron and other metals

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet M. is 36 years old and is married with three children. Her husband molds blocks to support his family.

Juliet is a petty trader, selling groceries, drinks, clothes and kitchen utensils to make a living. She has been in this business for a long time and hopes to see her business grow bigger in the nearest future.

Juliet is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries, drinks and kitchen utensils to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, drinks and kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Née en 1964 à Womey dans la commune d'Abomey-Calavi, K. Antoinette est mariée à AZOGBAKIN Simon. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, dont trois représentent leurs propres enfants. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit depuis 8 ans à Womey. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. N'ayant jamais fréqenté l'école, Antoinette a commencé très tôt la vente de nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce et de poissons frits) à Cocotomey dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Antoinette mène cette activité depuis 22 ans environs et s'approvisonne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. L'activité de Antoinette lui génère de revenu qu'elle utilise pour faire face à ses différents besoins. Mais actuelement, Antoinette n'arrive plus à satisfaire tous ses clients qui ne cessent d'augmenter. C'est pour cette raison que Antoinette sollicite un deuxième prêt auprès de ALIDé, pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire ses clients. Antoinette a entre temps bénéficié d'un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle avait bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Born in 1964 in Womey, in the community of Abomey-Calavi, Ms. K. Antoinette is married to Mr. AZOGBAKIN Simon.  The couple has five children to support. Three of the children are their own, and some of them are in school.  The family has been living  in Womey for eight years.  The couple jointly ensures that family responsibilities are met.  Never having attended school, Antoinette soon started selling food (cornmeal mash served with sauce and fried fish), in Cocotomey in Abomey Calavi. She has been in this business for about 22 years and stocks up at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  Her business generates revenues that she uses to address her different needs.  But right now, she is no longer able to satisfy the entirety of her ever-growing customer base. For this reason, Antoinette is requesting a second loan from ALIDé for bolstering her business and satisfying her customers. In the meanwhile, she benefited from an ALIDé loan, which she repaid.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn, oil, and sauce condiments (tomatoes, onions, chili peppers)

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily started farming on a small parcel of land. She said that she believed that it would grow well if she works hard on it. She plans to grow her farm to earn better.

Emily is a 34-year-old married woman with a 7-year-old child. She lives in a town in Agusan Del Sur. She also wants to save for her child’s future.

Emily joined CEVI hoping to have financial assistance. She requested Php 6,000 which she will use to buy farm inputs such fertilizer and seeds. Receiving this loan is truly useful for Emily’s farming.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Erlinda Del Rosario

texts.es: Erlinda Del Rosario tiene 33 años, por lo que se dedica a una pulpería, hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella es una persona muy responsable, este negocio le pertenecía a su Mama quien le dejo a cargo esta actividad económica, pues siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarle a su hijo que todavía está a su cargo el pan de cada día. Ella se levanta todos los días con la esperanza que situación mejorara. Es por eso que realiza este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de golosinas, galletas, refrescos y un poco de productos de limpieza para el hogar. Su deseo es que su inventario sea más grande.
texts.en:
Erlinda Del Rosario is 33 years old. She runs a small grocery store. She has worked in this business for more than 17 years. She is a very responsible person. This business belongs to her Mother who left her in charge of this economic activity. She has always made sure she provided for her son who is still under her care. She gets up every day with the hope that the situation will improve. That is why she is doing this financing, for working capital. It will go towards the purchase of candy, cookies, soft drinks and some household cleaning products. Her wish is that her inventory were larger.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, cookies, soft drinks and some household cleaning products

loans.name: Martin Santos

texts.es: Martin Santos H. C. de 37 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de San Martín, departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa, la señora Brígida Pineda, la cual se dedica a trabajar como comerciante, y junto s sus tres hijos todos menores de edad. El señor Martín, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, el cual es un molino que está ubicado en la colonia El Castillo del departamento de San Salvador,  en el cual ya posee 12 años de tenerlo. Es un negocio muy rentable ya que su ubicación es muy buena debido a que en su alrededor existen muchos comedores, razón por la que cuenta con varios clientes, los cuales a diario llegan a moler el maíz u otros alimentos, lo cual le permite a Martín percibir ganancias diarias. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar nuevos motores los cuales trabajen a base de gasolina, de manera que mejore su servicio, agilizándolo para poder atender mayor cantidad de clientes, ya que en muchas ocasiones sobre todo en las horas pico le es muy  necesario a Martín reducir el tiempo que invierte en cada cliente para dar abasto con todos. Martín es un señor que goza de muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos como también de sus clientes, ya que es una persona muy amable y trabajadora, quien desea seguir adelante y mejorar su negocio para brindarle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Martin Santos H. C. is 37 years old and resides in the town of San Martín, located in the Department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife Sra. Brígida Pineda, who works as a merchant, and their three dependent children. Sr. Martin works in his own business, a mill located in the El Castillo subdivision of the Department of San Salvador, and has been in operation for twelve years. His business is very profitable because it is in a good location surrounded by several eateries. This allows Martin to generate income each day.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy new motors that are powered by gasoline so that he can improve his service, making it faster so that he can attend to more customers. During peak hours, there have been instances when he has had to spend less time with each customer in order to keep up with everything. Martin has very good references from his neighbors, who are also is customers. He is a kind and hardworking person who desires to succeed and improve his business so that he can provide a better life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gas-powered motors for his grain mill

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua S. is married and has two children. She attained a junior high school level of education. Efua sells locally manufactured salt at Jukwa market. Her husband is a farmer. Efua uses her income to help her husband take care of the family. Efua will use the loan she will be receiving to purchase more salt and secondhand clothing (which will serve as an additional trade) for sale. With the new profits from her extended business, Efua plans to save to buy a shop for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more salt and secondhand clothing

loans.name: Elma's Group

texts.en:
Elma A., from the village of Bagacay, is the 27-year-old leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Elma, who is married and has three school-aged children, owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling household items in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be her first from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's the living situation.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Chérifatou

texts.fr: Cette femme est une dame très sérieuse et dynamique, elle est veuve et a à sa charge ses 2 enfants. Pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille elle s’est lancée en 2008 dans le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois. Elle souhaite augmenter  ses recettes, pour cela elle doit augmenter son stock de marchandises raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 20 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
This woman is very responsible and dynamic; she is a widow and is responsible for her two children. In order to provide for her family expenses, in 2008, she launched into the business of selling bags of charcoal. She hopes to increase her profits, and to do so she must increase her stock of merchandise. This is the reason she is asking WAGES for a loan to purchase 20 bags of charcoal.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bags of charcoal

loans.name: God Power Group

texts.en:
Philimena V. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God Power.  She is 38 years old, single, and has four children who range from six to 25 years old. She was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to poverty.

For eight years, she has been selling used clothes on Front Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner that keeps her customers returning.  

She plans to use her 16,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 51,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bags of used clothes.  Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Philimena is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua E. cooks Jollof rice (a popular West African dish) at Abura for sale. She is married to a mason and lives together with her four children.

Efua has been selling cooked Jollof rice for about a year now, supporting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of rice to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of rice to cook for sale

loans.name: Georgia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Georgea está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y decididas una de ellas es la señora María de los Ángeles M. V. quien vende fresco naturales de mango, naranja, pitaya, cacao, de frutas etc. y tortillas bastimento por excelencia de los nicaragüenses. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 20 años  e invertirá el crédito en capital de trabajo para salir adelante.

Sus compañeros de grupo son Miriam del Carmen M. Alemán quien tiene un pequeño taller de costura e invertirá en telas para realizar blusas y faldas y Paulino Aguirre R. comercializa sandias desde hace seis años.
texts.en:
The Georgia group is comprised of three hard-working, determined people. One of them, Maria de los Angeles M. V. sells natural fruit drinks (mango, orange, dragon fruit, cocoa, and other fruit) and Nicaraguan tortillas. This work was implemented 20 years ago. By investing in this loan, you will help her succeed. Her colleagues in the group are Miriam del Carmen M. Alemán who has a dressmaking shop and invests in fabrics to create blouses and skirts and Paulo Aguirre R. who has been selling watermelons for six years.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit, sugar and corn.

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Mrs. Phea N. is 39 years old and is a villager in Ta Non village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Von Ngon, are silk weavers at home and aside from silk weaving, Mrs. Phea N. is also a grocery seller who owns a small store to support her business. With both businesses, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. 

In order to support the silk-weaving business and to increase their income to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Phea N. decided to ask for a loan to buy 10 kilograms of silk to enlarge her business activities. This couple has a child who is attending the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy 10kg of silk

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida P. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province.  She is a 41 year old widow with six school-aged children.  To make a living, Lida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail general shop.  Lida has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Lida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI.  Lida plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

---------------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Balimaya Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Balimaya II sont des femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 37 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames à Missiritou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres, le pois de terre, le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, NASSOUN D. compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1, 3 hectare de pois de terre et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000FCFA environ en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Balimaya II are married women who average 37 years of age and two children each. They live in polygamous families in Missiritou, a village in the Dioïla prefecture, in Koulikoro, Mali's second administrative region. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to better organize their activities at the start of winter. Their crops include ground peas, millet, peanuts and beans. This is their second farm loan, and the previous loan was repaid without problems. With this new loan, NASSOUN D. plans to buy inputs and small farming equipment, and pay for the plowing required to maintain 1.3 hectares of ground peas and peanuts. After harvest, the produce is sold in Dioïla to a clientele composed primarily of dealers from the big cities. They hope to make an average profit of approximately 50,000FCFA by end of season.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small farming equipment

loans.name: Santos Gilberto

texts.es: Santos Gilberto S. C. de 22 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador y responsable, el cual se dedica de lleno al bienestar de su familia, el reside en San Francisco Gotera, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa una joven de 20 años la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a su pequeña bebé de 3 años de edad. Santos se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, el cual cría en su casa de habitación la cual esta ubicada en la zona rural de San Francisco Gotera, este oficio él lo aprendió de su familia, por lo que ya cuenta con 7 años de experiencia, razón por la cual es muy conocido en la zona y cuenta con la confianza de muchas personas quienes le comprar su ganado. Santos es un joven que se esfuerza en la búsqueda de nuevos clientes y nuevas ventas, por lo que cada fin de semana él llega a las plazas de su lugar de habitación, para comercializar al ganado, esto le permite obtener ganancias extras. Santos solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más ganado, así mismo para comprar todo el alimento y vitaminas necesarias para la crianza optima de este y de esta mismo forma ofrecer un mejor producto.
texts.en:
Santos, 22, is a very hard-working and responsible young man who devotes himself entirely to his family’s well-being. He lives in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán, together with his wife, 20, who does household chores, and their three year-old daughter. Santos works buying and selling livestock, which he breeds in his home, located in the rural part of San Francisco Gotera. He learned this trade from his family, which is why he already has 7 years of experience. He is well-known in the area and trusted by many people who buy his livestock. Santos is a young man who strives to find new customers and make new sales. Every weekend he comes to people’s homes to market his livestock, thus earning extra income. Santos requests a loan as a means to buy more livestock and all of the feed and vitamins necessary for optimal breeding, allowing him to offer a better product.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Livestock and Feed

location.town: San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda C. is from the village of Victoria, Aurora, Isabela. She is 43 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting, harvesting & selling a variety of vegetables. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these kind of activity.

In 2009, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be Imelda’s 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for the tuition fees of her children. She really wanted to finish the studies of her children that's why she works hard and sacrifices a lot to gain more profits from her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rosa Belinda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Quiroga se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos.

Para la señora Rosa es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y está muy a gusto por los beneficios que ha recibido de la institución. Tiene 47 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 10 años, no pudo tener hijos pero crio a dos sobrinos como si fueran de ella,  uno de ellos vive con ella, su marido es albañil.

Se dedica a la compra y venta de maní, compra el producto en grano a los comerciantes en Calceta el mismo que traslada a su casa donde lo cocina y muele para después entregarlo  a su hermana que lo lleva a Santo Domingo donde lo entrega a clientes o tiendas del lugar, dice que allá su producto se vende a muy buen precio. Trabaja sola todos los días siete horas al día.  También cría animales de corral  que le dejan ganancias.

Este crédito es para comprar maní para tener reserva ya que se pone escaso y es muy caro.
 
Sus sueños son tener un carro y una lavadora de ropa para que le facilite sus labores del hogar.
texts.en:
The Quiroga Communal Bank meets in the Quiroga parish of the city of Calceta every 15 days.  This is a place where most of the people work in agriculture, raising animals, and selling their products.

Rosa is in her fourth cycle in the communal bank.  She is happy with the benefits she has received from the institution.  She is 47 years old, and she has been in a common-law marriage for ten years.  She was not able to have children, but she raised two nephews as if they were her own.  One of them lives with her.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

She buys and sells peanuts.  She buys them whole from merchants in Calceta.  She takes them to her house where she cooks and grinds them.  After that, she delivers the product to her sister to take to Santo Domingo.  Her sister delivers the product to customers or the stores there.  She says that her product sells there for a very good price.  She works alone seven hours everyday.  She also raises farm animals, and that produces income.

This loan is to buy peanuts to have in reserve because they are scarce and very expensive.

Her dream is to have a car and a washing machine to help with the housework.

loans.use: To buy peanuts

loans.name: Adiaratou

texts.fr:
Madame Adiaratou Samaké est une femme mariée de 32 ans et mère de 2 enfants qui vit  dans une famille monogame avec ses enfants chez son époux dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
Après des études secondaires sanctionnées par un diplôme d’enseignant, elle est restée pendant des années sans emploi. Ainsi elle décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et vente de pagnes. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de son ami. Avec une expérience de 4 ans elle maitrise son activité. 
Pour obtenir un fond de roulement consistant, elle décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des pagnes. 
Elle est à sa première expérience avec l’institution. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali). Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes. La vente se fait  d’une façon ambulante dans les différents quartiers  de la ville de Bougouni, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit payable mensuellement ou journalièrement.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000FCFA. Elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adiaratou Samaké is a 32 year old married woman. She is the mother of 2 children and lives in a monogamous family with her children and husband in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni.

After finishing her secondary studies with a teaching diploma, she remained unemployed during several years. She thus decided to start income-generating activities, notably buying and selling “pagnes” (traditional brightly-colored fabric). She learned this business alongside her friend. With 4 years of experience, she has a good command of her business. 

In order to have a substantial working capital, she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso to purchase “pagnes”. 

This is her first experience with the institution. She gets her supplies from Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). Her customer-base is mainly composed of women. She sells door-to-door in the different districts of the town of Bougouni, accepting cash and sometimes credit, payable monthly or daily.
She plans to make a monthly profit of 30,000 CFA Francs. She is considering expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase "pagnes" (traditional brightly-colored fabric)

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a young man of 26, married with two children aged 4 and 2 years old. He lives with his family of four people in Fort Portal, Uganda. He says he hopes to have a better standard of living in the future for his family. 

Patrick is in the transport business and has been in it for the last seven years starting right after school. This is Patrick’s first cycle loan from HOFOKAM and he intends to use the loan proceeds to buy a car for transport business for income generation.

loans.use: Buying a car for transport business

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school and one of whom dropped from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children. 

For over two years, she has been making and selling deep fried potatoes from her home. Her customers are neighbors, passersby and local students. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Saumu hopes to establish a restaurant in the future and sell different types of food. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase 20 litres of cooking oil, a bundle of wheat flour and a sack of charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 20 litres of cooking oil, a bundle of wheat flour and a sack of charcoal.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson, D. 55 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado D. su esposa Teresa D. 56 años y sus 5 hijos que son mayores y además ellos viven con sus respectivas familias; juntos se esfuerzan a diario por salir adelante. Este emprendedor hombre se desempeña como chofer D. una movilidad D. transporte público desD. hace 30 años, además ha trabajado como cobrador y, dice que le entretiene mucho su labor ya que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles educación. Durante todos estos años trabajó en diferentes empresas y en L. actualidad esta en el proceso D. alquiler y compra D. un vehiculo para lograr independizarse. Lo que no le gusta D. ser chofer es que muchas veces debe soportar el mal humor D. los pasajeros pues algunos son algo prepotentes, pero esta satisfecho pues trabaja solo un turno, desD. las 8 D. L. mañana hasta las  5 D. L. tarD. y obtiene regulares ganancias. Y como es un hombre con mucha expectativa para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda D. comestibles en su casa ya que quiere continuar progresando. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar con sus planes D. salir adelante. Nelson tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en L. compra D. materiales para refaccionar el piso D. su casa ya que quiere empezar con su anhelo que es instalar un negocio en ese lugar.
texts.en:
Nelson is 55 years old.  He lives in his own home with his wife Teresa who is 56 years old and his 5  grown-up children who also live with their respective families.  Together they work hard every day to get ahead in life.  This enterprising man has worked as a public transport driver for the past 30 years.  He has also worked as a conductor and he says that he likes his work a lot because it has allowed him to get his children ahead in life and give them an education.

Over the years, Nelson has worked for a number of different companies and he is currently in the process of renting and buying a vehicle so that he can become self employed.  What he doesn't like about being a driver is that many times he has to put up with his passengers' bad tempers since some of them are very overbearing.  However he is satisfied because he works only one shift from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon and he makes regular profits.

As Nelson is a man who has many hopes for the future, he is planning to set up a grocery store in his home as he would like to continue making progress.

This is the first loan which Nelson has had from MFP and he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner because he doesn't want to let down the people who are providing this support which will allow him to continue with his plans to get ahead.  Nelson plans to invest his loan in buying materials to refurbish his house since he would like to begin work on his wish to set up a business there.

loans.use: To refurbish his house so that he can create a sales establishment there

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a thirty-four-year-old married woman with three children, living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She dreams of owning a family residence in the next four years. She has been operating a drugstore for over three years, and this has helped her to pay school fees for her children,  although she lacks enough capital to buy drugs for sale. Jane intends to use the loan to buy drugs for sale.

loans.use: To stock drugs for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is the mother of three school-age children. She has been working as a private nurse for the past 10 years. She has obtained a previous Kiva loan to purchase a car in order to facilitate her business movements. And she is thankful for the results. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for her children's school fees. She works hard with her husband to be able to raise her children and she needs the loan to add to her savings to pay the school costs. Her dreams include seeing her family get ahead.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto, de 41 años, convive con Gladis (32)  y juntos tienen tres menores  hijos con los que habitan  su casa que es propia y esta ubicada en el distrito de Quimbiri.Alberto es muy entusiasta y  se levanta cada día muy temprano para empezar con la atención de  su tienda de abarrotes; además le gusta atender solo, y  se dificulta un poco cuando se acumulan sus compradores, es entonces cuando pide apoyo a su esposa o hijos. Su negocio esta ubicado en la zona céntrica de su distrito, en ese lugar trabaja hace 20 años y goza de su labor;  los días jueves no son de su agrado por que en esos días escasea de compradores y pasa la mayor parte del día practicando distintos deportes. Su tienda le resulta productiva porque la venta de su mercadería la realiza en su casa y se ahorra el gasto de alquilar un local; entre sus planes a futuro se encuentran comprar mayor cantidad de abarrotes para incrementar su tienda y así pueda abastecer bien a sus compradores.Es el  décimo  préstamo que tiene  con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, además en su banco comunal es un socio muy querido, ya que es muy fraterno y solidario.Alberto tiene planeado invertir los  dos mil soles solicitados en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería, con esto piensa  implementar mejor  su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en: Alberto, age 41, lives with Gladis (32). They have three young children together, and live in their own home in the Quimbiri district. Alberto is very enthusiastic and gets up very early every day to start working in his grocery store. He enjoys working alone, but finds it can be challenging when there are many customers at once--this is when he asks his wife or children to help out. His business is located in the central zone of the district. He has worked there for 20 years and loves his job. He does not like Thursdays because on these days there are no customers and he spends the better part of the day playing different sports. His store is very profitable because it is in his home and thus he saves the cost of renting a location. Among his other plans for the future, he plans to purchase a larger quantity of groceries to expand his store and satisfy his customers. This is his tenth loan with MFP, and he promises to pay the quotas punctually. In his community bank he is very well-liked, as he is very friendly and supportive. Alberto plans to invest the requested 2000 soles in the wholesale purchase of a large quantity of merchandise. With this, he hopes to better stock his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of food merchandise

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es:
la sra. Guadalupe del Carmen D. se dedica a la venta joyas de Oro de manera ambulante y es notable que durante este tiempo a sabido administrar su negocio, con los ingresos que le a generado el mismo a logrado terminarles sus estudios a sus hijas, mismas que ahora todas son profesionales y graduadas de carreras universitarias con licenciaturas en pedagogía.
ahora ya no tiene hijos a su cargo pero esto no a sido pretexto para no seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta hacer, ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la calidad y precios en que vende las joyas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de joyas como ser Cadenas, Esclavas, Anillos, Aritos, cadenas, pulseras y esclavas para dama y caballero.
texts.en:
Mrs. Guadalupe del Carmen D. sells gold jewelry on the street. It is clear that she knows how to run her business; with her income, she has been able to see her daughters through to the end of their studies. They are now professionals and graduates with university degrees in teaching.
She does not have children under her care anymore, but this has not been a reason to stop working in a business that she enjoys. Her customers prefer her for the quality and good prices she offers for jewelry.
She will use this loan for the purchase of jewelry such as chains, bangles, rings, hoops and bracelets for men and women.

loans.use: the purchase of chains, bracelets, hoops, rings, bangles.

loans.name: Srey Mai

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Mai S. is a widow with one child who is enrolled in local public school. She is living in a four-member household in Tadak Pong village, Takeo province, and she was born in 1977. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. Presently, she wants to buy a new motorbike to use, yet her savings are not sufficient to do so. So Mrs. Srey Mai S. is asking for a loan to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umasi is a married woman with six children, three of whom have graduated from school while three still attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She operates a cereal stall business, selling at retail prices to her local neighbors. Umasi faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan she wants to purchase sacks of peas, beans, rice and maize for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of peas, beans, rice and maize for sale.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana, tiene 52 años D. edad y tiene tres hijos, ella vive en la comunidad D. Tambo Real distrito D. Anta del departamento del Cusco. En la comunidad que Sebastiana en que vive la  gente se dedica a la agricutlura y ganadería desD. anteaños y se podría decir desD. niños. Sebastiana  no es la excepción pues ella se dedica a la venta D. leche y a la producción D. lácteos y sus derivados. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. Sebastiana en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumo para preparas más quesos. 

Sebastiana pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé D. Tambo Real” D. la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 52 years old and has three children.  She lives in the Tambo Real community in the Anta District, department of Cusco.  The people living in Sebastiana's community have been active in agriculture and livestock farming for a long time; one could even say since they were children.  Sebastiana is not an exception since she sells milk and makes dairy products.  She has been involved in this business for several years and has been successful at it because of her hard work.  Sebastiana is in need of a loan to buy ingredients to make more cheese.

She is a member of the "San Bartolomé D. Tambo Real" communal bank which belongs to the Arariwa Association.  She is grateful for this opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make more cheese

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby S. is from the village of Pag-asa, Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 33 years old, and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Ruby has a store selling used clothing and shoes. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ruby joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase additional t-shirts and blouses to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Ruby from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional t-shirts & blouses to sell

loans.name: Zoilo Adalberto

texts.es:
El Cliente Zoilo Adalberto R..   Vive en el municipio de el Sauce comarca la tejera del departamento león, tiene 2 hijo a su cargo trabaja actual mente en su propio negocio donde elabora ladrillo y lo vende al municipio de el Sauce.
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación su negocio de elaboración de ladrillo en toda la época del año. 
El destino del crédito es para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de ladrillo. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones el bien estar de su familia y obtener un mejor ingreso
texts.en:
Zoilo Adalberto R. lives in the town of Sauce, which is a brick-making area in the departtment of León.  He has two children in his care and works in his own business making bricks which he sells to the town of Sauce.

He owns his home and makes bricks all year long.  He plans to use the loan to buy raw materials for his business which will allow him to improve his family's living conditions with more income.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make bricks

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, reside en Alegría departamento de Usulután, vive en casa propia con su hijo de 6 años de edad y su madre de 48 años de edad; Ana se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal de Berlín, el horario de venta es de 6:00am a 6:00pm, tiene 5 años de experiencia. 
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de ropa en general como blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisas de vestir y deportivas, esta inversión ayudara a que Ana crezca en su comercio de prendas de vestir, mejorando la atención a los clientes y aumentando las posibilidades de tener ganancias que le permitan ofrecer a su familia una condición más estable.
Sus aspiraciones es crecer en el comercio, tener un negocio muy fuerte, en lo personal pues que su familia cuente con lo necesario y sobretodo que su hijo crezca sano.
texts.en:
Ana lives in Alegría, in Usulután department.  She lives in her own home together with her 6 year-old son and her 48 year-old mother.  Ana sells clothes and her business is located in Berlín town market.  She sells her products there from 6.00am to 6.00pm.  She has five years experience.

Ana needs a loan to buy clothes such as blouses, skirts, pants, dress shirts and casual shirts.  This investment will help her to grow her clothes business, improve her customer service and increase her possibilities of making enough profits to be able to offer her family more stable living conditions.

Ana's aspirations are to grow in her business and to strengthen her business.  On a personal level, she would like her family to have everything they need and, above all, for her son to grow up healthy.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, pants, dress shirts and casual shirts

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago padre de familia de 39 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en casa de sus padres; es propia y cuenta con servicio de agua y luz en el caserio de Chacupe bajo ubicado en el distrito de la Victoria y a la vez pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.
Santiago  se dedica a la actividad agrícola desde hace 10 años aproximadamente, este trabajo lo realiza en los terrenos de su padre, siembra camote de diferentes especies y una vez que se dé la cosecha los podrá vender en los diferentes mercados de su distrito para poder cubrir sus necesidades diarias.  Otra forma que recibe ingresos Santiago es mediante el alquiler de su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas).
El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1000 nuevos soles y su destino será para comprar más semilla de camote, para poder sembrar en su media hectárea de terreno que su padre le ha dado y así pueda incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Santiago es un hombre muy respetado y conocido en el caserío de Chacupe por ser trabajador, responsable y buen padre, con el único fin de que a su familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Santiago is the father of a family. He is 39 years old and he lives with his wife and their three children in his parents' house. He owns the house and he has running water and hydro sercies. It is located in the community of Chacupe Bajo found in the district of La Victoria of the province of Chiclayo. The population of this district are agriculturists and farmers.

Santiago has been an agriculturist for approximately 10 years. He carries out his work on his father's fields. He cultivates sweet potatoes of different varieties and once the harvest is ready he will be able to sell them at the different markets in the district. This will help him cover his daily needs. Santiago also has another source of income by renting his motorcycle rickshaw (a vehicle that he uses to provide transport in short distances, with a maximum of 3 passengers). 

The loan that he requests from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) is in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles and the funds will be used to purchase more sweet potato seeds. He will be able to cultivate the half hectare of land that his father has given him to increase his income and to improve his family's quality of life.

Santiago is a well respected man who is known in the community of Chacupe to be a hard worker, responsible and a good father. His only goal is to have his family not want for anything.

loans.use: to purchase more sweet potato seeds.

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg is a 27-year-old single woman. She lives with her parents and her only daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her parents are pensioners and they help by looking after her daughter, giving Battsetseg a chance to work full time. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Battsetseg runs a garment and underwear retail business. Once a month she travels to China to buy her products at wholesale price and resells them to customers. We see that her business is improving dramatically in recent years. 

In spring 2010, she started a building project for the family house. The house is half complete. The basement and walls are erected. This year, she is planning to complete the building project, but she lacks funding. Battsetseg is planning to build her house greener than ordinary houses. She wants to put foam insulation materials between the walls and roof, and also to install double glazed windows to make the house more insulated from the cold and wind. She is also planning to install an efficient central heating system in the house to save on heating costs. She says all these additional things will make the house warm, cost effective and green in terms of smoke emission. She is asking for a loan to buy necessary building materials and recruit a builder to complete her building project.

loans.use: to buy necessary building materials and recruit a builder to complete her building project

loans.name: Santos William

texts.en:
Santos, age 25, is a hard-working entrepreneur who has been selling fruits and vegetables in the market for the past five years. This family-owned business has been passed down through the generations, and Santos is now managing the operations. It is his dream to be able to buy some land and construct a modest home, and perhaps have a family someday.

Santos would like to use his loan funds to buy a harvest of avocados to offer for sale at market.

loans.use: to buy a harvest of avocados to offer for sale at market

loans.name: Luciola Doris

texts.es:
La señora Luciola es socia D. banco comunal Las Guerreas D. Distrito D. Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 54 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.
Cuenta con un taller D. costura bien implementado ya que requiere comodidad para poder trabajar, cuenta también con una señorita que es su ayudante.
Con este nuevo préstamo D. S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 nueva vitrina para poder sus telas porque la que tiene ya no alcanza, 1 espejo granD., 1 maniquí, 2 docenas D. gancho para ropa, 1 paquete D. bolsa granD. para cubrir algunas prendas.
Actualmente vive con su esposo, quien es chofer D. mototaxi (transportista) y una D. sus hijas.
Luciola nos cuenta que gracias a su negocio pueD. solventar algunos gastos D. los estudios D. su hija y también apoya económicamente a su esposo.
texts.en:
Luciola is a member of the "Las Guerreas" community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 54 years old, married, and has three children.

Luciola has a well-equipped sewing workshop since she needs comfort in order to be able to work.  She also has a young lady who works as her assistant.  Luciola will use this new loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy 1 new display case for her fabric because the one she has isn't enough, 1 large mirror, 1 dressmaker's dummy, 2 dozen clothes hangers and 1 packet of large bags to cover some of the items of clothes.

Luciola currently lives with her husband, who is a motorcycle taxi driver, and one of her daughters.  She tells us that, thanks to her business, she is able to cover some of her daughter's educational expenses and also financially support her husband.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet and a mirror

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, de 38 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Ignoly de 32 años y su querida hija Penny de 2 años, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. La fábrica de hielo de Pedro funciona en su casa, su hielo es distribuido a sus vecinos y a todas las tiendas de su barrio, los cuales son consumidos rápidamente debido al intenso calor que hace en la ciudad de Pucallpa. La mayoría de clientes ya saben que es Pedro el que hace el hielo y muchas veces le compran directamente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede utilizar todo el hielo que quiera, sin embargo el cambio de temperatura le puede hacer daño. Por ahora su propósito es crecer su negocio para tener más ingresos. Es el primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera la colaboración de todos para que pueda desarrollar su negocio. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más moldes para preparar su refrescante hielo.
texts.en:
Pedro, age 38, is a very unassuming and hard-working man.  He lives in his own house with his 32 year old wife, Ignoly, and his beloved 2 year old daughter, Penny.  Pedro wishes to offer them a better future.  

Pedro’s ice factory is in his house.  His ice is distributed to his neighbors and to all of the stores in his neighborhood.  The ice is consumed rapidly due to the intense heat in the city of Pucallpa.  Most of his customers know that it is Pedro who makes the ice, and many times they buy directly from him.

The thing he likes most about his work is being able to use all of the ice he wants.  However, the change in temperature could cause damage to the ice.  His current objective is to grow his business in order to have more income.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He therefore hopes for everyone’s collaboration in order to be able to develop his business.  He will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy more molds to prepare his refreshing ice.

loans.use: to buy more ice molds.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is age 36 and married, with three children between the ages of 2½ and 11. He has been farming for eight years, producing pineapples, tea, and milk, which are all sold locally. Farming has been his only source of income.

Daniel has made a loan request for 31,400 Kenyan shillings (KES) in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra proceeds from the sale of milk will enable him to pay school fees for his children and expand his farming activities. He faces the challenge of diseases that affect his production. In the future, he would like to increase the number of his dairy cows and buy two motorcycles, which will be used to transport his farm products to the markets.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 38-year-old married man and father of three children who works hard in his grocery store and improves his wholesale trade to fulfill their needs. Mohamad is a hardworking man with a good reputation in his area. He struggles to improve his family's social and financial situation. Mohamad is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a Renault rapid car, necessary to transport merchandise requested in his store and to sell wholesale products. Mohamad is planning to open other branches in nearby villages, and he is hoping to expand his business more and more.

loans.use: To buy a Renault rapid car

loans.name: Hilda Maria

texts.es:
La señorita Hilda Maria es soltera,  tiene 24 años de edad, ha cursado loes tres años de educación básica, se dedica a la tejeduría, a tejer cortes, perrajes, rebosos, sabanas, servilletas, etc. inició este trabajo gracias al apoyo de su señor padre y lleva 1 año de experiencia.

Decide solicitar a la institución un préstamo para comprar un telar más y más hilos ya que su negocio está creciendo, su sueño es que en el futuro su negocio sea súper y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Hilda María is single.  She’s 24 years old.  She’s completed three years of basic education.  She’s a weaver.  She knits fabric, baby slings, shawls, sheets, napkins, etc.  She started the business thanks to support from her father and she has one year’s experience in it.

She decides to request a loan from the institution to buy another loom and more yarn because her business is growing.  Her dream for the future is that her business is super with better profits.

loans.use: to buy a loom and yarn to weave.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is a resident of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a 59-year-old widow with 4 adult-aged children. Magdalina has owned and operated a retail store at home for the past 3 years. It was created to answer people's day-to-day consumption. Magdalina earns approximately PHP 7,000 monthly from business operations.

Magdalina became a GDMPC member in 2006. She has taken out loans from the cooperative twice and successfully repaid them. Magdalina is now requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase daily use merchandise to sell in order to earn more income. She hopes to sustain the store's revolving funds to prolong business operations. Magdalina is planning to renovate her house so she may have a better place to live in.

loans.use: To purchase more daily use merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Seyet

texts.en:
Seyet (in the photo) and her husband, Ly, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have two young children--one son and one daughter. 

Seyet is a weaver, and her husband is a car repairman. Seyet also buys additional silk products from other weavers in her village for resale. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk products for sale and repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: To purchase silk products for sale and repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Benita nació en la provincia de Paucartambo en la ciudad de Huancarani y tiene 40 años de edad, ella es divorciada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Actualmente, Benita vive en la  misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria muy cerca  a la plaza principal de la ciudad de Huancarani. Benita requiere el micro crédito para comprar insumos como bolsas de arroz, bolsas de azúcar, botella de aceite, verduras, carne y otras cosas más. 
 
El Banco Comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Benita was born in the Paucartambo province in the city of Huancarani.  She is 40 years old, divorced, and has four children.  Benita currently lives in the same city where she was born.  She conducts her business activities there; she sells food in an itinerant manner.  She sells very close to the main plaza in the city of Huancarani.

Benita needs the small loan to buy ingredients like bags of rice, bags of sugar, bottles of oil, vegetables, meat, and other things.

The “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” (Eleventh of May - Huancarani) Communal Bank meets once a month in Huancarani district, Paucartambo province,  Cusco (Peru) department.  Cusco  is known for being a tourist and business area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bags of rice, bags of sugar, bottles of oil, vegetables, meat, and other things.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel D. 57 años D. edad, habita en casa propia junto con su hija y su compañero D. vida Miguel D. 63 años edad el cual es jornalero. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. ricas tortillas. Tiene 9 años D. dedicarse a esta actividad  y gracias a Dios  y a su trabajo ha sabido mantener el negocio activo.  María es muy conocida en la zona y muchas personas confían en ella ya que es una mujer  responsable, trabajadora y sobre todo emprendedora.
