Su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su hogar D. residencia el cual está en una zona bastante segura y muy transitada por muchas personas. A pesar D. su edad no se da por vencida, tiene muchas energías y para élla el trabajo es vida. Ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en el negocio en la compra D. insumos como: maíz, leña, agua y cal. con el fin D. ofertar una mayor cantidad D. tortillas y poder cubrir una mayor demanda. Espera poder tener resultados positivos y mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
María Isabel, 57, lives in her own house with her daughter and common-law husband, Miguel, who is 63 and works as a wage-earner.  She makes and sells delicious tortillas, which she has been doing for nine years.  Thank God, and through her hard work, she has been able to keep her business active.

María is well-known in the area and many people trust her as a responsible, hard-working woman and they think of her mainly as an entrepreneur.  Her business is set up in her home which is in a safe area with many passersby.  Despite her age, she does not give up and has a lot of energy to keep on working, which she feels is vital.  She has decided to request a loan through INTEGRAL to invest in her business.  She plans to buy supplies such as corn, firewood, water and lime so she can increase production and meet demand.  She hopes to obtain positive results and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as corn, firewood, water and lime.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
 
Evangeline has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Evangeline is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Niyingabiye Group

texts.fr:
Daniel est un commerçant âgé de 62ans qui habite  la localité de Mugutu de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Il fait le commerce de la bière locale depuis 26ans. Il commence cette activité alors qu’il était encadreur agricole. Il a fait ses études jusqu’en 4e année primaire. Il est marié a Angèle et ont ensemble 5 enfants dont 3 étudient.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 120,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de bière locale à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« NIYINGABIYE»
texts.en:
Daniel is a 62-year-old merchant who lives in Mugutu, Gitega Province, in the center of the country. He's been selling locally made beer for 26 years. When he started this business, he was a farm supervisor.

He attended elementary school up to the fourth grade. He's married to Angèle, and together they have five children, out of whom three are studying.

He's seeking a loan of BFI 120'000 to bolster his working capital and purchase large quantities of local beer for resale, in order to turn a big profit.

He's a member of Niyingabiye Group.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of local beer for resale

loans.name: Apokori Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Apokori Group in Western Kenya!  Patrick is the facilitator of the Apokori group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Patrick takes care of 12 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Patrick had an excellent maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Patrick was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Patrick and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Patrick will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Apokori group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured with his group members in the picture.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Zuura's Group

texts.en:
Zuura is the leader of this group. She is 37 and resides in Alabuka, a small village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Five years ago, with an initial investment of 5000 soms, Zuura started to cultivate cotton. She purchased a good sort of seeds and got a good harvest. This year she grew 500kg of cotton. With money received from this loan she wants to purchase fuel, fertilizers and seeds for cultivating more cotton. In the near future Zuura also plans to start growing tobacco and potatoes.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel, fertilizers, and seeds

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is a 49-year-old modest lady from Kilgoris County in Kenya. She is married to Samuel and they have five children between 17 and 10 years. For the last 24 years, she has operated a business selling cereal in the Nkararo area of Kilgoris. With her vast business experience, Caren makes a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

Caren recently joined KADET LTD and is requesting her first loan to buy more maize cereal to sell. She will use the anticipated profit from her loan to reinvest in her business. Her hope is to expand her business and at the same be able to provide for the family.

loans.use: to buy cereal to sell

loans.name: Sunrise Group

texts.en:
Aaron is a 42-year-old man who is married with four children, ages 7 months, four, nine, and 11. Two of his children go to school. Aaron also looks after his parents who live with his family. For the past three years, he has been buying and selling cows and also selling airtime recharge cards. His wife helps him in his business and he operates it at Nyika Growth Point. Aaron's major business challenge is high market competition. 

Aaron is requesting a loan to buy more cows and airtime cards. In the future, he has a vision of owing an abattoir with specialists to grade and examine the meat. Aaron will use the profit from his loan to provide for his growing family.

loans.use: to buy cows and airtime recharge cards

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: El señor Hugo tiene su vehiculo el cual lo utiliza para brindar servicios de taxi. El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento completo de su vehiculo, pues lo necesita en buenas condiciones para seguir trabajando y generar ingresos para mantener a su familia. Hugo es casado y tiene dos hijos. Vive en casa en anticrético la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Bajo Seguencoma de la Ciudad de La Paz. Su historial de pagos el crédito anterior es muy bueno y hace que Hugo califique para este nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Hugo has a vehicle that he uses to provide taxi service.  He needs the loan to do a complete maintenance service on his vehicle because he needs it to be in good working order to continue working and generating income to support his family.  

Hugo is married and has two children.  He lives in a house in the anticrético modality [a transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you] that’s located in the city of La Paz’s Bajo Seguencoma zone.  His payment history on his previous loan is very good which makes him qualified for this new loan.

loans.use: to service his taxi.

loans.name: Gloria Ramona

texts.es:
Gloria Ramona tiene 53 años de edad, madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos entre 17 a 28 años de edad, vive en Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Doña Gloria se dedica a elaborar y vender comida desde hace 10 años, vende desayunos y almuerzos. Su puesto de venta esta ubicado en un local del centro de la comunidad al cual le dedica todo el día atendiendo a sus clientes.
Anteriormente vendía ropa y zapatos, pero surgió la oportunidad de vender comida y ha sido mejor.
Comenzó este negocio con sus propios esfuerzos, luego solicito financiamiento a ODEF, actualmente lleva 7 préstamos solicitados y este de 18,000 es para invertir en carnes, condimentos, refrescos y todos los insumos y materiales necesarios para elaborar los alimentos. Su plan es incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos que le ayuden a mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria Ramona, 53, is a single mother; she has four children whose ages range between 17 and 28 years.  She lives in Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Gloria has been making food to sell for ten years; she sells breakfasts and lunches.  Her food stand is located in a locale in the center of the community which she spends all day in tending to customers.  She used to sell clothes and shoes but the opportunity to sell food arose and it’s been better.

She started the business with her own efforts and then asked ODEF for financing.  To date, she’s had seven loan requests and this one in the amount of 18,000 will be used to buy meats, condiments, soft-drinks and all the ingredients and supplies needed to prepare the food.  Her plan is to increase sales and income which will help her improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy meat, soft-drinks, condiments and other ingredients needed for food preparation.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40  ans et en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à KABOILA II un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Elles sont à leur treizième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Sali fait le commerce d’oranges dans ce groupe de femmes DEMBAGNOUMA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  4 chargements de charrette d’âne en orange. Elle s’approvisionne dans les vergers des villages environnants de Sikasso et effectue ses ventes au  marché de Médine à Sikasso ville et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 52.500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.

loans.use: Pour acheter d’oranges

loans.name: Mwanzo Mpya S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Benendetta. She is 44 years old and a mother of 5 children. She is a member of Mwanzo mpya S.H.G which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015 and has benefited from savings mobilization, enterprise development and financial management training.
She is a shop keeper. She is borrowing a kiva loan to add stock to her shop by buying things like flour, sugar, milk, rice, cooking fat and other household items. She hopes this will meet her customer’s demands hence increasing her income. She will use the anticipated income to provide food for her family.
She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to add stock to her shop by buying things like flour, sugar, milk, rice, cooking fat and other household items hence more income to provide food for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Inventory, locally made crafts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Judy would like to buy a bale of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Maria Idalia

texts.en:
Maria idalia is 41 years old and is divorced with two children. She started a clothing sales business in her home town of Monterrey in order to pay for personal expenses and the education of her children. She started with a little merchandise and little by little she has increased her sales and clientele. It has not been easy for Maria to carry all of the responsibilities of ehr house but the love of her children makes it worth it.

Actually, Maria needs a loan of $475 to buy new merchandise to have new sales and new clients. Maria will repay this loan in 5 to 10 months. You can contribute to improving the living conditions of this family. Your help is a great blessing for them.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Idalia tiene 41 años de edad, es divorciada y es madre de dos hijos. Ella emprendió su negocio de venta de ropa en la ciudad de Monterrey, Nuevo León, de donde es originaria para sobrelleva sus gastos personales y los de la educación de sus hijos. Inicio con poca mercancía pero poco a poco ha ido incrementando sus ventas y sus clientes, no ha sido fácil para Maria cargar con todas las responsabilidades de su casa, pero el amor y el bienestar de sus hijos es su recompensa al esfuerzo.

Actualmente necesita un crédito por $ 475 dólares para compra de mercancía que le permita incrementar la variedad de su ropa así como sus ventas y pueda tener más y nuevos clientes, Maria se compromete a regresar este préstamo en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses. Tú puedes contribuir a mejorar las condiciones de vida de esta familia, tu apoyo será de gran bendición para ellos.

loans.use:
Purchase Merchandise

Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah K. is a 36-year-old woman who is married to a pastor and is blessed with six children. She lives in Mlolongo town, situated along the Nairobi-Mombasa Highway. Peninah started selling secondhand clothes in 1996 in a town known as Rongai in Kajiado District, but then her husband moved to Mlolongo town so she also had to move. She then settled in Mlolongo town where she has been operating her business ever since.

Peninah started her business with an initial capital of Ksh 3,000 (USD 45), which was a loan from her husband. Fortunately, she was able to settle the loan in good time from the high sales she made from her business. Due to the growing population within this town, the demand for her clothes is at the peak during the cold-weather season, when people buy warm clothing.

Being a pastor’s wife, Peninah also cares about the less fortunate members of her Gospel Tabernacle church, and she assists them in paying their rent and also gives them the clothes that are left over after her sales. This act is of great significance to her. Peninah’s clothes are always in demand because they are very reasonably priced; hence even people who earn less than $3 per day can afford to buy from her.

Due to the increased demand, Peninah is requesting a loan of $725. Peninah plans to increase the stock in her stall by purchasing 6 bales of secondhand clothes. Peninah also intends to employ two more people to assist her in the business.

loans.use: To purchase 6 bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Tauavae

texts.en: Tauavae I. is thirty five years old and has a child. She lives with her parents. She sells sugar cane and chips at a local school, as well as taro and bananas at a market. Tauavae only goes to the market three days a week, where she earns US$80 a day. Sometimes she sells chips and sugar cane five days a week. This is her family's only source of income, and Tauavae is grateful for the SPBD loans that have helped not only her business, but also her children’s schooling. She will use the current loan of US$700 to purchase chemicals, fertilizers, weed killers, plastic wrappings, and tools for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of chemicals, fertilizers, weed killers, plastic wrapping, and tools

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old. She is married and has two children. She is living in a rented house. She has a small sewing project in her house. She applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and some new fabric to make clothes to sell to the customers near her house. She wants to increase her income and save for a better life for her family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Gloria De Los Milagr

texts.es:
Gloria is 40 years old and studied tailoring in school. She has 2 children who are dependent on her. They live in the spa town of Las Delicias in the Trujillo district. Gloria sells beauty products, and also makes clothing by request. In addition, in her house she has set up a shop where she offers small quantities of grocery items, sweets, bread and eggs. She began her clothing business because she studied tailoring, but the majority of people preferred ready made clothing, so she left that work and took a job as a worker in an asparagus factory. When she became pregnant she had to leave her work, but with her small savings she was able to set up her little shop, and later, she took advantage of the opportunity to sell beauty products.

With the first loan she received through the group called Mientras Tanto, Siempre Unidas (always united), she purchased milk and oil to stock her new business. With this new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy fabric and other materials to create party dresses as she has requests for an upcoming children's party. She will also use some of the loan to purchase eggs, rice, oil, and other items she needs to stock up on.

La señora Gloria de Los Milagros tiene 40 años de edad, estudiÓ una carrera técnica y tiene 2 hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el balneario de Las Delicias en el Distrito de Moche de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y a la confección de ropa según pedidos, además en su casa a instalado una pequeña bodega en donde ofrece, en pequeñas cantidades, abarrotes, golosinas, pan y huevos. Inició su negocio confeccionando ropa porque estudió corte y confección pero como la mayoría de gente ahora prefiere comprar ropa confeccionada dejó de hacerlo y buscó trabajo como obrera en una fábrica envasadora de espárragos: quedó embarazada y tuvo que dejar el trabajo, con lo poco que pudo ahorrar implementó una pequeña bodega y luego se le presentó la oportunidad de vender productos de belleza. Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 que recibió en su Grupo Mientras Tanto “Siempre Unidas” compró leche y aceite para surtir más su bodega. Con este préstamo de S/.1,200.00 que pagará en cuatro meses, comprará telas y otros materiales para confeccionar vestidos de fiesta porque tiene pedidos para una fiesta de promoción de niñas pequeñas y también invertirá una parte en comprar huevos, arroz, aceite que hacen falta en su bodega.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FABRIC TO MAKE CLOTHING,  AS WELL AS PURCHASE ITEMS SUCH AS RICE AND EGGS TO STOCK HER SMALL SHOP.

loans.name: Kadith

texts.es:
Kadith sells bread and other basic goods in store in Lamas, San Martín, Perú. She started her business with hopes of increasing her income, given that she is a single mother supporting her little son.

She is 33 years old and lives with her son, who gives her the energy and motivation to confront life's adversities. Her dream is to have a "Minimarket" to offer a wide variety of products to her clientele.

With her six month, US $625 loan, Kadith will buy large wooden scaffolding and a scale for her store, and stock up on soft drinks, snacks, boxed milk and sugar.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Kadith vive en la región de San Martín, provincia y distrito de Lamas. El negocio está ubicado en el Jr. Manco Cápac 145 y se dedica a la venta de pan y otros productos de primera necesidad. Ella emprendió este negocio con la finalidad de tener mayores ingresos, puesto que es madre soltera y tiene que apoyar a su pequeño hijo. Con el préstamo de S/.1,800.00, el cual pagará en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará andamios grandes de madera, una balanza, gaseosas en paquetes, galletas, golosinas, leche en cajas y azúcar en sacos, para ofrecer a su clientela. La señora Kadith tiene 33 años, vive con su hijo, quien es el motor que le da fuerzas para enfrentar las adversidades que se le presenta la vida. Su sueño es tener un Minimarket para ofrecer los más variados productos a su distinguida clientela.

loans.use: To buy assets (scaffolding and a scale) and dry goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Thân, 51, lives in Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An with her husband and 3 children. She is a 4th year TYM member. Her main occupation is raising piglets and calves. Each year she sells 3-4 batches of pigs, each batch brings her 500-600 USD. She also raises calves until they mature and sells for a good profit. Her husband works in the rice filed and helps her out whenever he has free time. 1 of their children still goes to school. Their family income is 150 USD a month. Mrs Thân is requesting a loan of 525 USD to buy piglets and mash.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thân, 51 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Chị là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Hoạt động chủ yếu của chị Thân là chăn nuôi các loại gia súc như: lợn, bò. Một năm chị bán từ 3 đến 4 lứa lợn, mỗi lứa cho thu nhập 500-600USD. Ngoài ra chị mua bê chăm cho đến khi được giá sẽ bán. Chồng chị ngoài thời gian làm việc đồng áng cũng phụ giúp vợ tích cực trong việc chăn nuôi. Hai anh chị có 1 cháu còn đang đi học. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình 150USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị Thân xin vay 525USD để mua lợn con và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy piglets and mash.

loans.name: Teresia's Group

texts.en:
Teresia N., Amina S., and Zainabu S. are all residents of Tabata. They all run shops selling cosmetics in the Tabata municipal market. They have had their businesses for six years.

Teresia, the group leader, also sells soft drinks alongside the cosmetics business. They are requesting a loan to help them expand their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
Marhabo A. is a resident of Vahdat. She is married and has 3 children. She is 44 years old and has secondary education. She has been in the business of selling children's clothing for the past 13 years. Her husband is a construction worker, which is a seasonal job. For this reason, she can only rely on herself. Her children are currently in school. Marhabo wants to increase the assortment of her inventory. To do that, she wants to get a loan. With help of credit, she will be able to purchase more goods. Marhabo, having an extensive experience, knows that the more quality merchandise she has, the better are her sales. She plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Аюбова Мархабо жительница города Вахдат. Мархабо замужем имеет 3 детей. Ей 44 года, образование среднее. Мархабо торгует на центральном рынке города Вахдат детской одеждой. Торговлей клиентка занимается 13 лет. Муж клиентки строитель, работа сезонная . Поэтому полагаться ей приходиться только на себя. Дети Мархабо еще только учатся . Клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент торговой точки. Для этого она хочет получить кредит. Получив кредит ,она сможет завести новый товар . Мархабо,имея хороший опыт в торговли,точно знает чем больше хорошего,качественного товара,тем лучшет торговля.Клиентка планирует погасить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en: Aminu H. is a 40-year-old businessman. He is a husband and the father of 6 children who are currently in school. He is a retailer of beef in the local market. He buys his supplies from Techiman, which is about 50 km away, and sells to his customers. Beef is enjoyed by many Ghanaian homes because the flavour is good and it is quite affordable. With his small working capital, he is not able to buy larger quantities to make enough income. He wants to use the loan to buy beef in bulk to serve his customers with good quality beef for their meals. He believes this will provide him with increased income to expand his business and also to finance his children’s education. He belongs to the community group called Butchers Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy beef in bulk to serve his customers

loans.name: Rosa Adela

texts.es:
Rosa lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood of Managua, where she operates a small business selling clothes. She also sells clothes door-to-door to her neighbors. She has been running this business for 5 years, during which time she has had to fight to keep her business going and to get ahead.

Rosa is married and has four children. Two of them are grown and she is raising the other two. Rosa needs a loan to build a wooden door and windows in her house in order to to complete her long-term home building project.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

D. Rosa habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación de Managua, en donde tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, el que también realiza de forma ambulante entre sus vecinos. Tiene 5 años de tener este negocio tiempo en el cual ha tenido que luchar mucho para poder mantenerlo y lograr salir adelante.

D. Rosa está casada tiene 4 hijos, solamente dos de ellos se encuentran a su cargo, sus otros dos hijos son independientes a ella. Requiere del préstamo para construir una puerta y ventanas de madera en su casa de habitación para así continuar el proyecto que desde hace años atrás ha venido haciendo que es el de terminar de construir su casa por completo.

loans.use: Purchase two wooden doors and windows

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Jamila S.. She is married and has three children.

In 2002, Jamila established her tailoring business. She is assisted by her husband and one employee. Jamila has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase an additional sewing machine, as well as cloth and thread. In the future, Jamila plans to to increase the quantity and range of the stocks such as cloth, thread, etc.. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sewing machine, cloth and thread.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana is a woman who dedicates herself to selling foods like baked good, coffee and snacks at a post in the Israel Lewites market in the city of Managua. Since she started her business with few products, she has been able to make do and at times has been the means of support for her household. Over time she has been able to increase her selection and has improved her quality of life thanks to the support of loans from Kiva partner Ceprodel. Once again she is requesting a loan to purchase her products. She is very confident that her request will be fulfilled and she will be able to continue providing for her household.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

La señora Ana Cecilaia P. es una dama que se dedica al negocio de venta de comestibles como reposterias, café y golosinas estando ubicada en el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua.

Desde que inició su negocio con pocos productos ha logrado mantenerse y a la vez ha sido el sustento de su hogar de habitacion. Hoy en dia a medida que el tiempo ha transcurrido ha aumentado su mercaderia y ha mejorado su nivel de vida gracias al poyo brindado por Ceprodel opr medio de los creditos que se le han birndado. Una vez mas solicita el credito para la compra de sus productos, ella está muy confiada que su credito le será otorgado y asi continuara con el mantenimiento de su hogar de habitacion.

loans.use: Purchase products for her business / Compra de los productos

loans.name: Mahmatqul

texts.ru: Ятимов Махматкул фермер со стажем. Уже 18 лет занимается животноводством. Откармливает молодых бычков для продажи на мясо. Кроме того имеет корову , которая дает молоко. Молоко использует для производства кисло-молочных продуктов. Продукцию реализует оптом на рынке. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить еще одного бычка. Это увеличит товарооборот и принесет доход для семьи и развития бизнеса. Махматкул женат и имеет восьмерых детей. Она помогают ему ухаживать за животными. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahmatqul Y. is an experienced farmer, who has raised cattle for 18 years. He fattens young steers to sell for meat. In addition he has a cow that provides milk used for the production of cultured milk products to be sold wholesale. Mahmatqul wishes to take out a loan for the purchase of an additional bull. This will increase his turnover, expanding his business and providing income for his family. Mahmatqul is married and has eight children. His wife assists him in caring for the animals. He will be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.en:
B. Naimjon is 30 years old. He lives in the Spitamen region and is married. Mr. B. Naimjon is a very hard-working man with a good reputation among neighbors and colleagues. Mr. B. Naimjon has a livestock business, also selling onions and rices through his life. He works also as semiskilled worker.

Mr. B. Naimjon has applied for a KIVA loan for the business development. He's asking for a loan of 2800 STJ for 4 months for livestock business support. He wants to buy rams, to permit him in the future to open a new business in wool manufacturing. He thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all the best.

loans.use: livestock business support

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin tiene 22 años, es soltero y vive en la casa con su madre y hermanos. Gracias al apoyo de su madre trabaja actualmente en la venta de aceites, aceitunas y mermeladas, actividad que realiza desde hace 1 año para poder solventar sus gastos, así como para ayudar en su hogar. En el año que lleva trabajando en esta actividad ha podido observar que  el negocio da buenas ganancias, dándole ánimos para seguir adelante y obtener mayor capital. A Edwin no se le hace complicado realizar su trabajo, ya que cada vez se va haciendo más diestro a la hora de comercializar sus productos.  Es su 1er préstamo solicitado en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero comprará más aceite y así poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Edwin is 22 years old, single, and lives in the house with his mother and brothers. Thanks to his mother’s support, he currently works selling oils, olives, and marmalades. He has undertaken this activity for the past year, in order to meet his expenses and also to help out the household financially. In the year that he has been working in this enterprise he has been able to observe that the business provides good income, which has animated him to forge ahead and obtain more capital. For Edwin, it has not been difficult to realize this work since over time he has become more skilled at selling his products. This is the first loan he is requesting with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the funds, he will buy more oil which will allow him to increase his sales.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity of oil to sell.

loans.name: Oghogho

texts.en: Oghogho O. is a 53-year-old widow with 3 children, who are all university students. She sells foodstuffs and firewood in her community. She is requesting this loan to purchase more firewood and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and firewood to sell

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es: Lizbeth tiene 35 años, es madre de 3 hijos en edad escolar, además, vive con su conviviente quien está de acuerdo con sus objetivos. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida en las afueras de su casa por las noches, lo viene haciendo desde hace 3 años, negocio con el cual está sacando adelante a sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es preparar bien su comida y que esté al gusto de sus clientes para que los mismos se sientas satisfechos. Le es rentable, ya que cuenta con muchos clientes fieles, además se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona. Es su 6to préstamo con MFP, y es una clienta puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir su kiosco para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is a 35-year-old mother of three school aged children who lives with her partner, who supports her in her endeavors. Her business is selling food in the evenings from outside of her home, which she has been doing for the past three years and has been helping to support her children. She enjoys preparing the food to her clients' tastes so they come away satisfied. She makes a good profit as she has a loyal client following and she is well-situated. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she has a punctual payment history. With the requested funds she will have a kiosk built from which to better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a food-selling kiosk

loans.name: Nak

texts.en:
Mrs. Nak P. is a villager in Tompong village in Kampong Speu province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Tem Vibol, sells firewood that he has bought from the other villages to resell. 

Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Nak P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more firewood for her husband's business. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. 

She is 28 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her husband's business.

loans.name: Maria Leonarda

texts.en:
Maria Leonardo is a 44-year-old woman. Her business is making and selling tortillas in her house. She sells the tortillas in the morning, afternoon, and in the evening. She also spends her time making hand-made napkins. She has seven children, two of whom are teachers and the rest are still in school. Her husband delivers construction materials and his income helps to pay for the education of their children.

Maria Leonardo needs a loan in order to buy the tortilla ingredients in bulk. This time of year she can buy things like corn and firewood at a much better price. 

Her dream is to increase her income and that her younger children can finish their education. 


***********************************************

Maria Leonardo es una mujer de 44 años de edad.  Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de tortilla en su casa.  Las tortillas se venden por las mañanas, al medio día  y por las tardes.  También ocupa su tiempo en la elaboración de tejidos a mano, para servilletas.  Ella tiene 7 hijos, 2 de ellos son maestros de educación, los demás están estudiando todavía.  Su esposo trabaja en la entrega de materiales de construcción y él le ayuda a pagar la educación de los hijos.
Maria Leonarda necesita el préstamo para comprar por volumen y a mejor precio los materiales para las tortillas, como lo son maíz y leña, ya que en esta época del año las puede comprar a mejor precio.
Su sueño es mejorar sus ingresos y que sus hijos pequeños terminen su educación.

loans.use: Bulk purchase of ingredients to make tortillas

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
ELSA P. O., Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” con domicilio en el Jr. 7 de junio esquina con el Jr. Ruperto Pérez, del distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 57 años, 09 hijos, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo como conductor de motocarro.

Obtuvo su primer préstamo rápidamente de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con lo cual compró una parrilla, pollo, arroz e inicio un pequeño negocio en el rubro de comidas típicas, en las tardes y noches. Con el tiempo fue creciendo, actualmente tiene ya muchos clientes en su local ambientado en su casa, y ha visto por conveniente ampliar su negocio. Para ello ha programado hacer sus compras al por mayor, ya que se ahorra al comprar en cantidad y tiene su materia prima en stock.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, comprará al por mayor: arroz, azúcar, maíz, carbón, e insumos usados en la elaboración de sus platos.

Dice de la ONG. Manuela Ramos: “el apoyo es bastante efectivo, la ha ayudado a sustentar los gastos de su familia y gracias a los créditos ha podido salir adelante con su negocio”.
texts.en:
Elsa P. O. belongs to the Nuevo Eden community bank in Yarinacocha. She is 57 years old and has 9 children. Her partner works as a mototaxi driver. She received her first loan of S/.300 new soles which she used to buy a grill, chicken and rice, supplies that she used to start a small business selling traditional food dishes, afternoons and evenings. Over time, it grew and now she has many customers in her shop which is located in her house and which she's had to expand. She arranges to buy wholesale supplies of products because you can save by buying in bulk and having stock on hand. With this S/.1,000 new-soles loan, she will buy wholesale supplies of rice, sugar, maize, fuel and other supplies used to prepare her food dishes. About the NGO, Manuela Ramos, she says "the support is highly effective, having helped to pay family expenses. Thanks to the loans, I've been able to push the business ahead."

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies for food business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Since 2006, Rebecca H. has sold phone card units in the Cape Coast area. She is married with 2 children and received an education through vocational school. While Rebecca is selling her wares, her husband is employed at the University of Cape Coast.

Rebecca uses her income to pay for rent, utilities, food, and her children’s school fees. Rebecca will use the loan to purchase more phone card units in order to expand her business. With her newly gained capital, Rebecca plans to put up a building where she and her family can live.

loans.use: purchase more phone card units

loans.name: Pura

texts.es: La señora Pura, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en Jr. Apolonia Nº 474 - Caserío de El Porvenir, del  Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 35 años y 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen de ella.Se inicio con un capital de S/. 500.00 junto a su esposo emprendieron su negocio de fabricación y venta de ladrillos quemados.  En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio que ofrece a las instituciones publicas y privadas que son sus principales Tiene 04 años trabajando con el Banco.Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 que cancelara en 06 meses, lo invertirá comprando leña en tercios en cantidades y galones de petróleo para quemar los ladrillos igualmente  moldes de acero para la fabricación en serie del producto. Se siente orgullosa de aportar económicamente al ingreso familiar y verse realizada como mujer y como empresaria. Pura, esta feliz por el gran apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos, gracias a la ONG salio adelante y en su negocio le esta yendo muy bien.
texts.en:
Pura belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario" communal bank. She lives in the El Porvenir settlement, Bellavista District, San Martin Department. She has a life partner, is 35 years old, and has two children, both of whom are still dependent on her. She and her husband began with an initial loan of 500 soles which they used to begin a business consisting in the manufacture and sale of bricks. She currently is involved in the same activity and offers her product to public and private institutions which are her main customers. She has been working with the bank for 4 years. This 3000 sol loan, which will be repaid in 6 monthly installments, will be used to buy wood and oil used in the firing of the bricks as well as steel molds used to mass produce the bricks. She feels proud to be able to contribute to the economic well-being of her family and to see herself develop as a woman and as a businesswoman. Pura is happy for the great help that Manuela Ramos gives her since it is thanks to the NGO that she has been able to get ahead in her business and is doing very well.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood and gallons of oil.

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
Trương Thị T. (20203050001) is a 52 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Trương is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by DINARI.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách 01 (1).


Trương is married and has 3 adult-aged children.  To making a living, Trương is starting a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale.  Trương has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1300.000 IDR a month from these activities.


Trương joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Trương is requesting for the first time a loan from DINARI.  She is requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 IDR which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI.  Trương plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050002) is a 41 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 IDR loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Nguyễn Thị V. (20203050003) is a 51 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 IDR loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Trương Thị V. (20203050004) is a 40 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 IDR loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050005) is a 51 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 IDR loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Trương Thị T. (20203050001) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Trương là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách 01 (1).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  Trương thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Trương kiếm được khoảng 1,300 IDR.  Trương đã tham gia DINARI để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Trương đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ DINARI.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 IDR.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ DINARI.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050002) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị V. (20203050003) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Trương Thị V. (20203050004) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20203050005) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về DINARI:

Nhiệm vụ của DINARI là cố gắng giữ giàn một môi trường cho phép người nghèo và tạo cơ hội phát triển kinh tế xã hội cho những chủ doanh nghiệp nhỏ.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort K., 28, a married mother of three children who are in school, has been hawking washing detergents such as Unilever washing powder, soaps, bleaches etc. for a year now. She balances her stock on her head and walks miles to her customers' doorsteps to sell her products and is requesting this loan to inject more capital into the business so it can grow. Comfort plans to use the loan to increase her stock of detergent supplies in order to earn more income to provide her children with a good education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Prosperity’.

loans.use: To buy more detergent supplies for her business.

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Ngoné D., 41ans est mariée avec 03 enfants et 02 autres membres de sa famille en charge. Elle s’active dans la vente de jus de fruits et de glaces Ce prêt va lui permettre d’acheter pain de singe (fruit du baobab), lait, bissap, sucre, sachets, de préparer les jus et vendre pou mieux assurer la prise en charge familiale;
texts.en:
Ngoné D., age 41, is married and has three children plus two other family members to support. She is active in selling fruit juices and ice cream. This loan is going to enable her to buy “monkey bread” (the fruit of the baobab tree), milk, dried hibiscus flowers, sugar, and bags for making juice drinks to sell, in order to provide for her family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell fruit juices and ice cream

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
"We are a farmer since we are just small kids. My husband and I came from a farmer clan. From a very young age, we already familiar the kind of life growing rice and other crops to be able to provide food in the family" says Judith R., 42-year-old mother of four children.

Knowing the services of Community Economic Ventures, she never hesitated to apply for a loan worth Php 12,000. She will use the loan to purchase hybrid seeds, fertilizers and other farming needs. The loan will help her increase their harvest and income as well. 

She chose CEVI because of the easy credit access, training and insurance coverage that they offer to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds, fertilizer and other farming needs.

loans.name: Reyes Antonio

texts.es:
El Joven Reyes Antonio A. tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada, el negocio lo atienden el y su mama la señora María Magdalena R..
Al negocio le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía pero en esté momento no cuanta con el capital necesario para invertir, es por eso que está solicitando una préstamo para poder comprar la mercancía que le están ofreciendo a un buen preció.
Reyes también es empleada de una farmacia y con las ganancias de negocio desea pagar el crédito.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora María Magdalena quien en ese momento atendía el negocio porque Reyes Antonio se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Reyes Antonio A. has been selling used clothes for over three years. He and his mother, María Magdalena R., tend the business. The business is in need of a greater variety of merchandise. At this time, he does not have the necessary capital to invest. That is why he is asking for a loan to be able to buy the merchandise that they are offering at a good price. Reyes is also an employee of a pharmacy. He wants to pay the loan with the earnings from the business. The woman in the photograph is María Magdalena. At the time the photograph was taken she was tending the store because Reyes Antonio was at work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for the business

loans.name: Komadia 4 De  Sogola Group

texts.fr:
Au nombre de 7 femmes, le groupe KOMADIA 4 est composé de paysannes mariées qui ont en moyenne  32 ans,  4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, enfants et époux dans le village de SOGOLA, commune urbaine de BOUGOUNI, région de SIKASSO, république du Mali. 
A travers des liens de mariage ces femmes se sont connues. 
Dans l’intention d’augmenter leur productivité agricole, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt agricole et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt ces femmes comptent payer les frais de labour, acheter, des semences  et 4 sacs d’engrais (uniquement de l’urée) pour 3 hectares d’arachide et 4 hectares de haricot. L’engrais sera acheté auprès des commerçants de BOUGOUNI. La production totale attendue par le groupe est estimée à 2,250 tonnes d’arachide graine et 1,600 tonnes de haricot. Une partie de cette production sera utilisée pour la consommation familiale et l’autre partie sera vendue en gros et au comptant aux commerçants de BOUGOUNI. 
Le groupe compte obtenir un bénéfice global de 125 000 FCFA en fin de campagne qui sera utilisé pour soutenir les époux à subvenir aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Composed of 7 women, the Komadia 4 group is made up of married farm women who have an average age of 32 and on average 4 children. They all live in traditional extended conjugal families with their brothers, sisters, children and husbands in the village of Sogola, township of Bougouni, Sikasso region, Republic of Mali. They met because of being related by marriage.

With the intention of increasing their agricultural output, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their fifth rural loan after having reimbursed the preceding ones correctly.

With this loan these women intend to pay for plowing and buy seeds and 4 sacks of fertilizer (urea only) in order to grow 3 hectares of peanuts and 4 hectares of beans. The fertilizer will be bought from the merchants of Bougouni. The total production expected by the group is estimated at 2.250 tons of shelled peanuts and 1.600 tons of beans. Part of this production will be consumed by their families and the rest will be sold wholesale and for cash to the business people of Bougouni.

The group expects to have a total profit of 125,000 F CFA at the end of the growing season, which will be used to help their husbands support their families.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying seeds and inputs and paying for plowing

loans.name: Ademola

texts.en: Ademola is 45 years old and married with three children. He is a printer and has a small printing machine for his printing business. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more printing materials. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more printing materials

loans.name: Wenna

texts.en: Wenna C. lives in Mandih Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 40 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari sari store. Wenna has been in this business for more than three years. In 2009, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services that can help improve her life and her ability to take advantage of business opportunities. This will be her first loan, and she will use it to improve her store. She dreams of a earning enough money to provide for a better life in the future.

loans.use: To improve a sari- sari store

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva tiene 32 años, vive con sus 2 hijos y su madre en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas y desde hace 15 años trabaja de manera independiente. Todos los días cuida de su vaca y de sus cultivos, principalmente siembra maíz, papa, arveja y zanahorias. Una vez llegada la temporada de la cosecha, lleva a vender sus productos al principal mercado de la ciudad más cercana a su comunidad. Para Eva, realizar estas tareas es muy sacrificante y a la vez que le proporcionan el sustento diario. Por tal motivo desea continuar trabajando e incrementar su producción agrícola para mejorara sus ingresos económicos.
Esta es la sexta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona perseverante  y decidida a consolidar el banco comunal que integra. El dinero que solicita será invertido en la compra de abono para su siembra de maíz.
texts.en:
Eva is 32 years old and lives at home with her 2 children and her mother. Since childhood, she has been involved in farming and now has worked independently for the past 15 years. Every day she looks after her cows and the crops she has planted -- primarily corn, potatoes, peas and carrots. When the harvest season arrives, she sells her products at the main market in the city that is closest to her community. For Eva, performing these tasks is a great sacrifice and a means of providing daily sustenance. For this reason, she is motivated to continue working and increasing her farming output so that she can improve her financial situation.

This is Eva’s sixth loan with MFP. She is a persistent and determined member who contributes to the strength of her Communal Bank. The money she is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers for her next crop of corn.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: comprará productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, etc.

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es: La señora Juana Rosa M. H., tiene la edad de 49 años, habita en La Concepción, junto su esposo el cual es responsable de una iglesia cristiana y recibe ayuda de la misma , lo cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , doña Juana desde hace quince años se dedica al comercio , pero las ganancias no le permite comprar de una solo vez materiales de construcción , agradece a la institución por su buena aprobación de su primer crédito , a la vez esta contenta por la confianza y los intereses bajos los cuales benefician a todas las familias logrando una mejor comodidad y seguridad para su familia. con este crédito comprara piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzar hacer las mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Rosa M. H. is 49 years old and lives in La Concepción. Her husband is in charge of a Christian church. They also receive support from the church to cover their household expenses. Doña Juana has been a merchant for 15 years, but her earnings are not enough to cover a one-time purchase of construction materials. She thanks the Institution for approving her first loan. Doña Juana is happy they have confidence in her and for providing low interest rates that benefit all families. She will be able to provide more comfortable and secure conditions for her family. The loan will be used to buy stone, sand, cement, and iron so that she can begin making improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials such as stone, sand, cement, and iron

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es: María Esther es una mujer  dinámica, vive en la ciudad de pucallpa, distrito de Calleria región de Ucayali, tiene 34 años, es madre de un hijo mayor de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, chupetes, hielos. Su esposo es profesor. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Flor de la Canela II” desde hace dos años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que le permitió invertir en gaseosas, ahora María necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, que será utilizado para invertir una parte en bebidas y otra parte invertirá en comprar pollos. La meta de María es llegar a tener una bodega bien surtida.
texts.en:
María Esther is a dynamic woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Calleria District, Ucayali Region. She is 34 years old and the mother of a teenaged child. María sells sodas, lollipops, and ice. Her husband works as a teacher.

She became a member of the Communal Bank “Flor de la Canela II” two years ago. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy sodas. María is now requesting a loan of 1200 soles. Part of the loan will be used to purchase beverages while the remainder will be used to buy chickens. Her goal is to open a grocery store that is well-stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks & chickens

loans.name: Genesis 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Lucrecia is the coordinator of her group, Genesis, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Santiago, the Dominican Republic's second largest city, which is known for its production of cattle, tobacco and coffee, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-time partner and their three children.

Lucrecia is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of vending traditional food made with yucca, beans, rice and chicken. She will use the profits to continue to grow her business and invest in her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, chicken and yucca to cook and sell

loans.name: Honorata's Group

texts.en:
Honorata F., age 57, is married. She has 8 children and 9 grandchildren. Honorata has operated a chicken farm since 2005 and she just opened a grocery store. She works every day  from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. She is able to make a monthly profit of around $260.

This will be Honorata’s 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used h previous loans to increase the size of her chicken farm, and repaid her loans successfully. She hopes to get a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania increase her stock even more and provide capital for her grocery shop.
	
Honorata will share this loan with her loan group, Green Tomalin, which has 16 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Honorata is at the centre front of the picture wearing a dark blue and light green dress.

loans.use: Stock for a grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics and other items

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 49 years old and is married with four children. She lives and works in Benin City, Edo State. Her husband is an accountant.

Gladys is a friendly woman. She sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers and with these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her immediate family members. She hopes to own a world-class supermarket in the future.

Gladys needs a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Noely

texts.es:
Noely, de 21 años, es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Todas las mañanas, junto a su inseparable carretilla, vende su delicioso queso helado (helado hecho a base de leche batida). En los alrededores del mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca) es donde encuentra a sus clientes, quienes conocedores del delicioso producto que vende no dudan en esperarla para saborear el delicioso postre.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su negocio es conversar con sus clientes mientras realiza sus ventas, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es caminar por las calles de la ciudad bajo el inclemente sol del medio día. 
Para el futuro, anhela instalar una tienda donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad su producto.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Noely con MFP, está muy feliz de haberlo obtenido y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para elaborar su sabroso queso helado.
texts.en:
Noely, age 21, is a very cheerful and hard-working young woman. She lives in a house which she inherited from her parents, and what she wants most is to improve her quality of life. Every morning, with the pushcart from which she is inseparable, she sells her delicious ice cream (called "queso helado" but prepared with whipped milk, not cheese). The area around the San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca) is where she finds her customers. Those who know the delicious product she sells are happy to wait for her in order to enjoy this tasty treat. What Noely likes most about her business is having conversations with her customers while she carries out her sales. She has done this work for 4 years, and she thinks the hardest part is walking through the city streets under the uncomfortable midday sun. For the future, she dreams of setting up a store where she can sell her product with greater tranquility. This is Noely's second loan with MFP; she is very happy to have obtained it, and she plans to make her payments on time. In her communal bank, she is a very well-liked member because of the responsibility she demonstrates. With the 1000 Peruvian new soles she is requesting, she will buy more ingredients for preparing her delicious "queso helado" ice cream.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients to make ice cream

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena L., 61, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. A widow blessed with two children, she makes sure that she earns well so that the family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for 10 years now.

Magdalena has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for four years now, regularly attending their weekly fellowship meetings and paying her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has so far been able to borrow 12 times in CCT’s Cooperative, using the money to expand and improve her variety store.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 20,000 loan to be used as a source of additional capital for expanding her business by buying stocks to replenish her products. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her family’s daily needs and enjoy a healthy life with them. She also wants to have her own stall where she can sell additional products.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy stocks to replenish her products for her business.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es:
Leonel Sandí M., tiene la edad de 36 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y 2 hijos de 14 y 7 años de edad,y son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Leonel también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Leonel is 36 years old, is married and lives with his wife and two children, ages 14 and 7. They are his top priority. He is asking for this loan in order to maintain his fields, specifically for growing coffee. He wants to buy fertilizers. He wants to adequately maintain the coffee crop in order to produce a better quality and be able to get the best price come harvest time. This will be his first loan thorough FEDECOSUR and he is very grateful for their help. Leonel has been farming for a number of years. He hopes for a brighter future for his family, for a better quality of life, and to be able to continue to develop as a person and producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fretilizers

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita R. D. B. D. 48 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su hijo D. 18 años D. edad, quien se dedica a estudiar. Margarita, posee una pupusería, en la cual se encarga D. elaborar pupusas D. queso, D. chicharrón y queso, D. frijol con queso y otras variedades más. Ella se encarga D. elaborarlas y posteriormente comercializarlas en su propia casa, lugar en el cual cuenta con muchos clientes, ya que las pupusas son el platillo típico más famoso del país y que cuenta con mucha demanda por parte D. las personas. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más materia prima para la elaboración D. las pupusas, tales como: queso, frijoles, arroz, maíz y otros más. Margarita desea poder aumentar sus ventas, atendiendo mayor cantidad D. clientes, es por esta razón que ella cuenta con la esperanza D. seguir adelante y D. ir creciendo cada vez más en su negocio, el cual le ha permitido contar con todo lo necesario durante 6 años.
texts.en:
Margarita R. D. B. is 48 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador with her 18 year old son, who is a student. Margarita has a pupusería, where she makes cheese pupusas, fried pork and cheese pupusas, bean and cheese pupusas, and other varieties. She makes and sells them in her own home where she gets many customers because pupusas are the most famous traditional dish in the country and are in great demand from people. She asks for a loan so that she can have the necessary money to purchase more primary ingredients to make pupusas, like cheese, beans, rice, corn and more. Margarita would like to increase sales by attending to more customers. This is why she has hope of succeeding and continuing to grow her business bit by bit. This has allowed her to have everything she needs for the last six years.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cheese, beans, corn, rice, and more.

loans.name: Nicolasa Aracelly

texts.es:
Esta joven se llama Nicolasa Aracelly G. Meza, tiene 27 años de edad, es casado, ella habita con su marido en una comunidad Rural que se llama Sirama Sur de donde ambos son originarios, su marido trabaja en una compañía donde se elaboran rones, ella tiene un  hijo que tiene dos años.

Ella se dedica al destace de cerdos, a demás de vender la carne, vende otros sub productos del cerdo como Chicharrón, Pepena, Rebano, Frito, Nacatamal, con estos ingresos ella aporta con los ingresos del hogar.

Con nuestra institución ella ha obtenido la cantidad de Veinte y Cuatro créditos, los que en su mayoría han sido para capital de trabajo.

Es bueno hacer mención que en los Veinte y Cuatro créditos otorgados anteriormente a esta joven, ella ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
This young woman is Nicolasa Aracelly G. Meza. She is 27 years old, married, and lives with her husband in a rural community, called Sirama Sur, which is where they are both from. Her husband works at a rum distillery and they have a two-year-old son. She butchers pigs and, besides selling the pork meat, she also sells other pork products like: chicharrón (fried pork skin), pepena (pork intestine), nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales). Earnings from these sales are used to meet household expenses. She has had 24 loans with our institution; most of them have been for working capital. It is worth mentioning that this young woman has been very responsible with all her previous loan obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and ingredients.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa C. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Adelfa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Adelfa owns & operates a business venture  preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Adelfa is just starting this business.

In 2006, Adelfa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Adelfa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Adelfa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used for additional capital for her business. This will be the second loan taken out by Adelfa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 37  ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de la région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font le commerce de savon local, des produits cosmétique, des condiments alimentaires et des céréales.                                                                    
Ces femmes du groupe Djiguisseme sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire  et Kadiatou Diakité, la présidente du groupe, qui fait la fabrication de savon local compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de beurre de karité, de concombres et de papayes destinées pour la fabrication du savon local très apprécié par les clients. 
Kadiatou a bénéficié d’une formation par rapport à cette activité qui lui réussie bien et dans laquelle elle est très sollicitée et appréciée.                                                   
Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières sur place et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Dioïla et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguisseme group are all married. They are on average 37 year-old with four children. They all live in traditional extended families in the city of Dioïla, the prefecture of the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through their families and as neighbors and sell local soap, cosmetics, condiments and cereals. This is the third solidarity loan for these women of the Djiguisseme group. Kadiatou Diakité, the group's president, is active in the production of local soap. She intends to use her loan to purchase a large stock of shea butter, cucumbers and papayas for the production of her highly-appreciated local soap. Kadiatou has been trained in this activity, in which she has experienced a lot of success. She is in high demand and very well-regarded for it. She procures her raw material and retails locally on the Dioïla market and in neighboring fairs, offering cash or credit to a clientele comprising women and men. She expects to make an average monthly benefit of 40,000 CFA francs, which will be used against the everyday expenses of her family, with the remainder reinvested in her trade activities.

Translated from French by Charlotte Buecheler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for the production of local soap

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John B. is married and has four children. He has received senior high education. His wife is a trader.

John produces herbal soap for sale at Takoradi and uses his income to pay school fees and utility bills. He will use the loan to buy more ingredients and raw materials to prepare his soap in larger quantities.

With the new earnings from his extended business, John plans to save to provide a meaningful education to his children.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients and raw materials to prepare his soap in larger quantities

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es:
La señora Marisela F. es madre de familia, tiene dos hijos adolescentes que actualmente estudian.
Con un dos créditos anteriores de FVP ha construido dos cuartos, pero le falta colocarles el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto para que la casa sea más segura y duradera.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para esa construcción y planea pagarlo con el ingreso que obtiene su esposo el señor Juan Ruiz, como chofer de camión de carga de una compañía de trasporte. 
Su deseo es que sus hijos tengan su propio cuarto y vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Marisela F. is the mother of 2 adolescent children who are currently in school. With her 2 previous loans from FVP she built 2 rooms, but was unable to finish the roof. She wants to construct it with cement tiles so that the house is safer and more durable. Marisela is requesting a loan for this construction and plans to repay it with her husband's income as a cargo truck driver. Juan Ruiz works for a transportation company. Marisela's hope is for her children to have their own room for a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of roof.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es: El Sr. Alcides S., es originario del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente se desempeña como jardinero en el Juzgado civil de las personas donde tiene 13 años de laborar para dicha Institución. Tiene seis años de laborar con Ceprodel donde se le han otorgado nueve créditos consecutivos para gastos personales como compra de bienes para el hogar, gastos médicos con lo que ha resuelto gracias a ello. Su último crédito se le otorgó para la compra de medicina para el bienestar de su esposa.
texts.en:
Sr. Alcides S. is a native of the township of El Sauce. Now he works as a gardener at the local civil courthouse, where he has worked for 13 years.
