He has worked with Ceprodel for six years, and they have granted him nine consecutive loans for personal expenses such as purchasing household goods and medical expenses, which he has been able to pay off, thanks to the loan. His last loan was granted to him for the purchase of medicine for his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Yang

texts.en: Mrs. Yang P. is 54 years old and is a villager who lives in Srae Kruo village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on for a living. Her husband, Mr. Phorn Yorng, is a cow middleman who is able to earn a small profit to support his family. In order to support her husband's business, Mrs. Yang P. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows to resell. This couple has four children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory and one is a laborer while the other two are students in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer C. is from the village of Mozzozzin Norte. She is 36 years old. Jennifer is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Jennifer is just starting this business.

In 2010, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jennifer from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Nadiétou

texts.fr: F. exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de tissus de haute qualité appelé BAZIN. elle s'approvisionne au niger. le bazin est un tissu très apprécié par les femmes togolaises. elle fait ce commerce depuis 2008 et le fait de façon ambulante. son stock de marchandises est en baisse c'est pour cette raison qu'elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour rehausser son stock avec une quinzaine de bazin et assurer le transport aller retour. elle est célibataire et c'est avec le revenu de son commerce qu'elle subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. F. sells high quality fabric known as bazin. She buys her stock in Niger. Bazin is a fabric that is renowned among Togolese women. She has sold bazin since 2008 as an itinerant vendor. Her stock is currently low and she is requesting a loan through WAGES so she can purchase 15 pieces of bazin and transport them back home. She is unmarried and she uses the money earned from her business to take care of her family.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bazin

loans.name: Fatim

texts.fr: Madame Fatim F. est une femme commerçante âgée de 36 ans résidente dans le quartier de Liberté 1 d'où elle exerce un commerce de détail avec la vente de produits céréaliers et alimentaires . Ainsi,elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son fonds de commerce et accroitre son activité génératrice de revenu . Néant pas une situation familiale ce commerce est pour elle un moyen de subsistance qui va lui permettre de faire face à ses besoins personnels et à ses enfants
texts.en:
Ms. Fatim F. is a 36-year-old merchant living in the Liberté 1 district, where she runs a retail business selling cereals and food products. She is seeking a loan to strengthen her capital and increase her income-generating activity. Not having family to support her, she relies on this business as a means to provide for herself and her children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her business

loans.name: Rushooka Women's Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
As they say, hard work pays! K. Claudia, a very hardworking and determined woman, has reaped the fruits of her hard work having started up her restaurant enterprise over 20 years ago. She offers catering services in Rushooka Trading Centre, Ntungamo, preparing breakfast meals and local dishes for lunch and supper on her customers' menu.

Due to her good management and esteemed customer care, the business has maintained customers for a long time. The business has a strong clientele as they maintain good levels of hygiene. Most of her customers are town dwellers. With this loan, Claudia wants to put good furniture in place and also shop for restaurant supplies like foodstuff and drinks as she looks to improving the quality of services offered. This will enable her to get more customers, earn more profit and be able to provide her family and children’s requirements like education. She is very optimistic she will achieve a self-sustaining lifestyle with more income coming her way. 

K. Claudia belongs to Rushooka Women's Group, Ntungamo.

loans.use: To restock foodstuffs and furnish her restaurant

loans.name: Ecelia

texts.en:
Ecelia P. is from the town of Banga. She is 47 years old. Ecelia is married and has 3 children, aged 23, 20 and 18. She is involved in farming and hog-raising. She plants and harvests rice crops with her husband. She also grows pigs for fattening and sale. Ecelia has big dreams for her children. She says she wants them to have bright futures.

Ecelia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ecelia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ecelia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed and livestock. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase feed and livestock

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
Muborak is married with three children. She owns a small business that sells clothing at the central market in Khujand and has been in this business for 7 years. Muborak has always offered high quality products and excellent client service. She has many repeat clients that make her business a success. Muborak has an active life that encourages her business neighbors and friends. She has used micro-loans before and found them very helpful. This time, Muborak would like to borrow $1,000 USD to increase her inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and receive additional income to help her son pay for college.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new goods for selling in order to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia L. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Letecia is married and has two grown children. To make a living, Letecia raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Letecia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to build capital for her business. 

Letecia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Letecia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lyudmila

texts.ru: Рахмонова Людмила проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 38 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Работает на центральном рынке района Шахритус. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает конфеты и печенье. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара. На полученную прибыль хочет отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Lyudmila R., 38, lives in Shahritus. Lyudmila is married with three children. She has secondary education and works at the central market of Shahritus. Lyudmila rents a retail outlet, where she sells candy and cookies. She has been running this business for five years. Lyudmila would like to get a loan in order to increase the assortment at her outlet. The profit would allow her to renovate her home.

loans.use: to increase assortment

loans.name: Maricon

texts.en:
Ms. Maricon N. is from Barangay IV, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old and single. Maricon is presently engaged in operating a carenderia (mini-restaurant) and Internet café. She also receives support from her parents who work abroad. Maricon has been engaged in this business for 3 years and earns a monthly average of at least 3,500 PHP from it.

Just this year, Maricon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricon, as a newly-recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP as her 1st loan. She plans to use the loan for additional capital to extend her café and for her existing carenderia. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions, especially in meeting their basic needs and in saving for future use, loan repayments and possible business expansions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Internet cafe extension and additional capital for her carenderia business

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is a 35-year-old hardworking man, married to a farmer with six children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  His ambition is to have a model-educated family. He distills alcohol for a living and has been in the business for 15 years now, amidst the challenge of limited capital available to grow the business. Solomon intends to use the credit facility to purchase coffee seeds and bananas to use in alcohol distillation.

loans.use: To purchase bananas and coffee seeds for alcohol distilling.

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es: Clara Luz C. es una mujer de 46 años y se dedica al negocio de alquiler de lavadoras, actividad muy bien desarrollada porque ayuda mucho a las mujeres que, como ella en algun tiempo pasado, no cuentan con esta maquina y se les hace muy pesada la tarea de lavar y a Clara Luz le genera unos importantes ingresos que le sirven para su hogar. Asì fuè como Clara Luz inspirada, por cuanto ella ofrecia el servivio de lavado y planchado a mano que era tan pesado, se diò a la tarea de faciliarla para ella y para los demas. Asì fuè como compro varias lavadoras con los que hasta hoy apoya la gestiòn de su hogar, fortalecida con el trabajo de su conyuge en beneficio de sus 5 hijos que hoy estan en las edades de 10 a 26 años , estudian y por los cuales ha estructurado su negocio, para que puedan seguir aprovechando sus  ingresos por mucho tiempo. Este es su primer credikiva y con el comprarà dos lavadora, para aumentar sus ingresos y responder mas oportunamente a sus clientes. Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y se preparen para el futuro, asì como tener una vivienda propia y aumentar cada dia su infraestructura, por lo cual debe seguir esforzandose. Con su negocio Clara obtiene  un75 % de utilidades y el èxito de esta inversiòn se espera porque tiene una buena demanda del servicio, una clientela fija y unas permaente ganas de trabajar constante para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Clara Luz C. is a 46 year old woman and she  works in the business of renting out washing machines. This is a very well developed activity because it really helps women, who like her not long ago, don't have this appliance and the task of washing becomes very difficult for them. It generates important income for Clara Luz that she uses for her home. Clara Luz was inspired when she offered a laundry and pressing service by hand and it was so difficult she decided to make it easier for her and for everyone else.  Thus she bought several washing machines that to this day help her household, fortified by her spouse' work for their 5 children, aged 10 to 26 years old. They go to school and she has structured her business around them so that they can keep making the most of it the income for a long time. This is her first Kiva loan and with it she will buy two washing machines to increase her income and respond more quickly to her customers.  Her dream s for her children to go to school and prepare for the future, as well as to have her own home and increase her infrastructure ever day.  This is why she keeps on striving. With her business Clara gets 75 % profit and success is expected with this investment because she has a good demand for her service, regular customers and a permanent wish to work constantly to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: Two washing machines

loans.name: Fernanda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Fernanda de 27 años, es una joven emprendedora que aprovecho la oportunidad que su mama se fue al exterior para mejorar su calidad vida y comenzó administrar una pequeña tienda que ya tenía con la mama por 10 años. 

Viviendo con su esposo que es comerciante y sus dos hijos que tiene 9 y 6 años en una zona urbana llamada Suburbio ha trabajado en la tienda desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. En la tienda vende varios víveres como arroz, azúcar, bebidas, enlatados, dulces etc.    

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro por eso quiere continuar con su negocio comprando con el préstamo arroz, azúcar, bebidas entre otros víveres. En el futuro quiere incrementar el negocio y comprar una casa ya que en la que vive es de la mama.
texts.en:
Fernanda is 27 years old.  She is an enterprising young woman who took advantage of the fact that her mom went abroad to improve her quality of life and she started managing a small store that she had already owned with her mom for 10 years.

Fernanda lives with her husband, who is a salesman, and their two children, aged 9 and 6, in an urban area called Suburbio.  She works in her store from 7.00am to 10.00pm every day.  In her store she sells a variety of foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, drinks, canned goods, candy, etc. 

Fernanda has many aspirations for the future.  For this reason, she would like to continue working in her business and will use her loan to buy rice, sugar, drinks and other foodstuffs.  In the future, she would like to increase her business and buy a house since the one in which she currently lives is her mom's.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and drinks

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a sus 4 hijos y se dedica a administrar una tienda de productos de primera necesidad.
Ella como responsable del hogar mantiene en las mejoras condiciones el inventario de su tienda ya que de ella dependen sus hijos y logra cubrir los gastos familiares, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite y maíz, con estos productos espera continuar con el inventario en buenas condiciones y ofrecer a los clientes calidad y variedad, complaciendo sus necesidades cotidianas.
Su objetivo es mantener el negocio en buenas condiciones y ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios, para que estos puedan superarse.
texts.en:
María lives in San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazán. She is 38 years old, lives with her four children, and works managing a store with basic necessities.

As the person responsible for the household, she keeps her store inventory in the best conditions as her children depend on her. She is able to cover the family expenses and this is why she is requesting a loan for the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, oil, and corn. With these products, she hopes to continue to keep her inventory in good conditions and offer quality and variety to her customers, meeting their daily needs.

Her goal is to keep her business in good condition and to help her children with their education so that they can be successful.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the store

loans.name: Subhi

texts.en:
Subhi is a young man from Qalqilia. He is married and has no children yet. Subhi works in the agriculture industry. He has contracts with a number of farmers in Qalqilia to transfer their crops to the shops around the town. Subhi started this job one year ago and it is helping him secure a good life for his small family.

Subhi took a loan from FATEN to pay for the last payment of the vehicle he uses to transfer the crops of farmers. The previous owner agreed on dividing the payments on a monthly basis. The loan will be used to cover the last payment.

Subhi appears in the picture here.

loans.use: To make the last payment on a small freight vehicle

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet M. is a single woman who owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity bills. 

She has operated an M-pesa (a mobile-phone-based money-transfer) service for the past five years, operating in a shop whereby neighbours and passersby are her potential customers. Juliet hopes to establish another business in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase a money float and credit cards for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a money float and credit cards for sale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, tiene 22 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive en la Capital Arqueológica de América,  Cusco – Perú. 

Victoria tiene un carro y lo alquila a S/. 25 soles a personas que desean trabajar brindando servicios de transporte. Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  Victoria en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para mantenimiento del carro. 

Victoria pertenece al banco comunal “Allin Muju” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Victoria is 22 years old and has one child.  She lives in the archaeological capital of America (Cusco, Peru).

Victoria has a car which she hires out for 25 Peruvian soles to people who want to use it to provide transport services.  She has been in this business for one year and it is doing very well.  On this occasion, Victoria requires a loan to have her car serviced.

Victoria is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Allin Muju" community bank.  She is grateful for the opportunity she is being given with this loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to have her car serviced

loans.name: Yerekun Gnini. Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf membres du groupe YEREKUN GNINI sont des femmes mariées, avec une moyenne d’âge de 33  ans, et ont en moyenne  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à SIEKOURANI un des villages de la commune de Loulouni préfecture de Kadiolo (Sikasso) 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
SITAN K. fait le commerce d’ignames dans ce groupe de femmes YEREKUN GNINI. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  600kg d’ignames. Elle s’approvisionne à Siékourani et dans les villages environnants.  Elle revend au  marché de Siékourani et au marché de Loulouni ville les jours de foires à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 14.750FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The nine members of the YEREKUN GNINI group are married women who average 33 years of age and two children each. Most of them live in polygamous families in SIEKOURANI, a village in the commune of Loulouni, prefecture of Kadiolo, in Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

This is their first loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy their customers’ needs.

Sitan K. is a member of the YEREKUN GNINI group. She sells yams. She plans to use her loan to buy 600 kg of yams. She gets her stock in Siékourani and surrounding villages. She conducts her sales at the markets of Siékourani and Loulouni, for cash, to a clientele composed of both men and women.

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 14,750 FCFA, which she will use to repay the loan and interest, and to bolster her savings.

loans.use: to buy yams for resale

loans.name: Daninova

texts.en:
Daninova is 37 years old and married with four children. Daninova works very hard to provide for them.

Daninova runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Daninova has been in this business for 21 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, soap, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Daninova would like to help her husband to earn additional income and make some improvement to their house.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Brahunda Group

texts.es:
A 40 minutos de veraC. se encuentra una comunidad llamada barahunda esta cominudad se caracteriza porque cerca de ahi se encuentran varios posos petroleros de PEMEX. En esta comunidad existe un grupo llamado “Barahunda” al cual llamaron asi porque es el nombre de su comunidad y por el significado de la palabra que es: “fiesta, bullicio o ruido ” ya que este grupo se caracteriza por ser muy alegre y unido.
Doña Elia Moran es uno de los  integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 60 años y tuvo 6 hijos los cuales ya estan casados actualmente vive con dos de sus nietos. Ella nos platica que hace mas de 7 años tuvo la inquietud de trabajar y con el apoyo de sus hijos abrio una muebleria en su comunidad a la cual llamo "Muebleria Diana"  en honor a la mas pequeña de sus nietas, ella tambien se dedica a la cria de puercos tiene un pequeño corral en la parte de atras de su casa en el cual tiene a sus puercos. Doña Elia necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de alimento para sus cerdos y algunos muebles(cajoneras, licuadoras, batidoras y planchas) para resurtir su negocio. Ella espera que con este credito o su negocio progrese y las vantas aumenten ya que desea obtener buenas ganancias para poder pintar su negocio y seguir invirtiendo en el.
Doña Elia nos dijo: "voy a provechar para agradecer a la fundacion por el prestamo y la confianza que me ha otorgado".
Los otros  integrantes del grupo son:
Maria de Lourdes G. C.- venta de catálogo cosmeticos
Josefa C.- venta de pollos y dulces 
Alicia Sánchez C.-venta de productos naturistas 
Rosa Ramírez R.-venta por cata lago de cosméticos
Maricela T.- venta de ropa y visuteria
Iraís E. Hernández-venta de zapatos para dama
Mayra M. - Venta de carne de cerdo
Elizabeth M.-comercio de ganado
texts.en:
Forty minutes from VeraC. is a community called Barahunda.  This community is noted for the fact that there are several PEMEX oil wells located there.  In this community there is a group called 'Barahunda'.  The group chose this name because it is the name of their community and also because the word means 'fiesta', 'bustle' or 'noise" which describes this very cheerful and united group.

Elia Moran is one of the group's members.  She is 60 years old and has six children who are all married.  She currently lives with two of her grandchildren.  She tells us that more than 7 years ago she wanted to work and, with the support of her children, she opened a furniture store in her community called "Muebleria Diana" (Diana's Furniture Store) in honor of her youngest granddaughter.  Elia also raises pigs.  She has a small farmyard behind her home where she keeps her pigs.  Elia needs this loan to invest in buying feed for her pigs and some household products (chests of drawers, blenders, mixers and irons) to re-stock her business.

Elia hopes that this loan will help her to make progress in her business and that her sales will increase since she would like to make good profits so that she can paint her business and continue investing in it.  Elia tells us "I am going to take this opportunity to thank Fundación Realidad for the loan and the trust that they have placed in me". 

The other members of this group are:
Maria de Lourdes G.-C., who sells cosmetics through a catalog
Josefa C., who sells chickens and sweet treats
Alicia Sánchez C., who sells natural products
Rosa Ramírez R., who sells cosmetics through a catalog
Maricela T., who sells clothes and costume jewelry
Iraís E. Hernández, who sells ladies' shoes
Mayra M., who sells pork
Elizabeth M., who sells livestock

loans.use: to buy furniture, blenders, irons, beds, pig feed, catalogs, men's and women's clothes, and supplies for making Mexican snacks

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 45 years old and married with three children. For a living, she sells milk and eggs and also has a job. She previously sold second-hand clothes. Grace has sustained her business for two years and now she hopes to open another business selling other milk products.  She has requested 20,000 Kes to buy milk, milk jars, and crates of eggs.

loans.use: To buy milk, milk jars, and crates of eggs

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en:
Batsuuri is 29 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Dornod province, Mongolia. His son is six years old and attends kindergarten and his wife works as an officer at NGO. Since 2009, Batsuuri has managed a transportation service business that runs between Dornod province and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He transports coal, wood, metal and other items. 

Batsuuri is a hardworking man who attributes his business success to his good managerial skills. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase new truck. Batsuuri is planning to expand his business and also to open a grocery store near his home.

loans.use: to purchase a new truck

loans.name: Tania Yesenia

texts.es:
Tania de 31 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, su esposo es chofer y tiene un hijo de 9 años que estudia en escuela particular. Tiene una papelería.

Cuando se hizo de compromiso se puso el negocio ya que tenia que cuidar a la hija y tenia que solventar en los gastos el hogar para ayudar a su esposo. Vende en su papelería como artículos escolares cuadernos plumas. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere invertir en mas mercadería cuadernos varios artículos de papelería y snacks para incrementar sus ganancias. En un futuro dese seguir en su negocio y conservarse bien en salud y para familia también.
texts.en:
Tania, 31, lives in an urban zone in El Guasmo (so called because of a species of tree, Guazuma ulmifolia; El Guasmo is a popular, low income neighborhood that used to be a hacienda) in Guayaquil.  Her husband’s a driver and they have a 9-year-old son who goes to private school.  She has a stationery shop.

When she became engaged she opened the store because she had to care for her child and cover household expenses to help her husband.  She sells stationery items like school supplies, notebooks and pens.  With help from the loan she wants to invest in more merchandise like assorted notebooks, stationery items and snacks to increase profits.  In the future she hopes to stay in business and to stay healthy and that her family does too.

loans.use: to buy stationery items and snacks.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es: El banco D. emprendimiento "RENACER" se encuentra en su octavo ciclo, el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco D. Emprendimiento esta representado por las siguientes socias: La Presidenta la señora María quien tiene la actividad económica D. venta D. libros en la puerta D. la universidad D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba, tiene variedad D. libros para poder ofrecer a los estudiantes D. las distintas áreas D. la universidad, la Sra. esta casada y tiene hijos, a los que mantiene con esta actividad, la Sra. es una persona muy amable y Jovial que trabaja mucho por el bienestar D. su familia, con el dinero del crédito comprara un lote D. libros para poder surtir su puesto D. venta, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The 'Renacer' community bank is in its eighth loan cycle.  It is maD. up of responsible and hard-working people.  This community bank is represented by its president, María, who sells books at the entrance to the university of the city of Cochabamba.  She has a variety of books that she sells to the students from different departments of the university.  María is married and has children who she supports with this business activity.  She is a very kind and cheerful person who works hard for the well-being of her family.  She will use her loan money to buy a batch of books with which to stock her sales location.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to buy a batch of books

loans.name: Indramaya

texts.en:
Indramaya is 40 years-old .  She is married and has 2 children, aged 16 and 10.  In 1998, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received, and successfully repaid, one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buys seeds and fetilizers. 

In the future, Indramaya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
41 year-old Suong lives with her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. The coupL. has 3 children. Her husband is a bricklayer, which is a line of work that doesn't always provide a regular source of income for the family. Suong has tried to support her family by selling soup on her street since 2006. This work provides her and her family with a daily income to meet the family's basic living expenses.

Suong's income has fallen recently because of the increased cost of renting the small area where she sets up her stall to sell soup. She would like to take out a loan to supplement her business capital and buy more food to sell at her stall. She hopes that through the loan she will be abL. to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, para recibir un ingreso extra hace 6 años coloco una papelería en su casa que se encuentra en una de las calles mas transitadas, el negocio se le denomino “Papelería UPS2" en el que ofrece variedad de artículos escolares como lo es lápices, plumas, sacapuntas, cuadernos, mochilas y más. El préstamo que solicita es para estar preparada para la entrada del nuevo ciclo escolar donde le pedirán las listas de las escuelas como lo es de kínder, primaria y secundaria así de esta manera obtendrá mayores ganancias. 

Cecilia también trabaja de secretaria en el Gobierno para poder sostener los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a hardworking and enterprising woman. In order to have an income, six years ago she started a stationary store in her house which is located on one of the busiest streets in town. The business is called "Papeleria UPS2" and offers a variety of school supplies like pencils, pens, hole-punchers, notebooks, backpacks and more. The requested loan is to stock her store to be prepared for the new school year when they will have lists of supplies needed for kindergarten, primary school and high school. This way she will make more money. 

Cecilia also works as a secretary for the government to cover the costs of her home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as notebooks, pens, crayons, pencils, and paper.

loans.name: Abdon

texts.es: Abdón, tiene la edad 46 de  años, está casado y vive su esposa que es su  prioridad. El con el crédito va a comprar los insumos necesarios de la siembra de tomate y chile. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de estos cultivos por lo cual los sembrara y los asistirá para su cosecha. El quiere generar  las ganancias para salir con el crédito y cumplir con sus proyectos de vida. Quiere darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida en el futuro.Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Abdón is 46, and married. He lives with his wife, who is his priority. With the loan, he is going to buy the supplies necessary to grow tomatoes and chiles. 

He has a plot of land suitable for growing these crops, so he will plant them, and help them be ready for harvest. He wants to generate profits in order to pay off the loan and to fulfil his goals in life. He wants to give his family a better quality of life in the future. 

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hadn't previously taken loans from state-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR offered better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To grow tomatoes and chiles.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is 33 years old, married and has three children.  To earn a living for his family, he operates a barber shop.  He has managed to retain his business for fifteen years because of the financial support from Faulu Kenya.  He has also learned how to manage his business through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya.

Peterson hopes to own a big barber shop in the future.  He has requested a loan for 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a shaving machine.

loans.use: buy a shaving machine

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Yat (in the photo), 53, is a widow with seven children. Four are married and live outside the family home, one is a garment worker, one has full-time employment, and another one is bicycle repairman. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Yat is a rice farmer. She is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: 19 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Huyền has a retail business selling clothing. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell. She is 52 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 19 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives with two dependents, and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Huyền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huyền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en: Jason is a hardworking business man, aged 41. He is married and blessed with five children. For the last nine years, he has been managing a retail shop to make a living. He has been able to retain his business because of the financial support from Faulu Kenya. In the next 5 years, he wants to manage a wholesale business. He is requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.use: to buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores, a 49-year-old married mother of four children, two of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a sari-sari store in the Philippines for the past seven years. She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a stock of groceries to sell in her store. In the future, Dolores would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Hadia

texts.en:
Hadia is 26-years-old, married to a man who is a driver, with one child who is not in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. 

Hadia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to be able to order more charcoal for sale. She will use her extra income for building a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to be able to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has been farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 27 years.  She is 46 years old, married to Githia, and they have six school-aged children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fourth loan.  She paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs and hire labor.

In the future, Jane hopes to improve her farming skills and make more profits, thereby improving the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and hire labor

loans.name: Rono

texts.en:
Rono is a 29-year-old farmer in Litein, South Rift, Kenya. He is married with one child aged one. He has been in farming for 11 years and currently produces milk and tea for the local market.

Rono has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow to boost his dairy business. He says he will use the income to improve the living standards of his family by providing them with the basic needs they currently lack.

He points at lack of finances as the major challenge for smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah used his first loan amount to buy fertilizer as well as plough his land during the previous planting season. He was able to plant and make a good harvest which was very profitable. He paid the loan amount well and in good time. This will be his second loan and he plans to use the loan amount to buy dairy meal and medicine for his livestock.

Besides farming as his primary activity, Jonah is also a veterinary doctor and offers veterinary services to farmers around and out of Olkalau area. In the future, Jonah hopes to start his own offices and clinic to offer veterinary services to farmers in the region.

loans.use: to buy dairy meal and livestock medicine

loans.name: Vanney

texts.en:
Vanney is 47 years old, married, and has six children. Two of her children are midwives, two are soldiers, and two attend school. She lives in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. 

Vanney is a farmer, while her husband works for the Ministry of National Defense. She is requesting a loan for $1,000, which she will use to purchase a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to the hospital where she is a midwife.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her daughter.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila de 44 años convive con Remigio con quien tiene 6 hijos de 16, 15, 13, 10, 8 y 6 años. Esta numerosa pero feliz familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa de Pumpuriani, provincia de Chanchamayo. Luzmila vive contenta, pues su esfuerzo y el arduo trabajo que desempeña la llena de gratificaciones que ve reflejado en su familia.  La agricultura es su forma de vivir y obtener dinero. Es así que cuenta con terrenos de cultivos en los que siembra 6000 kilos de maíz y plátanos. “Cuando el precio sube, el kilo llega a costar 1.20 o 1.50 soles”, comenta. Para ello, Luzmila cosecha las mazorcas y las desgrana y seca. El maíz de la selva es muy solicitado por los compradores, es así que llegan a la misma comunidad para adquirir los productos. Cuando eso sucede Luzmilia se ahorra en los gastos de fletes. Sus hijos aun son pequeños y se encuentran estudiando en el colegio y escuela. Es por eso que Luzmilia sigue trabajando por se sabe que su desempeño será recompensado al ver a sus hijos como personas de bien y realizadas. Gracias a su ayuda, éste sería su primer préstamo de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de las cuotas. A la vez se siente entusiasta de pertenecer a su banco comunal “Las Thinanis de Pumpuriani”. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos y el pago de jornaleros con 25 soles al día.
texts.en:
Luzmilla, 44, lives with her common-law husband, Remigio and their 6 children: 16, 15, 13, 10, 8 and 6.  This large but happy family lives in their own house in the local village of Pumpuriani, Chachamayo province.  Luzmila lives contentedly and the effort and hard work that she exerts fills her with gratification that is reflected in her family.  
Farming is her way of life and of getting an income. She has fields in which she plants 6000 kilos of corn and plantains and she says, “When the prices rise, the kilo can reach 1.20 or 1.50 sols. For that reason, Luzmila plants the corns and scrapes down and dries the kernels.  Corn from the jungle is very sought after by Peruvians and they come to the village to purchase.  When this happens Luzmila saves the transport cost.  

Her children are still small and they are in high school and elementary school.  That is why Luzmila continues working because she knows that her effort is rewarded by seeing her children develop and succeed.  Thanks to your help this will be her first loan with MFP and she promises to make all the payments on time.  She also feels enthusiastic belonging to the communal bank “Las Thinanis de Pumpuriani”.  She will use the money to buy sacks of organic fertilizer and to pay the farm hands 25 sols a day.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer and to hire farm hands.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 38 years old, married and lives in Buchanan with four children aged 7 months to 15 years old. They all live at home. For the past 21 years, she has been selling used clothes in the market. She established the business with small loans from friends and says that she encounters few problems in her business other than the large amounts of travel involved, which can be difficult with a small child. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Jose Joaquin

texts.es:
Con 54 años de edad, originario de San Marcos una comunidad ubica en las afueras de Estelí, es Joaquín, el tiene 25 años trabajando como agricultor, el siembra hortalizas y granos básicos, es casado tiene 3 hijos de 7,14 y 18 años de edad respectivamente. Cuando inicio en la agricultura fue en una pedazo de tierra que le asigno el gobierno desde entonces trabajo en su parcela donde orgullosamente con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo duro se gana el alimento para sus hijos. El viaja hasta  la ciudad capital Managua para vender su producción buscando como venderlo a un buen precio e el mercado donde la competencia es intensa pero el lucha hasta conseguirlo. Pero regresa a su casa con la satisfacción de haber conseguido un buen precio por sus productos. 
El solicita el préstamo para sembrar 2 manzanas de cebollas. Este le ayudara a comprar los insumos necesarios para sacar una producción de muy buena calidad. El tiene como proyecto próximo una vez finalizado la siembra de cebolla sembrar una manzana de Tomates.
texts.en:
At the age of 54 and in San Marcos, a community located in the outskirts of Estelí, Joaquín has been working as a farmer for 25 years.  He grows vegetables and basic grains.  He’s married and has three children who are 7, 14 and 18 years of age respectively.

When he started out farming it was on a piece of land the government assigned to him and since then he’s worked his parcel proudly with much effort and hard work generating food for his children.  He travels to the city of Managua to sell his crops looking to sell them at a good price in the market where competition is intense but he strives until he accomplishes it.  He returns home with the satisfaction of having gotten a good price for his products.

He is asking for the loan to plant two manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] of onions.  The loan will help him buy the necessary supplies to produce a good quality harvest.  His next project for when he finishes planting the onions is to plant a manzana of tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 29-year-old, married man. He has two children aged 3 and 8 years old.  He operates a pool table where people can play games. Paul has been involved in this business for one year.  His business is located in an area with business potential and his primary customers are local people.  In addition, Paul increases his income through farming.  His biggest business challenge is disturbance by the police. 

Paul will use the 10,000 KES loan to purchase another pool table. His business goal is to increase his customer size to over one hundred people within five years.

loans.use: To buy another pool table for his business.

loans.name: Gloria Lilba

texts.es:
Ella es Gloria Lilba una mujer luchadora que desea cumplir un sueño de mucho tiempo atrás, pues en la juventud no logró hacerlo realidad por falta de oportunidad, pero hoy lo ve más cerca que nunca, pues le falta pagar el semestre de pasantías para recibir el diploma como técnica en estética y cosmetología en campo alto una institución con buenas referencias a nivel académico.
Desea con todo el corazón llegar a conseguir un trabajo donde pueda ganar lo necesario para en la vejez no carecer de lo básico, y ella poder tener sus ingresos de dinero. 
Desde la juventud aprendió  a trabajar en oficio varios, nunca tuvo un trabajo en un empresa ya que no logro tener una formación académica completa y por lo tanto no logro tener una pensión.  
Ella llego muy pequeña a una ciudad donde todo se compra, los padre eran campesinos, personas honestas y honradas, pero no tenían una buena educación, lo poco que el padre ganaba solo alcanzaba para la comida y renta, por lo tanto a ella desde muy pequeña le toco bastante duro, ya que no tuvo las comodidades ni las facilidades de otra persona.

loans.use: Para pagar el semestre de matricula

loans.name: Mastulah

texts.en: Mastulah is single with two children and all go to school. She operates a food stall and has been in this business for more than 10 years. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy banana leaves,tomatoes,onions,cabbages . She gets additional income from roasting Cavendish bananas in the evening. She works seven days a week.  She is aspiring to buy iron sheets to roof her residential house. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, rent, and food.

loans.use: To buy banana leaves,tomatoes,onoins,cabbages

loans.name: Jerusalem Group

texts.en:
Hilda, who is in late 50's is single with four children. She has been running a motorcycling business and a clothing shop which sales vitenge for 13 years now. She works from 7 am to 11 pm daily and she's able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to purchase a motorcycle famously known as "boda boda" and to restock her shop with stylish clothes to meet customers demand. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is now proceeding well. 

She used her profit to take care of her family, to repay loan, reinvest in business and pay school fees. She will use this loan to buy spare parts for her boda boda's and to increase on the volume of latest outfit to sell during Christmas festivals. She dreams of expanding her business into a whole selling store. 

Hilda, will share this loan with her loan group JERUSALEM which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her boda boda's and to increase on the volume of latest outfit to sell during Christmas festivals.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en: I have been making shoes and repairing them for 11 years.  This is the first time I have ever taken a loan to invest in my business.  My plan is to buy in bulk the basic tools and materials that I always buy.  My customers come to my shop to place their orders or leave me their shoes.  My shop is in a good and easy location for my customers.

loans.use: Purchase materials such as leather, glue and rubber soles, and also tools such as blades, molds, and needles.

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.en:
Alma Rosa began her business selling cosmetics via catalog two years ago because she needed to earn additional income to cover increased household expenses which could not be covered by her husband's earnings. She is a mother of three children who are 14, 10 and 2 years old, and is facing a lot of school expenses. A friend helped her start this business and to overcome many adversities. Her work and her responsibilities are constantly in Alma Rosa's thoughts.

She hopes to recive a loan for $USD1,200 to increase the variety of her merchandise and thereby grow her customer base. You can help make possible the growth and continuation of Alma's business. It is very important because only this way can she help her husband and give her children the education they have the right to receive. Only with your help can this be possible. She and her family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora Alma Rosa comenzó su negocio de venta de cosméticos por catálogo hace 2 años, debido a la necesidad que tenía de generar ingresos extras, pues se presentaban en ese momento muchos gastos en su hogar, mismos que eran imposibles de solventar con sólo el sueldo de su esposo, pues ella es madre de 3 hijos, de 14, 10 y 2 años de edad, por lo que los gastos de la escuela son muy grandes. Gracias a una amiga comenzó con esta actividad, misma que le ha dado ha su familia lo necesario y ayudado a vencer muchas adversidades. El trabajo y la responsabilidad están cada día en el pensamiento de Alma Rosa. Ella tiene la esperanza de recibir un crédito de $1200 DLLS para poder surtir más mercancía e incrementar de esta manera su cartera de clientes. Tu puedes hacer posible la continuación y crecimiento del negocio de Alma, es muy importante, pues sólo así ella podrá seguir ayudando a su esposo y dar a sus hijos la educación a la que tienen derecho. Sólo con tu ayuda esto será posible, ella y su familia te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purcahse merchandise

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Mrs. Leticia H. has owned her tire shop for 1 year. “I am a single mother, and my business is my only income. I have a young man who helps me, since there are many things that I, as a woman, am not strong enough to do. I would like to purchase tires, an air compressor, and a hydraulic jack so that I can service my clients more quickly. I am asking for $1000.00 dollars for the purchase of tires, the air compressor, and the hydraulic jack.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Leticia Hernández tiene una vulcanizadora desde hace 1 año.” Soy mamá soltera y mi negocio es mi único ingreso, tengo la ayuda de un joven ya que hay muchas cosas que por ser mujer no tengo la fuerza para hacerlas, me gustaría comprar llantas, un compresor y un gato hidráulico para atender más rápido a mis clientes”. Solicito $1,000.00 dlls para la compra de las llantas, el compresor y el gato hidráulico

loans.use: Purchase tires, an air compressor, and a hydraulic jack.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Add more Pigs

loans.name: David

texts.es:
Mr. Fernandez is the owner of a vulcanizing shop – a place to chemically treat (rubber) with sulfur and heat for greater elasticity and durability – where he repairs auto tires for all types of vehicles. He made the effort to buy tools and machines to keep his business active. Currently, he wishes to borrow a loan to improve the appearance of his shop since he practically attends to his customers in the street. He wants to paint the area and build a roof that would allow him to create a waiting room for the comfort of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. F. es propietario desde hace más de siete años de una vulcanizadora donde repara llantas para todo tipo de vehículos, inició con las herramientas básicas para brindar sus servicios y poco a poco, con mucho esfuerzo fue adquiriendo herramientas y máquinas que le han permitido mantener activo su negocio, en la actualidad quiere adquirir el préstamo para mejorar la apariencia de su negocio, ya que prácticamente atiende a sus clientes en la calle, quiere pintar el local y construir un techo que le permita crear como una sala de espera para dar más comodidad a sus clientes.

loans.use: Maintenance and construction of store

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim R., age 31, is a widow who works as a farmer earning about $1.50 each day. She has one child who is a student. In order to increase her business revenue, she would like to request a loan of $300 to purchase fertilizer and seeds for her crop cultivation and use the remainder of the loan to buy piglets to raise and sell at the market. She hopes this will increase her income enough to help finance her child’s education and give them a more dependable income stream.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds for farming, and piglets to raise

loans.name: Subgroup C Of Group Sungura

texts.en:
Hironius, age 55, has owned his beer and soft drinks shop for over 23 years. Over time, his business has expanded and now brings in about $35 in profit every week. He hires 4 workers to assist him at his shop.

Hironius is the leader of Subgroup C of Group “Sungura” (Swahili for “rabbit”), which totals 31 members. Hironius’ wife is also a member of Sungura, although in a different subgroup. He and his wife have 4 children and take care of 2 orphaned relatives.

Hironius will be sharing this loan with his subgroup members Grace M. (selling lotions), Johari J. (selling charcoal), Prosper T. (selling motorcar accessories), Yahaya R. (a carpenter), and Lidya M. (selling food). They all live and work in the same locality. In the past, they have taken out 3 loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to enhance their businesses and were able to pay them back successfully.

Hironius used the previous loans to purchase inventory for his shop. He hopes to also use the new loan to once again increase his stock of soft drinks and beer.

loans.use: To expand businesses.

loans.name: Lourdes Judith

texts.es:
Lourdes belongs to the La Amistad del Dorado Communal Bank and lives in the San Martin region in the province and district of Moyabamba. She conducts business in a sales stand in the city’s supply market where her patrons, who are dwellers from the area or nearby visitors, attend daily.

Ever since she was a little girl, she had experience selling food with her mother, for which reason she had no difficulty starting her own business with the help of her husband and oldest daughter. The great service she offers her clients and her excellent flavoring has caused her clientele to grow, and she feels very satisfied from it.

With the loan of S/. 1,500.00, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase the necessary equipment for the installation of her water and drainage services, and she will buy ingredients for the preparation of her meals such as rice; sugar; legumes in wholesale; vegetables of all varieties (by the kilogram); and beef, chicken, pork and fish, also by the kilogram, which will allow her to prepare diverse meals for her clients.

Lourdes is a happy and enthusiastic woman of 35 years of age. She wishes to create a better future and live to old age in tranquility. For that reason, she wishes to one day own a room rental business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lourdes pertenece al Banco Comunal La Amistad del Dorado, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito D. Moyabamba. Desarrolla su negocio en un puesto D. ventas del mercado D. abasto D. esta ciudad donD. diariamente acuden sus comensales, los cuales son moradores D. la propia localidad o visitantes D. lugares cercanos.

DesD. pequeña tuvo experiencia en la venta D. comida junto a su mamá, por lo que no le fue difícil instalar su propio negocio con la ayuda D. su esposo y una hija mayor. La buena atención que brinda a sus clientes y su buena sazón hace que cada día su clientela aumente, con lo que se siente muy satisfecha.

Con el préstamo D. S/ 1,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará los accesorios necesarios para la instalación D. los servicios D. agua y desagüe y comprará los insumos para la preparación D. los alimentos como arroz, azúcar, menestras al por mayor, verduras en todas sus variedades (por kilos), carnes D. res, pollo, cerdo y pescado, también en kilos, que le permitirá preparar comida variada a sus clientes.

Lourdes es una mujer entusiasta y alegre con 35 años D. edad, la cual desea forjarse un futuro mejor y una vejez tranquila, es por ello que anhela tener un negocio D. alquiler D. habitaciones.

loans.use: Purchase the necessary equipment for the installation of water and drainage services, and ingredients for the preparation of her meals such as rice, sugar, legumes, vegetables of all varieties, beef, chicken, pork and fish.

loans.name: Elieser Jose

texts.es:
Elieser José is originally from Bluefields, Nicarague. He's 33 years old and married to Carla Chavarria, and together they have two young children who are currently enrolled in elementary school. These expenses are paid for by income from selling basic grains and other items, which he has done for eight years. His target customers are farmers. Currently, he needs to purchase 5 units of wheat at $27 per unit, 10 units of peanuts at $30 per unit, and 2 units of corn at $32.50 a unit to meet his customers' demands, which has grown in recent months.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Elieser José J. F. es originario de la ciudad de Bluefielfds, tiene 33 años de edad esta casado con la Sr. Carla Chavarria ambos tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que cursan estudios primarios estos gastos son pagados con el ingreso de la venta de granos básicos. El Sr. J. tiene mas de 8 años de experiencia sus clientes potenciales son granjeros. En estos momentos necesita comprar 5 quintales de trigo a $ 27.00 dólares el quintal, 10 quintales de Payana a $ 30.00 dólares el quintal y 2 quintales de maíz amarillo a $32.50 dólares el quintal para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que a aumentado en estos últimos meses.

loans.use: Purchase five units of wheat, 10 of peanuts and two of corn.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs L Thị L. is 40 years old. She is married and has 4 children. They live in Hưng Nguyn, Nghệ An. Her husband is a farmer. Beside working on their rice paddy, Mrs L. also raises pigs, poultry and cows. This is the main income source for her family. On average, they make 150-180 USD a month. Their 4 children are attending school and the expenses are high. Mrs L. and her husband are determined to work hard to provide their children the highest education. This time Mrs L. is requesting a loan of 775 USD to buy piglets, chicks and animal feed. Mrs L. is a 4th year member of TYM fund

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị L., 40 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 4 con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Văn Thọ, là một nông dân. Ngoài làm ruộng, công việc của chị L. là chăn nuôi lợn, gà, trâu. Đây là nguồn thu nhập chính của cả gia đình. Mỗi tháng gia đình chị thu từ 150-180USD. Cả 4 cháu của chị L. đều đang trong độ tuổi đi học nên chi phí rất tốn kém. Chị L. cùng chồng thống nhất cố gắng lao động để các con được học đến mức cao nhất. Vòng vốn tới chị L. xin vay 775USD để mua lợn, gà con và thức ăn gia súc. Chị L. là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương.

loans.use: Buy piglets, chicks.

loans.name: Tepeyac 5 Group

texts.es:
Josefa de Jesus fell in love when she was 16 years old and had twin girls. Up until now her focus has been to take care of their daughters, but because her husband's income is very low, she has seen the need to undertake the business of selling shoes. She will use this loan to purchase additional shoes of various sizes, colors and styles and hopefully grow her business and bring in additional profits to contribute to her household expenses.

Mrs. Fatima de La Paz B. Yanez (who sells "toppers"), and Irene del Rosario M. C. (who sells blankets, bedspreads and bedding) are also part of the group known as TEPEYAC 5.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

JOSEFA DE JESUS SE ENAMORO A LOS 16 AÑOS Y TUVO GEMELITAS, HASTA EL MOMENTO SE HA DEDICADO AL CUIDADO DE SUS PEQUEÑAS HIJAS, SU ESPOSO TIENE UN INGRESO MUY POCO Y SE HA VISTO EN LA NECESIDAD DE EMPRENDER EL NEGOCIO DE LA VENTA DE ZAPATOS A PEDIDO, Y POSTERIORMENTE CONFORME EL NEGOCIO VAYA CRECIENDO ADQUIRIR ZAPATOS EN DISTINTOS MODELOS, NUMEROS Y COLORES Y DE ESTA MANERA ELLA PODRA CRECER COMO NEGOCIANTE Y OBTENDRA GANACIAS PARA CONTRIBUIR AL GASTO FAMILIAR. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO TEPEYAC 5 JUNTO CON DOÑA FATIMA DE LA PAZ B. Y. (VENTA DE TOPPERS) E IRENE DEL ROSARIO M. C. (VENTA DE COLCHAS, COBIJAS, SOBRECAMAS, EDREDONES).

loans.use: To purchase additional shoes. (COMPRA DE CALZADO)

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 30 years old. He is married and has three children. One of them was born six months ago. He is living in his parents' house. He has a small shop of spare parts and he applied to borrow $1200 to purchase new spare parts. He also wants to make new shelves and renovate the shop and make advertising to improve his life and increase his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new spare parts

loans.name: Sissi

texts.fr:
Mme. Sissi A. was born in 1965 in Koutidji. She lives with her husband in Avétsèdomé in the department of Vo. She is married and the mother of six (06) children. Her main activity is the sale of essential foodstuff. The income she derives from this activity allows her to contribute to the budget of the household. But this income is far from meeting the needs of the family, where poverty continues to rule. To improve her income and her living conditions, she is requesting this loan.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1965 à Koutidji, madame Sissi A. vit auprès de son mari à Avétsèdomé dans la préfecture de Vo. Elle est mariée et mère de six (06) enfants. Sa principale activité est la vente des produits alimentaires de première nécessité. Le revenu qu’elle tire de cette activité lui permet de participer à la gestion de son ménage. Mais ce revenu est très loin se satisfaire les besoins de sa famille où la misère continue par régner. Pour améliorer son revenu et ses conditions de vie, elle sollicite ce crédit.

loans.use: Stocking and sale of food products

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 51 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2003. She has one daughter who is attending a university. She used the borrowed money in breeding pigs and ducks. After 5 years of membership, her breeding projects went very effectively. She decided to borrow money to buy rice-husking machine to assist local people. Her family economy improves. She is able to pay the tuition fee for her daughter’s school and furnish her house. This time, she wants to borrow 575 USD to continue investing in pigs and ducks. Her average income is 250 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị H. 51 Tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2003, vợ chồng anh chi có 1 con gái hiện đang đi học đại học, khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lơn, vịt đẻ, sau 5năm tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị vay vốn đầu tư vào các dự án đều đem lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao, gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn mua máy sát gạo phục vụ nhu cầu của người dân quanh địa phương, kinh tế gia đình chị ngày một phát triển gia đình chị đã mua sắm được nhiều tiên nghi trong gia đình và đầu tư cho con đi học đại học. Vòng vốn này gia đình xin vay 9.000.000đ. tiếp tục đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi lợn và vịt đẻ. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: invest in breeding pigs and ducks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of shoes to replenish her stock.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en:
Khosiyat R., 35 years old and married with three children, has been selling office and school supplies for the past five years. Her husband is currently unemployed, so Khosiyat’s business is the family’s main source of income. Her  trading place is located in the central market, and the majority of her customers are schoolchildren. 

Khosiyat’s goods are currently in great demand as the opening of school approaches, so she would like to take this opportunity to increase the range of goods that she sells. Therefore she is requesting a loan of $600 for a term of 10 months to purchase additional supplies.  Khosiyat is hoping to continue in her entrepreneurial pursuit and achieve stability and success.

loans.use: To purchase addional supplies to sell

loans.name: Sharifa's Tusongembele. Group

texts.en:
Sharifa A. is 48 years old and married with one 15-year-old child. She is a charcoal and firewood seller. She works at this daily and earns a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

Sharifa is now looking for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood inventory for her business. She will share this loan with her group members, who have businesses selling clothes, bites, firewood, and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en: Ilhomjon is a hard-working person and he makes an effort to give his 4 beloved children the best. He decided to stay on his home land so that he could develop it, and now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he cultivates the land and feeds his animals. With experience gained over 8 years in the purchase and sales of cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family. He would now like to extend his cultivated lands and would also like to purchase cattle to create more income for his large family. For this reason, he is requesting a loan and Ilhomjon thanks you very much for your support.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand business.

loans.name: Koly (Pauvreté) Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Koly (2 veuves et  2  mariées) ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivent dans des foyers polygames dans le quartier Bounoukobougou de la préfecture de Yanfolila (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Unies par des relations économique et de voisinage, elles font la préparation et la vente de l’attièké (Semoule d’igname ou de patate sauvage). En plus elles font de la friandise de haricot, de mil etc.
Elles sont parténaires de l’institution SoroYiriwaso depuis maintenat 2 ans et sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire(prêt de groupe).Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, 240 kg de manioc avec les commercantes venant d’Odjéné (en république de la  Côte d’Ivoire), du poisson , de l’huile de l’oignon et du piment. Les autres ingrédints entrant dans la préparation de l’attièké sont achetés sur place au marché.
La clientèle est contituée de forains et des nombreux passagers qui transitent par Yanfolila en partance pour les républiques de la Guinée Conakry  ou   de la  Côte d’Ivoire.
La vente se fait au marché de Yanfolila sous des hangards aménagés à cet effet. Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice hebdomadaire de 10.000 FCFA soit au minimum  40.000 FCFA par mois qui servira à rembourser les intérêts du prêt et assurer certaines dépenses de la famille comme l’éducation des enfants, la santé , l’habillement ...etc.
texts.en:
The four women of the Koly group (2 widows, 2 married) have an average age of 40 years, 4 children, and live in polygamous households in the Bounoukobougou quarter in the Yanfolila prefecture (the third administrative region in the Republic of Mali). United by economic and neighborly relationships, the women make and sell attièké (semolina flour made from yams or wild potatoes). They also make candies out of beans, millet, etc. They have been partners with the Soro Yiriwaso institution for two years and are now on their fourth solidarity (or group) loan. All of their previous loans were repaid in full. The current loan will be used to by 240 kg of cassavas with the merchants coming from Odjéné (in the Republic of Côte d’Ivoire), fish, oil onion, and peppers. The other ingredients used in making attièké are purchased on-site at the market. The client base is made up of stallkeepers and numerous passengers who pass through Yanfolila on their way to Conakry, Guinea or Côte d’Ivoire. They sell their products at the Yanfolila market underneath makeshift sheds designed for that purpose. They each hope to make a weekly profit of 10,000 FCFA or at least 40,000 FCFA per month which will be used to pay the interest on the loan and to take care of certain family expenses such as the children’s education, healthcare, clothing, etc.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food items

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 21 años, es soltero, vive de forma independiente alquilado en un cuarto. Se dedica a la venta de frazadas en su pequeño puesto ubicado en la ciudad de Juliaca, el incursionó en este negocio hace 4 años, sabiendo que por estos lares el frío es inclemente y que las personas demandan de estos cobertores. Carlos aprendió a querer su trabajo, al ver las satisfacciones que le brinda, aunque no todo es color de rosa, ya que se ve obligado a viajar para adquirir sus productos a la ciudad de Desaguadero que queda a 3 horas y media aproximadamente de su ciudad natal, Juliaca, que es en donde vende estas frazadas. Se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de frazadas para vender en estas épocas.
texts.en:
Carlos is 21-years old and is single. He lives independently in a rented room. He has dedicated himself to the sales of small blankets in his small post in the city of Juliaca. He has been in business for the past 4-years, and knows what is needed in cold temperatures as people are demanding these blankets.

Carlos learned to love his job, seeing the satisfaction it offers, but not everything is so rosy as he’s obligated to travel to purchase products from the city of Desaguadero, which is approximately 3.5 hours from his hometown, Juliaca. It is in Juliaca where he sells his blankets. This is his second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and with these funds he will purchase a larger stock of blankets to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a supply of blankets to sell

loans.name: Kalanzi B-Prescade Group

texts.en:
Just like her other group members, Prescade N., 48, runs a restaurant in Kalanzi zone. With five years' experience in the business, she has gained popularity for her affordable but delicious and mouth-watering dishes. Her menu comprises matooke, katogo, chapatti, posho, rice, lumonde, cassava, vegetables, beef, chicken and fish among others. A plate of food goes for 1,000 Ugandan shillings (about 50 US cents) from which she earns a profit of 300 shillings.

Prescade is using the proceeds of this loan to purchase rice, green bananas for preparing matooke and maize flour for posho. She buys her supplies from Kikubamutwe market. The growth of her business is mainly attributed to good customer relationships and hygiene. She has employed two jovial, young ladies as waitresses.

Prescade is a single mother of six. She dreams of supplying green bananas to the market vendors to supplement her restaurant income. With a stable source of income, her desire will be to see her family prosper in all aspects of life.

Prescade will share this loan with the four other members of her group.

loans.use: To buy rice, green bananas and maize flour.

loans.name: Yav

texts.en:
S., 28, lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia where she owns a plot of land in front of her house for growing crops. She currently grows both rice and vegetables. She is a good mother to three children, all three of whom are still young.

To help cover the family's food needs, her husband is employed as a firewood seller. He sells firewood that he buys from the people who cut it from the forest. Since firewood is their main source of income, S. is asking for a loan for her husband to use as capital to buy more firewood to store for sale.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to store to sell

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes du groupe Dembagnouma sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles polygames, dans le village de TDJILA chef lieu de commune dans la commune de WATENI situé dans la sous préfecture de NIENA de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles menent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres l’achat – vente de céréales, de soumbala, des savons, d’arachide, des condiments et la restauration.
Elles sont à leur premier prêt (prêt solidaire) et comptent  l’utiliser pour acheter, 5 sacs de 100kg de céréales, 4 paquets de savons, 100 kilogrammes de grains de Néré pour faire le soumbala, 5 sacs d’arachides  et des condiments.
Elle s’approvisionnent  aux marchés de NIENA, de BOUGOULABA et de TDJILA  auprès de grossistes et producteurs  et revendent au marché de TDJILA; en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 8.780FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie investie dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
The ten women of the Dembagnouma group are all married and on average 33 years old with 5 children. They live in traditional polygamous families in the village of Tdjila, the administrative centre of the town of Wateni, situated in the sub-prefecture of Niena in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They run various businesses which include among others the preparation of food and the purchase, preparation, and re-sale of cereals, soumbala (a West African condiment made from fermented néré seeds), soaps, peanuts, and condiments.
