They are seeking their first group loan, which they intend to use to buy five 100-kg bags of cereals, 4 packs of soap, 100 kilograms of néré seeds to make soumbala, 5 bags of peanuts, and other condiments. They supply themselves at the markets in Niena, Bougoulaba, and Tdjila, from wholesalers and producers, and sell their goods at the market in Tdjila at retail and in cash to a clientele composed of men and women. They each foresee generating an average monthly profit of 8,780 FCFA, of which one portion will be used to meet their families' needs and the rest invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
D. ÁGUILA D. RAMÍREZ NORA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Almendras” con domicilio en el Jr. Espinar N° 293 D. distrito D. Calería, tiene 57 años, 07 hijos, y su cónyuge es actualmente trabajador jubilado.

El primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que incrementó su capital para algunas compras, para el negocio que tiene.  Ella se dedica a la venta D. comida en el mercado La Hoyada. 

El negocio le ha ido muy bien.
Con este crédito D. S/.1,200 Nuevos Soles, ella hará compras D. insumos, materia prima y otros que requiera, por ello comprará al por mayor maíz, arroz, por sacos, chancho para tener carne fresca, hojas D. plantas y otros insumos para la elaboración D. sus alimentos.

Dice: con Manuela Ramos he podido salir adelante, porque antes mi vida era una tristeza, agradezco a esta ONG y a mi amiga por haberme invitado a pertenecer a este Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Nora D. Águila D. Ramírez belongs to the communal bank, "Las Almendras." She is 57 and has 7 children. Her husband is currently retired. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to increase her capital for the business that she has. She sells food in La Hoyada market. Her business has gone very well for her. With this credit of 1,200 nuevos soles, she will purchase supplies and other items she needs. She will make wholesale purchases like corn, rice, pork to have fresh meat, plant leaves, and other items to make her dishes. She says, "With Manuela Ramos, I have been able to get ahead. Before my life was sad. I am thankful to this NGO and to my friend for inviting me to belong to this communal bank."

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies like corn, rice, pork, etc.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua B. is a trader who sells fresh fish and goods, such as utensils, in Elmina; she has been in business since 1999. She is married with five dependents and has received her junior high school diploma. While Ekua sells her wares, her husband is employed as a taxi driver. Ekua is responsible for helping to pay her children’s school fees.

The loan will be used to buy more fresh fish from the fishermen for resale and also to invest in the other goods to expand her business. She hopes to use her newly gained profit to complete the building of her house.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish for resale as well as other goods

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina es socia del Banco Comunal Tu Ángel Lucy.
Justina es viuda, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Justina tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende especerías como ají molido, ajo molido, productos que ella misma prepara, además vende verdura picadas.
Justina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de comino, pimienta, sal, ají colorado.
Los sueños de Justina son tener una tienda de abarrotes en su vivienda y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Justina is a member of the communal bank, Tu Ángel Lucy.

Justina is a widow, 45 years old, and has three children. Justina has a stall in the 12 de Abril market, in which she sells spices such as ground chili and garlic, products that she prepares herself. She also sells diced vegetables.

Justina needs a loan of 1,000 soles ($324 USD), money that she will invest in the purchase of cumin, pepper, salt and chilies.

Justina’s dreams are to have a grocery store in her home and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cumin, pepper, salt and chilies

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo B. is 41 years old and married with 6 children. She sells table water and juice. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more juice and table water to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more table water and juice to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is fifty-two years old. She is married and has four children, one son and three daughters. She says some are in senior high school while others are in a polytechnic. She lives with her children and husband in a family house in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer.

Mary is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey. Kenkey is prepared from corn dough. It is served hot with ground pepper and fried fish. She prepares the food in her house of residence and hawks to sell in her community. She procures bags of maize from the nearby communities. Mary also deals in all kinds of utensils. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. She is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es: Rossana tiene 31 años, vive con sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de comida al paso en la esquina de su casa, por la mañana prepara todo lo necesario para empezar a vender por las tardes. Una de las dificultades que se le presentan es la lluvia, ya que vende bajo una pequeña una carpa que no la protege en su totalidad del frió y ni del agua, a pesar de esto, Rossana se mantiene perseverante porque desea incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ya tuvo la experiencia del trabajar en equipo en otras organizaciones, pero ahora se ha comprometido con su banco comunal para apoyar en el crecimiento de todos. El dinero que está solicitando será utilizado para adquirir alimentos comestibles no perecibles (en grandes cantidades) y un balón de gas para su cocina.
texts.en:
Rossana, 31, lives with her 3 children. For 3 years, she's operated a business selling meals to passers-by at the corner by her house. She prepares what she needs during the morning so that she can sell her meals in the afternoon. One of the difficulties that she faces is rain. She has a small canopy under which she sells her meals but it doesn't completely protect her from the cold or the wet. Even so, Rossana perseveres because she wants to increase her income. This is her first MFP loan. She already has experience working in teams with other organizations, but now she's promised her community bank to help everyone grow. The money that she's requesting will be used to buy non-perishable food products (in large quantities) and a gas cylinder for her kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and equipment for food business.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy R. is 47 years old and married to Rhodora. They have two children. Rudy has been in farming since he was a small child. He owns a one-hectare farm that has gone far in providing for his family's basic needs, such as food, clothing, medicine and education.

Rudy is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. The loan will help him buy fertilizers and insecticides to ensure an abundant harvest on his farm. Rudy is happy as an active member of CEVI. He enjoys not just credit assistance, but training and insurance cover as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean M. is just 18 years old. But despite her age, she knows well the needs of her family. She wants to help especially to guarantee the education of her siblings. What she can do to help supplement the income in their household is planting vegetables, using the 2-hectare farm of her parents. She also is managing a rice farm. She thinks that with her own way of managing their family business, she will be able to help her family a lot.

She wants to make their business grow, that is why, after hearing about Community Economic Ventures Inc. and how it helps people have their own business, she applied for a loan worth Php 7,000. She will use her loan to purchase 1 sack of fertilizer and as payment for labor.

Now, she is happy having the loans, training and insurance coverage services that CEVI offers to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase 1 sack of fertilizer and as payment for labor

loans.name: Diakaridia

texts.fr:
Monsieur Diakaridia Konaté est âgé de 36 ans marié et père de 4 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez son feu père dans le quartier Faraba de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Suite au décès de son père, il revenait à  Monsieur Diakaridia Konaté (aîné de la famille)  de  prendre la famille en charge (conformément à la coutume). Très vite il commença les activités génératrices de revenus car il n’a pas été scolarisé.
Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités sans succès, il finit  par opter pour le commerce, notamment la vente de merceries  qu’il  a appris auprès de son ami.  Avec 8 années d’expérience, il maîtrise son activité et est très sollicité.
Afin d’obtenir un fonds de commerce complémentaire, Monsieur Diakaridia Konaté décide de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour une acheter de la mercerie à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Il  effectue sa vente dans sa boutique, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de tailleurs de la place et des localités environnantes.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Diakaridia Konaté compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 28 000 FCFA qu’il utilisera pour améliorer son entreprise et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Diakaridia Konaté, age 36, is the father of four children. He lives with his wife and children in his late father’s house in the Faraba district of the city of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Following his father’s death, it came upon Mr. Konaté (the eldest in the family) to be responsible for the family (conforming to custom). He soon started a business to earn an income because he had no formal education. After having tried several kinds of work unsuccessfully, he finally opted for commerce, especially in sewing supplies, a business he learned from a friend of his. With eight years of experience, he has a command of his business and is much in demand. In order to obtain supplemental capital, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first individual loan. He intends to use this loan to buy sewing supplies in Bamako (capital of Mali). He makes his sales out of his shop to customers composed essentially of tailors in the area and from surrounding towns. With this loan, he plans on realizing a monthly profit of 28,000 francs CFA that will be used to improve his enterprise and to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Pablo Esnider

texts.es: Don Pablo es soltero, de 53 años de edad, trabaja en el Supermercado San Antonio como Director Financiero desde hace 16 años, ademas cuenta con un negocio de un taxi que le genera ingresos adicionales, tiene hijos los cuales son mayores de edad pero siempre les brinda su apoyo.  Esta solicitando su 1er credito para ponerle ceramica a su casa de habitacion pues actualmente el piso es embaldosado y el que se encuentra en mal estado, y de esta manera mejoraria sus condiciones de vida.

loans.use: Poner ceramica a su casa

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Many people say that sometimes poverty is one of the reasons why young women and men decided to get married at their young age, they out of school nothing to do so would think to get married early. But to Lucia I. even if married to Rodney I. at an early age she never think that it just that nothing to do, she loves the man and together with him she wants to get out of poverty. Lucia now is 22 years old with two children, Sheina Marie 3 years old and Pauline Kaye only 1 year old.

Their marriage life is never been that easy, her husband is a fisherman and she in order to help her husband to get an extra income, she do the buy and sell of different kind of fish. When she first joined and loan to Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) she used this as capital for this kind of business. Now, the business contributes to their income, but she wants a much higher income so she decided to loan again to ASHI to buy another set of different things that found in the sea, that can be eaten by a typical Filipino, to sell like bangus (kind of fish that found in the sea in the Philippines), shrimps, prawn, crabs for more income.

Lucia experience a lot of hard things being a poor, so she doesn’t want to experience that by her children, that’s why now she make sure to have a savings that came from the revenue of their business for the education of her two children.

loans.use: Will be used to buy different kinds of fish to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace un año tiene un kiosko donde vende comestibles y golosinas, este negocio es una fuente importante para la generación de ingresos económicos. Cada día, Yolanda se dedica a realizar una atención esmerada y una de las ventajas que tiene es que está ubicada en una zona que garantiza sus ventas. Sus hijos también el ayudan en la atención, en especial cuando ella tiene que salir a comprar más mercadería. El deseo a futuro de Yolanda es de mejorar la estructura de su kiosko e incrementar la cantidad de productos que ofrece.
Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada a formar parte de un banco comunal porque la conocen como una persona muy responsable. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su kiosko, tanto golosinas como abarrotes.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Florely

texts.en:
Florely Q. has managed her furniture-making business for 5 years, since she was 25.  At first she told herself the business was only a trial. Now that she has managed her business for five years she is molded and guided by her favorite principle in life, which is “try and try until you succeed”. She is married to Marvin Q., a farmer and her partner in managing her business. They have two children: John Camilo, 11  and a girl, Zyrine, who is 9. They are both in elementary school.

She is living with her family happily and they help each other to maintain good family bonds. Her dream is to expand her business to have a Carinderia, a small eatery where she sells meat and fish. She wants to borrow Php 6,000 for additional capital to buy products to be able to increase her income.

loans.use: additional capital for  business expansion

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a client of Asociación Arariwa. She is a member of a communal bank that consists 15 neighbors who live in Ccorao, a town that is 30 minutes from Cusco, Peru. The loan group is called Reynita de Belen de Ccorao and is named after a virgin of Peru. Victoria is from Ccorao. She is 40 years old and is single. She sells a Peruvian grain called "tarwi" (See a description of tarwi in Wikipedia) in a nearby market. She earns approximately 400 soles every week, which is equivalent to approximately $140 USD. She says that the money that Arariwa lends her helps her business to grow. With this loan, she will buy more tarwi to sell. Victoria appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy more grains to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 8 años se viene dedicando al reciclaje. Junto a su esposo recolectan y compran todo tipo D. chatarra y objetos inservibles, los cuales veden por kilos. Maria compra y venD. por kilos, ella considera que este método le brinda mejores ganancias, siendo un proceso difícil la obtención D. toda su mercadería. Maria dice que lo que para muchos es inservible, para ella es una fuente D. ingresos muy rentable, por lo que se siente satisfecha con su labor.

Esta es la tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona muy responsable, porque cumple con lo que promete, por ello es muy apreciada en su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. más materiales artículos reciclables.
texts.en:
Maria, 46, lives with her husband and their two children in her own house. She has been working in recycling for eight years. Together, she and her husband collect and buy all types of junk and objects that are not serviceable. They sell them in kilos. Maria buys and sells by the kilo. She feels that this method offers better income. Getting all of her merchandise is a difficult process. Maria says that what is unserviceable to others is a very profitable source of income for her. Therefore, she is satisfied with her work. This is her third opportunity to have a loan with MFP. She is a very responsible person because she always keeps her promises. That is why she is much appreciated in her communal bank. She will use the money she is asking for to buy more recyclable material.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is 37 years old and married with five children between the ages of nine and sixteen. She has a business selling fish in the Kawangware area of Nairobi. She sells Tilapia and has been in business for fifteen years. She describes herself as a very focused and determined woman.

She successfully completed a previous loan from the Kiva field partner, Faulu, for 20,000 KES and says since she joined Faulu she has been able to expand her business and is now also selling clothing. She requested this loan of 40,000 KES from Faulu to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she hopes to have a full clothing shop and become a wholesale fish supplier.

loans.use: Add stock of fish

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun M. is a 57-year-old woman who is the widowed mother of four children. Two of her children are married and currently live without a family home, while the other two are single. They all work at different jobs and provide their little income to meet what the family needs. Sun M. sells vegetables in the local busy market. In the past, she hired a taxi at a high cost to take her vegetables to the market and right now she is hoping to eliminate these expenses by using her first loan to buy a used motorcycle to use as transportation.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle to transport vegetables to market

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito P., age 27, manages a rice farm. Although he is a young man, he is already mature  to handle a business. He says that farming is their only source of livelihood and now, he needs money for his business to sustain his livelihood. 

Joselito joined the CEVI program and is hoping to receive a loan of Php 5,000 to buy farm supplies to grow his rice.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Watékou

texts.fr: Ce Monsieur est un célibataire sans enfants qui effectue comme activité génératrice de revenus le commerce de détail des produits de première nécessité. Il a démarré ses activités en 2008 dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. ce commerce lui permet de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins. En ce moment il souhaite associé à son commerce la vente de carte de recharge togocel il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 300 cartes  de recharge Togocel de 450 FCFA, 200 cartes de recharge de 1 000FCFA, 25 cartes de recharge de 2000 FCFA et 25 cartes de recharge de 4 500 FCFA.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a bachelor without children, who generates income through retail sales of basic necessities. He began this activity in 2008, in the Agoé area of Lomé. He can meet most of his needs through this business. At this time he would like to add the sale of Togocel telephone cards to his retail activities. He is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 300 Togocel phone cards at 450 FCFA, 200 cards at 1,000 FCFA, 25 cards at 2,000 FCFA, and 25 cards at 4,500 FCFA.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy telephone cards

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys, de 32 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y luchadora. Viven en la casa que le heredaron sus padres junto a su esposo Guido, de 26 años, y con su querida hija Tayhua de un año, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de billeteras, gorras, adornos, etc. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, sale a vender sus productos por los alrededores del mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca). Su negocio marcha muy bien, ya que los productos que vende son muy novedosos y siempre llaman la atención de la gente.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene la libertad para decidir en qué momentos salir a vender. Lleva 3 años realizando está actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes. 
Para más adelante, espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad su mercadería.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Gladys con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo para poder acceder a otro. En su banco comunal es muy activa y siempre participa de todas las decisiones que se toman. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos productos, para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de dónde elegir.
texts.en:
Gladys, 32, is a mother who is very hard working and a fighter. She lives with her husband Guido, 26, and their beloved one-year-old daughter Tayhua in the house that she inherited from her parents. Her husband and daughter are the reason for all of her hard work. Gladys makes a living selling wallets, caps, etc. Every day she leaves very early in the morning to sell her products around the San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). Her business is going well, since the products she sells are very new and always draw people’s attention. The thing Gladys likes most about her work is that she is free to choose when she goes out to sell her products. She has made a living in this business for 3 years, and says that the most difficult part of her job is that she walks all day looking for customers. In the future she hopes to have a store where she can sell her products more comfortably. This is Gladys’s third loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she understands the responsibility of paying her loan on time so that she can gain access to another loan. She is very active in her communal bank and always participates in all of the decisions that they make. Gladys is requesting a loan of 2000 soles and will use the money to purchase new products so that she can offer her customers a larger variety of products to choose from.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise

loans.name: Elma Cale Group

texts.en:
Elma C. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Elma is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Elma is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Elma owns and operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Elma has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $100 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Elma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 35 años, vive con su esposa Domitila (en la foto) y su hija Camila, en su casa propia.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a brindar servicios eléctricos a domicilio de forma independiente, mientras que su esposa se encarga de las labores del hogar. Generalmente, Alfredo trabaja durante todo el día y gracias a su profesionalismo se ha hecho de fieles clientes, quienes confían en la calidad de su trabajo y es por ello que su actividad le resulta rentable. Para este tipo de oficio se necesita trabajar con buenos materiales, los cuales sean seguros, ya que es un trabajo muy riesgoso, por lo que Alfredo toma muchas precauciones al respecto.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete ser muy puntual con el pago de todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará las herramientas que le hacen falta para el cumplimiento de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 35 years old and lives in his own home with his wife Domitila (in the photo) and their daughter Camila. For the past five years he has been working independently doing home electrical work, while his wife takes care of the home. Alfredo generally works during the day and thanks to his professionalism, he has established loyal customers who trust in the quality of his work. This is why his work is very profitable. This type of work is risky and requires quality materials, so Alfredo takes many precautions. This will be his first loan through MFP and he promises to make all of his payments on time. He will use the money to buy some tools that he needs for his work.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools

loans.name: Gracias A Dios Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Gracias a Dios esta ubicado en la colonia Morazan, esta integrado por 3 mujeres que se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo atras, a continuacion se detalla las diferentes actividades que ellas relizan:
La señora Noemy Esperanza Z. F. tiene  de 53 años de edad, vive en union libre y se dedica a la venta de golosinas y refrescos, tiene unos 20 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. utilizara el credito para comprar carnes, verduras y refrescos.
la sra. Santos Abadesa Z. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en union libre, tiene 2 hijos, Santos tiene un negocio de venta de comidas frente a la ferreteria San Francisco en donde vende carne asada, tacos, enchiladas y frescos naturales, utilizara el credito para invertirlo en su negocio, comprar carnes, frijoles, tortillas, refrescos, papas, verduras, etc.
la sra. Francis Azucena H. F. tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un negocio de pulperia en su casa de habitacion, en donde vende abarroteria en general, utilizara el credito para surtur mas su pulperia.
texts.en:
The “Gracias a Dios” (Thanks be to God) communal bank is in the Morazan neighborhood and is composed of three women who have known each other for a long time. Following are their various commercial activities: Noemy Esperanza Z. F., 53, lives in a common law union; she sells snacks and soft-drinks. She has been in this line of work for about 20 years and will use the funds to buy meats, vegetables and soft-drinks. Santos Abadesa Z., 40, lives in a common law union and has two children. She sells prepared meals across from the San Francisco hardware store; she sells grilled meat, tacos, enchiladas and fruit juices. She will use the funds to buy meat, beans, tortillas, beverages, potatoes, vegetables, etc. Francis Azucena H., 33, is a single mother and has a grocery store in her home where she sells assorted groceries. She will use the funds to buy stock items for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans, soft-drinks, bread, coffee, cookies, rice, lard, cooking oil, churros, sauces, pasta, soups, salt, spices, meats, vegetables, cheeses, manioc, fruits, sugar, and water.

loans.name: Feviiai

texts.en:
Feviiai E. is 39 and married with 3 children.  She owns a business venture, selling fabric handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Feviiai has 5 years of experience in this business.  Feviiai needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Feviiai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Asmat's Group

texts.en:
Asmat is the wife of M. U. and comes from Multan, a city famous for its shrines and sweetmeats in Pakistan. She is 40 years old, married with two children: one son and one daughter. Her husband and her kids work at a photo frame-making business. They are very talented and can frame every picture. They also do calligraphy and then sell at markets and earn income. Their earning allows them to manage the financial expenses of the family. 

Asmat also operates her own decorative embroidery business. She makes embroidery on suits and earns profit. Her clientele base is made up of women. She receives order from her neighbors. Her earning allows her to share the financial burden of her family. 

She has successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan again to purchase items (mirrors and paints and paint brushes) in bulk so her family can make more frames and make calligraphy and earn a good profit from it.

loans.use: Purchase items for her photo frame-making business

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
A 40 cette femme reste une dame très dynamique, elle exerce depuis 2000 le commerce de détail de riz, d’haricots et d’huile.elle maîtrise bien la gestion de son commerce  grâce à son  expérience. Le stock dont elle dispose actuellement ne  lui permet de  satisfaire la demande de ses clients. Elle souhaite se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour achat de sacs d’haricots et de bidons d’huile.
Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants.
texts.en:
At 40 years old, this woman remains very dynamic. Since 2000, she has practiced the selling of rice, beans, and oil. She has mastered the management of her business due to her experience. Her available merchandise does not allow her to satisfy the demands of her clients. She would like to re-stock and is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy bags of beans and drums of oil. She is married and the mother of four children.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bags of rice, beans and oil

loans.name: Damian

texts.es:
El señor Damián tiene 40 años está casado con la señora Reyna y tienen 3 hijos de (10,8 y 2) años los cuales estudian en la primaria, son una familia de escasos recursos económicos. 

Es señor Damián vive en la Ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de Esmeralda Norte, tienen una pequeña casa que falta terminar de construir ya que solamente cuenta con dos habitaciones. Una ocupan los padres y la otra para los tres hijos en la cual se encuentren muy incómodos.

El señor Damián tiene un pequeño aserradero en su domicilio del cual vende toda clase de madera a las carpinterías de la zona para la fabricación de muebles.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de tronco, el cual compra con todos los permisos y autorizaciones necesarias por la ABT (Autoridad de control Social de Bosques y Tierras) y de esta manera prever materia prima para aserrar madera y de esta manera vender en tiempo de lluvia.

Entre sus sueños y metas es tener una mueblería y así de esa manera tener una pequeña empresa, su meta más importante a corto plazo es realizar una construcción con habitaciones para cada uno de sus hijos, con lo cual estarán mas cómodos cada uno de ellos.
texts.en:
Sr. Damián is 40 years old and married to Sra. Reyna. They have three children (ages 10, 8, and 2), of whom two are attending elementary school. His family has limited financial resources.

Sr. Damián lives in the community of Esmeralda Norte in the city of Cochabamba. He has a small house that is still in the middle of construction. Only two of the bedrooms are occupied. His parents stay in one room while his three children occupy the other, which makes conditions very uncomfortable for everyone.

Sr. Damián operates a small sawmill out of his home where he sells all types of wood to carpenters in the area for making furniture. This loan will be used to buy tree trunks. He has all the required permits and authorizations from the ABT (the local forestry and land management authority) and the necessary equipment for sawing wood that he can sell during the rainy season.

One of his dreams is to open a furniture store so that he can have his own small business. Most importantly, his short-term goal is to finish the construction of the bedrooms for each of his children so that they will be more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tree trunks to turn into lumber

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi D. is single and sells corn at Abura. She travels to buy maize in sacks to returns to sell it to her customers. She has not been to school.

Esi requests the loan she hopes to get to buy additional bags of maize to sell to her increasing number of customers. The income she is able to generate from her sales is used to pay her rent.

Esi hopes to invest in palm oil and selling raw cassava to expand her business. More so, she plans to save to build a house for herself and her future children.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny R. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Sarun Am, have been married since 1991 and have two sons; one is adopted and he is a policeman and another one attends school. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh about 17 kilometers away.

Mrs. Vanny has been a rice farmer for more than twenty years, while her husband has been selling cows for more than ten years. Besides the business, he is a construction worker as well. 

Vanny asked for a Kiva loan one time already. She now is requesting her second loan of US$ 600 to add to her own money to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To add to her own money to buy a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Kousar Perveen

texts.en: Kousar perveen lives with her family in a three-room, brick house in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a seamstress and provides her services to neighborhood clients. She is also a very good mother who worries for the future of her only son who has a welding shop in a nearby market. He welds electric equipment and returns them to working condition. He has been doing this work for over six years. Kousar has applied for a loan from Asasah for her son so he can buy another welding machine. She is hopeful that with this loan, she will be able to help her son in his business in a positive manner.

loans.use: To purchase another welding machine

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma L. is from the village of Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Erma owns and operates a specialized retail store selling products like blankets and pillow cases.  Erma has been engaged in business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Erma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erma is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

-------------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Smoking and selling fish

loans.name: Alishakh

texts.en: Alishakh S. is married and has 2 children. He runs a small grocery business in Agsu city. His shop is located on the main market aisle where there are many customers every day.  Alishakh has been in this business for over 10 years. Alishakh  started his business with his first loan from AqroInvest, which he successfully repaid. He is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. His professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure rapid growth and success of his business.  Now his monthly income is about 300-450 AZN. Alishakh is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN to increase the assortment of his selling inventory. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profits. We believe that Alishakh 's ability to identify tasks critical to business success and set up a system for accomplishing them will allow him to continue growing in the sphere of private entrepreneurship.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for his grocery.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married. He has been in business for five years. He started as a taxi driver. Later, he began to help people with various construction projects. About a year ago he was able to open his own store, selling plumbing and construction materials. Sergei is very entrepreneurial. He wants to develop this business further and serve many satisfied clients.

Sergei is requesting a loan of 10,000 hryvnias to purchase more inventory for his store. He would like to invest the money he makes back into this business. Sergei's wife and two sons help him with this business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Erita Argentina

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente dedicada  en gran parte a la agricultura y cría de  animales, se reúne cada quince días  El Banco Comunal Quiroga.

La señora Erita tiene 49 años de edad,  mantiene una relación de unión libre hace muchos años y tiene 4  hijos todos mayores de edad y solo uno de ellos vive en su casa, a pesar de que todos viven cerca de ella. Su marido tiene un kiosco en calceta donde vende refrescos.

Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de dulces en el centro, por la cooperativa de transportes Calceta  junto al kiosco que tiene su marido, ella tiene una vitrina donde ofrece sus productos que son muy solicitados en especial por las personas que viajan a otras ciudades. Trabajan todos los días desde las 7 am hasta las 17h00, los dulces los compra en Junín.

Este crédito lo va a compartir la mitad para comprar dulces para su negocio y la otra parte para el negocio de  su marido para que compre frutas y jarabe para los refrescos. Este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque no hay que hacer  tantos trámites para recibir los créditos. 

Su sueño es gozar de salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
In the Quiroga parrish in the city of Calceta, an area where people are dedicated in large part to farming and raising animals, the Quiroga Community Bank meets every 15 days.

Erita is 49 years old. She has maintained a common-law relationship for many years and has four adult children and only one of them lives in her house although all live close to her. Her husband has a kiosk in Calceta where he sells refreshments.

She has a small business selling candy in the center of town at the Calceta transportation cooperative next to her husband's kiosk. She has a display case where she offers her products that are in high demand, especially by the people who are traveling to other cities. They work every day from 7AM until 5PM. They purchase the sweets in Junín.

She is going to split this loan in half and use it to buy candy for her business and to buy fruit and syrups for the refreshments for her husband's business. This is her fourth loan with the community bank and she like it because she doesn't have to complete as many procedures in order to receive the loan.

Her dream is to enjoy good health so she can continue working.

loans.use: Purchase fruits, syrup, caramels, chocolates, gum, lollipops, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock more bags of groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.en:
A. Ulugbek is 38 years old. He is married with two children. He has a great passion for dairy farming and has been in this business for 6 years together with his wife. Ulugbek would like to expand his business by adding more cattle to the ones he has. This is because recently he acquired orders from outside town to supply milk. He is requesting a loan of 5900 Somoni. With additional income Ulugbek will be better able to cater for his family financial obligations, especially the education of his children.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Yanci Marilú

texts.es: Yanci Marilú G. C. de 27 años de edad, es una joven trabajadora, quien vive junto a su madre y su hermana menor, junto a las cuales trabaja en el negocio familiar. Ella posee una granja en la cual se dedica a criar gallinas las cuales posteriormente comercializa y así mismo vende sus huevos, este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos con la cual cuenta esta familia por lo que es muy importante sacarlo adelante. Yanci solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más gallinas, así mismo comprar concentrado, vitaminas y antibióticos para el cuidado de ellos. Yanci cuenta con muchos clientes, ya que es una persona muy responsable quien desempeña su trabajo de la mejor manera, brindando un excelente producto. Yanci depende en gran manera de este negocio, ya que es así como junto a su madre logran solventar todos sus gastos en el hogar.
texts.en: 27-year-old Yanci Marilú G. C. is a young worker who lives with her mother and younger sister. She works along with them in the family business. She has a farm where she raises hens, which she later sells. She also sells the eggs. This business is the only source of income for the family, which is why it is very important for them to carry it forward. Yanci is requesting a loan that will give her the money necessary to buy more hens and to buy feed, vitamins and antibiotics to raise them. Yanci has a lot of customers since she is a responsible person who carries out her work in the best way possible, yielding an excellent product. Yanci is very dependent on this business, since it is how she and her mother meet the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy hens to sell.

loans.name: Farrah

texts.en:
Farrah C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 22 years old and married. She has 1 child, aged 1 year and 4 months. She is a farmer, just like her husband. They both cultivate their land for planting and harvesting rice crops. Farrah hopes to increase their harvest and earn more. She plans to save for her child's education in the near future.

Farrah needs additional farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. She has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI), a KIVA partner. She will use the loan to fund her farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farming inputs

loans.name: Maria Etelvina

texts.en:
Etelvina is forty-six years old.  She lives in the village of Sandial in the district of Pitipo, a region of northern Peru near the cities of Lambayeque and Chiclayo.  She shares her home with her husband and their one young child.

Etelvina and her husband are farmers.  They both raise animals and manage a small plot of farm land.  Etelvina raises pigs and turkeys.  Her husband primarily tends to the land, raising yellow corn.  She plans to use the loan to complete the next farm planting and purchase additional feed for her animals.

This will be Etelvina’s second loan funded through Kiva.  She paid punctually and used the previous loan responsibly.  She has used a portion of the funds from this loan to repay the previous loan.  She has good personal and business references from her community and other businesses.  Edpyme Alternativa is proud to be able to work with her and assist her in meeting her goals.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for planting corn and feed for animals

loans.name: Isika

texts.en: Isika is a member of Faulu Kenya under Faraja Yetu group.  She joined the group so that she can easily access loans from Faulu Kenya.  She sells milk to earn a living.  To boost her income, she also sells food.  Being a single mother of two, she works hard in her business so she can provide for her family.  She dreams of expanding her business into wholesale in the future.  She has requested for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy milk.

loans.use: To buy milk

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 45 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su esposo, y sus  4 hijos, los cuales aun estudian en el colegio.Luz cose camisas, pantalones y sabanas, que luego que las termina, las vende  en los diversos mercados de su zona. Ella tiene varios clientes, que saben de la calidad de sus trabajos, y  no dudan en hacerles más cantidad de pedidos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es realizar los trazos de los moldes de las prendas, y las trata de hacer las más perfectas posibles para darle un buen acabado a sus prendas. Es así que, desde los 16 años, realiza  esta labor que tanto le apasiona, pero piensa que su labor puede ser más eficaz  con una máquina remalladora para mejorar los  acabados de las prendas, y es por esta razón que  para mas adelante quiere comprar esta máquina. Tiene planeado  para el futuro, equipar su taller de confecciones en su casa y de ese modo espera  mejorar su calidad de vida.Es el 11avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar  puntualmente  sus cuotas, pues  desea  obtener mejoras para su negocio. En su grupo comunal, es un socia muy responsable y siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de su grupo.Luz tiene planeado invertir el  dinero solicitado en la compra de  telas de algodón y polipima, pues  son  telas frescas apropiadas para la estación de verano.
texts.en:
Luz, age 45, lives in her own house with her husband and their four children.  They children are still in school.

Liz makes shirts, pants, and sheets.  She then sells them at the different markets in her zone.  She has several customers who know the quality of her work, and they do not hesitate to place more orders with her.  What she likes most about her work is drawing the patterns for the garments.  She tries to make them as perfect as possible so that the garments are of good quality.  

She has been doing this work, which she is passionate about, for 16 years.  However, she thinks that her work could be more efficient with an overlock machine to improve the finishings on the clothes.  That is why she wants to buy this machine in the future.  In the future she plans to equip her seamstress shop in her house.  That way she hopes to improve her quality of life.

This is her eleventh loan with MFP.  She pledges to make her payments on time because she wants to get improvements for her business.  She is a very responsible member of her communal bank, and she is always concerned about the group’s well-being.

Luz plans to use the requested loan to buy cotton and polycotton fabrics.  They are cool fabrics that are appropriate for the summer season.

loans.use: To buy fabrics to improve her business

loans.name: Maria Elsy

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 60 años de edad, reside en San Miguel departamento de San Miguel, donde vive junto a su esposo, posee una tienda que nació por iniciativa propia, atendiendo todos los días de 6:00am a 7:00pm, este negocio tiene 15 años de existir y hasta el momento les ha solventado las necesidades del hogar.
Ella por el momento desea invertir en mercadería por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar arroz, pollo, azúcar, aceite, esta compra le ayudara a fortalecer la tienda, ofrecerá más productos a los clientes y espera que sus ventas aumenten.
Para doña María este negocio de tantos años, en el que ha trabajado mucho y del que ha obtenido ingresos para sostener al día los gastos del hogar, espera que siga siendo rentable y que le estabilice su condición económica.
texts.en:
Doña María, age 60, lives with her husband in the San Miguel department of San Miguel. She started her own store 15 years ago. It's open every day from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. The income from this business is enough to cover María's household expenses. She is now requesting a loan to invest in merchandise such as rice, chicken, sugar, and oil. 

This purchase will strengthen the store by allowing María to offer more products to her customers and thus, to increase her sales income. María has worked hard to build her business and hopes that it will remain profitable enough to support her economically.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, chicken, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani belongs to Okara which is a small city of Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in the area of Tariq colony with her family in a 2 room brick house. She moved here 10 years ago. She is 33 years old, married to M. A. who is an electrician by profession. His shop is located in the community area and he offers quality electrical repair services to his customers. 

Rani is the mother of 2 sons and a daughter. 2 of them are enrolled in a local high school and getting their education while youngest one is only 5 years old and has not started his education yet. Rani is a seamstress and stitches clothes for her neighboring clients. She charges $2 per cloth and the earning helps her to pay for her children school fee.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s business. With the loan he will buy the latest repair tools which will help him to perform better services for his customers. 

Rani is very hopeful that her husband’s business will be expanded further after the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In her previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy repair tools

loans.name: Tukolerewamu Association Bakijjulula-Mityana Group

texts.en:
Twenty-six-year-old Recheal K. is a chapatti seller in Mityana Town. Although a highly competitive business, during her six months of operation she has been able to make significant ends meet out of it. Recheal ekes out some additional profits from her tea sales trade. This business earns her 100,000 shillings weekly as profit.

She is requesting this loan to purchase more cooking oil to fry more of the chapattis that she sells to old and new clients alike. Recheal is affiliated with Tukolerewamu Association Bakijjulula Group.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta tiene 57 años y es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que busca el bienestar de su familia, ella trabaja en la chacra, en el hogar y en su pequeña chichería, ella vive en la Comunidad de San Isidro de Chicon que se encuentra ubicado a 15 minutos  de la ciudad de Urubamba, Cusco – Perú. En la comunidad de Chicon los pobladores se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura. Modesta se dedica a la venta de chicha, siembra tubérculos, hortalizas, verduras y también se cría animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y chanchos.  Modesta requiere el microcrédito para comprar jora. 

Modesta pertenece al banco comunal “Los Dinámicos de San Isidro de Chicon” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Modesta, 57, is an enterprising, hard working woman seeking her family’s wellbeing. She works her fields, does her household chores and tends to her small chichería (shop selling chicha-a drink made from fermented corn).  She lives in the community of San Isidro de Chicón located 15 minutes from the city of Urubamba, Cusco, Perú.  Chicón’s residents are mostly farmers and raise livestock.  

Modesta raises small farm animals like guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and other small animals and also sells chicha and farms tubers, leafy green vegetables and vegetables.  Modesta needs the microloan to buy jora (a type of chicha).

Modesta is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Los Dinámicos de San Isidro de Chicón” (San Isidro de Chicón’s Dynamic Ones) communal bank and she is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means; she also commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy jora.

location.town: San Isidro de Chicon- Urubamba - Cusco

loans.name: Cellu... Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Cellu” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown. They are requesting a loan of SLL 4,100,000.00 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to expand their businesses.
 
The leader of this group is Hawa K.. Hawa is aged 37 years-old and was born in a place call Magbangba, in western Sierra Leone. Currently, Hawa is residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary school. 

Hawa sells market-food and has been doing this business for six years now. With her share of this loan, she W. buy rice, palm-oil, groundnuts, onions, pepper, margi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste) gari (fast food made out of cassava roots), and many more items in bulk in order to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm-oil, groundnuts, onions, pepper, margi cubes, gari, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more modern equipment for his barber shop

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Hawa T.. She is married and has five children aged 19, 17,11, 9 and 2 years. 

In the year 2009, Hawa established her provision, imported food and drinks business. She began her business with the hope of generating enough income to help her husband support their family. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 400,000 SLL every month. 

Hawa needs a loan in order to buy additional provisions, imported food and drinks for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 100,000. 

In the future, Hawa plans to get a house for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drinks, imported food and provisions such as milk, sugar and margarine.

loans.name: Mario Pedro

texts.es: El Sr. Mario se dedica al servicio de transporte con vehículo de su propiedad, y cuando no trabaja con su auto, se dedica a trabajar como mecánico, tiene una experiencia de varios años en dicha actividad después de mucho sacrificio compro su auto, vive en domicilio de su propiedad junto a su familia, solicita el monto para la refacción de su vehículo ya que este sufrió un accidente y tiene que realizar la refacción de su vehículo para poder retomar la actividad de transporte, es una persona trabajadora con ganas de superación y se encuentra agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mario provides transportation services with his vehicle.  When he isn’t working with his car, he works as a mechanic.  He has several years’ experience and bought a car after many years of sacrifice.  He lives in his own place with his family.

He is asking for this loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle because it was in an accident and he needs to repair it so he can resume his transportation services.  He is a hard working person with a desire to get ahead.  He is grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 44 years old and a mother of two children, aged 28 years and 13 years old. She has rental houses as her primary business, which she has been doing for 11 years. Besides this, she also sells porridge in the Dallas Kangemi area. 

Pauline plans to buy iron sheets for 25,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs), nails and paint for Kshs 20,000 and timber for Kshs 25,000. With the returns from her business, she wants to expand the business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for 25,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs), nails and paint for Kshs 20,000 and timber for Kshs 25,000.

loans.name: Xiomara  Del Carmen

texts.en: Xiomara, a 37-year-old single mother of a 12 year-old, has been selling clothing in the local market for the last three years.  An extremely hard worker, Xiomara’s only wish is to be able to continue providing adequately for her son and herself.  The loan will assist Xiomara to buy a new inventory of clothes to sell during the upcoming family-focused holidays.

loans.use: to buy a new inventory of clothes.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Don Carlos hace 5 años queda desempleado y decide montar un negocio para poder tener el sustento diario. Él inicia con un saltarín pero no le da resultado, luego decide vender por las calles dulces y mecato y tampoco le permitía tener un buen ingreso y luego inicia la venta de minutos y este negocio desde  hace un par de años es el que le da una buena calidad de vida.

El quiere tener unos buenos planes de celular que le permitan tener más cantidad de minutos para vender, además poder dotar el espacio donde vende los minutos en la calle con una sombrilla para cubrirse del clima.
texts.en:
Don Carlos had been unemployed for five years before deciding to start his own business to support himself. He started out operating an inflatable bounce house, but it did not do very well. Carlos later decided to sell candy and boxed lunches, but neither of these products allowed him to generate a good income. Eventually he started selling mobile phone minutes and has been in business for two years. This has enabled him to have a good quality of life.

Carlos wants to obtain a few good cellular plans so that he can offer better quality minutes to sell. In addition, he hopes to acquire a space where he can sell minutes on the streets with an umbrella to protect himself from the elements.

loans.use: to acquire a space where he can sell mobile phone minutes.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is now 47 years old. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. Janette is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 5,000 per month. 

Janette is asking for a loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her farm. Janette grows rice and has been in rice production for almost 30 years.

In the future, Janette hopes to have a plentiful harvest so that she can earn income to support the education of their children. She is thankful that Kiva lenders offer financial assistance to improve their sources of income. She hopes that KIVA lenders will continuously assess her so that she can be able to start another kind of business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Beatrice Marie's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very please to present to you teachers of the Ansaru Primary School, situated in small town of Mile-Ninety-One, in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of SLL 7,500,000. Some of these teachers will invest their part of the loan in their businesses, others will pay school fees for their children. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible for repaying SMT on their behalf. 

Beatrice Marie is a teacher at the school and leader of this group. The 46-year-old has been in the teaching profession for 17 years. A native of Mile-Ninety-One, Beatrice Marie is married and has four children. She has requested a loan of SLL 3,00,000.00 to invest in agriculture, buy furniture for her house and house-building materials, and invest the rest in a small scale business.

loans.use: to invest in agriculture, buy furniture for her house and house- building materials, and invest the rest in a small business

loans.name: Blanca Bertha

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

Conocimos a la señora Blanca y ella nos cuenta algo de su vida, tiene 79 años de edad hace muchos años su esposo falleció y quedo sola pero de esa relación tuvo 5 hijos los mismos que ahora ya son mayores de edad. Uno de sus hijos que a pesar que es comprometido  aun vive con ella junto con su familia.

Ella para obtener algo para sus gastos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja los sábados y domingos en las ventas y cobranzas ya que deja a crédito y cobra al mismo tiempo que realiza sus ventas. La mercadería se la va a comprar un hijo a Guayaquil porque dice que allá se encuentran mayor variedad y a más bajos costos para que le quede mejores  ganancias. Lleva más de 16 años que se dedica a esta actividad y aun se mantiene ya que tiene muchos clientes que la prefieren.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el principio y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución.

Sus sueños son tener salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in the La Sequita parish, which belongs to the Montecristi cantón, which is a prosperous cantón of Manabí. It is known as the birthplace of the “Old Fighter”, Eloy Alfaro. It is also famous for the straw hats that are well-known in and outside the country [“Panama” hats]. 

We meet Blanca and she tells us some about her life. She is 79 years old. Her husband died many years ago and since then she has been alone. But she had 5 children from her marriage, all of whom are now grown. One of her sons is engaged, but continues to live with her, along with his family. 

In order to earn something for her expenses, she sells clothing of all kinds. She sells door to door. She works Saturdays and Sundays in sales and also charges customers at the same time she does her sales. One of her sons goes to Guyaquil for her to buy the merchandise because she says that there is a better variety there and the costs are lower, which leaves her with better income. She has been in this business for 16 years and she’s still doing it because she has many clients who prefer her.

She will use this loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and children’s clothing. She has been in the communal bank since its beginning and she likes it because of the additional benefits the institution provides. Her dream is to have good health so that she can continue get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina D. 47 años es madre D. familia, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana D. la provincia D. Chiclayo.    Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad comercial y turismo.

Marina se dedica a la venta D. uniformes escolares, buzos, chompas y otros, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio por seguridad desD. hace unos un año, su mercadería lo ofrece a sus clientes al contado y al crédito, también trae a pedido, tratando D. tener mayor demanda D. clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Al observar Marina que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad D. mercadería y abastecer su negocio para satisfacer las necesidades D. sus clientes, con la finalidad D. que su ganancias aumenten para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Marina is 47 years old, and is the mother of a family.  She lives with her husband and children in their own home, which has running water and electricity.  It is located in the urban area of Chiclayo province.  This area is characterized by commerce and tourism.

Marina works selling school uniforms, jogging suits, sweaters and other items.  She has been running her business out of her home for security reasons for the last year or so.  She sells her merchandise to her customers for cash or on account, and she also takes orders, in this way trying to meet the increased demand of her customers and so be able to earn more income to cover her family's expenses.

Marina has observed that her business is becoming increasingly prosperous, and feels it is necessary to request a loan from Edypme Alternative for 2,500 New Soles.  This loan is to buy a greater quantity of merchandise and stock up her business to meet her customers' needs, with the goal of increasing her earnings to be able to pay back her loan and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of merchandise and stock up her business

loans.name: Mariza

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Manhiça, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, viuva e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais dois frequentam a escola, e o outro ainda não tem idade escolar. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua enteada que vive com ela. 

Saiu da sua terra natal quando contraiu matrimonio, é pensionista e negociante ha mais de 12 anos onde dedica-se a compra e venda de produtos diversos, e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.750.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção DE CASA( cimento, areia, pedra, barrotes, e outros.) para dar continuidade a sua obra. Oprimeiro emprestimo foi de: 10.000.00mt, para o inicio da obra.
Pretende concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua familia e apostar na educação dos filhos, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Mariza was born in Manhiça in the southern Mozambique province of Maputo. She is a widow and mother of 3 children, two of whom go to school while the third is past school age. She made it through the 7th grade, but dropped out due to financial hardship. She lives in her own house with her family and also looks after her stepdaughter, who lives with her. 

She left her hometown when she got married and she has been a pensioner and a business woman for over 12 years. She buys and sells a variety of products, earning her a monthly income of 3,750 Mozambique Meticais (MZN), which she puts toward her household expenses and some of which she saves in her personal bank account (BIM). She has never taken out a loan from another bank. 

She came to know Hluvuku [Kiva field partner] through a friend who is also a Hluvuku client. This 10,000 MZN loan will be her second with Hluvuku and she intends to use it to buy construction materials for her home (cement, sand, stones, beams, etc.) in order to continue her home improvement work. Her first loan was 10,000 MZN to begin the construction work. She plans to finish her house to improve the living conditions of her family and to support her children's education. Thus, she intends to take out further loans with Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her home (cement, sand, stones, beams, etc.)

loans.name: Sinoun

texts.en:
Sinoun, a 31-year-old farmer, is married to a tuk tuk (auto rickshaw) driver. Their income is $10 per day. This couple has four children, all of them students. Every month, Sinoun has to spend $35 on food, $10 on electricity, $20 on school fees, and $75 on transportation.

Sinoun is requesting a loan to buy a new tuk tuk for her husband, as his current one is old and in need of frequent repairs. In the future, she wants to buy a sugarcane squeezing machine to sell sugarcane juice in front of her house, and hopes to be able to send her children to university when they finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a new tuk tuk for her husband.

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 29 años es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive en Latacunga. Elsa se describe como una persona responsable y alegre.

Trabaja con su esposo en la crianza de animales. Es la primera vez que trabaja con Fodemi el crédito que solicita es para la compra de terneros para su crianza lo cuàl aumentará su producción y mejorará sus ingresos.

Su sueño es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Elsa is 29 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Latacunga. Elsa describes herself as a responsible and joyful person.

She works with her husband raising animals.This is the first time she's worked with Fodemi. The loan she's asking for is to buy calves for her animal breeding business which will increase her production and improve her profits.  

Her dream is to finish construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy calves for her animal breeding business.

loans.name: Primicias Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMICIAS” iniciará su quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Elisabet. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de cosméticos, venta de masitas, venta de dulces, venta de juguetes, venta de papa, venta de coca, venta de sopitas, taller de costura y cortes.

La señora Elizabet,  indica que este es el segundo año que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de coca que viene trabajando desde hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su tía.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de coca) que comprara de villa Fátima y lo venderá en su local de ventas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y la atención de salud que la institución.

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Dora, ya que no accedio a la misma por motivos culturales.
texts.en:
The A.C. “PRIMICIAS” will begin its 5th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the communal bank Centro Focal Santiago II. It consists of 9 members and is lead by a board headed by Señora Elisabet. The members of the communal bank run various businesses such as: selling cosmetics selling cookies, selling candy, selling toys, selling potatoes, selling coca, selling soups, running a sewing and tailoring workshop .

Señora Elizabet says that this is the second year that she works with Pro Mujer, being invited to join by a promoter. She has been running a business selling coca for many years now, a business she learned from her aunt.

The loan she is currently obtaining will be used to increase her capital to buy coca which she will purchase at Villa Fatima and later sell in her shop. This kind of work allows her, as she is single, to generate an income to support her family wherever possible.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and the health care institute.

Señora Dora does not appear in the photo due to cultural constraints.

loans.use: to buy coca.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 30 years old and married with four children. With all of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Glenda runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for a year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, and other groceries. 

Glenda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Genafe

texts.en:
Genafe is a married woman with three kids. Genafe is 25 years old and lives in Pan-taon, Ozamiz City, Philippines. Genafe is in an agricultural business raising pigs. She raises pigs to earn a living and has had this business for five years. 

Each month, Genafe earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase feeds. Genafe has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Genafe hope to renovate their house and to expand her agriculture business raising pigs. She plans to raise five mother pigs to produce more piglets.

loans.use: to purchase feeds.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 26 years old. He is married to Elizabeth and together they have three children, ages seven, four, and two months old. He works in a quarry and has been in the business for the past 10 years. He gets a profit of KES 10,000 from his business.


This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to purchase another quarry. He will buy a larger stretch of quarry with his anticipated profit. His dream is to buy a lorry (truck) to aid in transporting the stones.

loans.use: to buy another quarry

loans.name: La Grace Group

texts.fr:
Mme R.Julie Pascaline représente le groupe LA GRACE. Elle est mariée, mère de 3 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 6ans.2 de ses enfants vont a l’école et elle a 3 personnes a sa charge.

Elle vend du savon depuis 1an. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de toécin dans un village environnant. Ses clients sont les femmes.

Mme veut s’acheter 03 cartons de savon local et un carton de savon marque SANTEX.

Ses économies serviront à ouvrir un kiosque. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une alimentation et construire une maison (aider son mari).
texts.en:
R.Julie Pascaline represents the group LA GRACE. She is married and the mother of three children. The eldest is 20 years old and the youngest is six. Two of her children go to school and she has three people to support. 

She has been selling soap for a year. She buys supplies at the Toécin market in a nearby village. Her customers are women.

 She wants to buy three boxes of local soap and one box of Santex brand soap. She will use her savings to open a kiosk, and her ambitions are to open a grocery store and build a house (to help her husband).

loans.use: to buy 3 boxes of local soap and 1 box of Santex brand soap.

loans.name: Tessito Gadamayo/nafore Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Naforé est créé le 15 Novembre 2006 au jour d’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 19 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Les membres ont des liens de parenté. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou (assise à l’extrême droite) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et  mère de quatre enfants, elle prend en charge aussi deux de ses neveux. 

Elle vend des fruits et légumes, de l’huile de palme et du miel dans le marché de son quartier. Elle a  une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant environs dix ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra  spécifiquement d’acheter du miel pour la revente.

Elle désire soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge sanitaire et alimentaire de la famille, de même elle compte constituer une épargne pour de futurs investissements.
texts.en:
Group Naforé was created on November 15, 2006, on the day of the inauguration of the "banc villageois" (village lending association). It is composed of 19 women, all coming from the same district. The members are all related. Their main business is retail.

Mrs. Fatou (sitting all the way to the right) is the group's leader. She is 49 years old. She is married and a mother of four. She also has two of her nephews in her care.

She sells fruits and vegetables, palm oil and honey at her local market. She has a lot of experience in this business, since she has been active in it for about ten years.
