Specifically, her new loan will enable her to purchase honey for retail.

She wishes to support her husband in providing for the family's needs in terms of health and food. In addition, she is planning on creating savings for future investments.

loans.use: to buy honey for resale.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex, a 38-year-old farmer, wants to increase his income in the next harvesting season, and so is requesting a loan of P15,000 from Alalay Sa Kaunlaran Inc. to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. Alex hopes to increase his income in order to finance the education of his five children so that they can one day earn degrees and therefore have better opportunities in life than he has had.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for use in his business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La Señora Virginia  tiene  como actividad la venta de carne seca "CHARQUE", compra ganado vacuno de la feria dela localidad de Achacachi, Corta la carne y luego coloca sal  para el secado de la carne una vez seca es el charque, este trabajo realiza  con ayuda de su Papa, su venta principal es en Yungas Coroico, el momento de la besito se encontraba vendiendo el Charque junto con su Mama en  El Alto, vende quincenalmente sus productos, esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella, en esta ocasión solicita financiamiento para aumentar su capital de negocio, comprara ganado vacuno y así de esta manera incrementar  sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia, ya que esta actividad es su única fuente ingresos.
texts.en:
Virginia  sells dry meat or "charque", She buys beef cattle from the market in the settlement of Achacachi.  She cuts up the meat, then puts salt on it to dry the meat, and once it is dry, it is charque. She does this work with her father. She mainly sells in Coroico in the Yungas region. 

At the time of the visit, she was selling charqui with her mother in El Alto. She sells her products every two weeks. This activity is her main source of income.

At this time, she is applying for a loan to increase her working capital. She will buy beef cattle, and in this way increase her income to improve the quality of life for her and her family, as this activity is their only source of income.

loans.use: To buy beef cattle.

loans.name: Eshdavlat

texts.ru: Эшдавлат в основном занимается выращиванием и продажей картошки, пшеницы и лука. Он женат и на воспитании имеет шестерых детей из них трое несовершеннолетние. Жена присматривает за детьми и занимается домашними делами. Кроме этого он занимается откормом крупного рогатого скота. В бизнесе ему помогает семья в основном его дочка и сын. Эшдавлат хотел бы получить займ для покупки семян, минеральных удобрений и топлива. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Eshdavlat is mostly engaged in growing and selling potatoes, wheat and onions. He is married and is raising six children, including three minors. His wife looks after the children and takes care of the household. Eshdavlat also raises cattle. His family, particularly one daughter and one son, help him with the business. Eshdavlat would like to obtain a loan to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel. He hopes for your help and thanks you in advance for your kindness and assistance.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, solicita otro préstamo porque quiere aprovechar la época de fin de año para incrementar sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos y comprar más frutas frescas como: mango, jocotes, jícamas, sandia, papaya, para ofrecerles a los clientes variedad.
Los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron porque las ventas mejoraron cada día, las condiciones económicas son favorables para su familia.
texts.en: María is asking for another loan because she wants to take advantage of the end of year season to increase sales and earn higher income and buy more fruit like: mangoes, jocotes [red mombin], jicama, watermelon and papayas to offer a greater variety to her customers.  Previous loans helped her because sales improved daily and the economic conditions are favorable for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Dina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Dina lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Candida de 48 años quien es comerciante ambulante de frutas, verduras y pan entre otros productos. Ella tiene tres hijos de 15, 14 y 10 años los cuales estudian y en su tiempo libre le ayudan en el negocio.
Ella invertirá el crédito en la crianza de animales de patio gallinas, cerdo…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Iliana de 24 años quien vende comida desde hace 3 años y Jennifer de 28 años tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The Dina group is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising women.

Candida, age 48, is one of them.  She sells fruit, vegetables, bread, and other products in an itinerant manner.  She has three children, ages 15, 14, and 10.  The children go to school, and in their free time they help her with the business.

She will use the loan for raising small animals like chickens and pigs, etc.

The other members are 24 year old Iliana who has been selling food for three years and 28 year old Jennifer who has a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy small animals like chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Jafred's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Jafred, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. He is 35 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 12 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.  He is married and has 4 children.

Jafred is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund as this means that he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Jafred says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2013, he has learnt a lot from farming training, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Jafred will use the profits from this season to send his children to school.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.25 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en:
Damascene is 32 years old. He is married with 2 children aged between 2 and 6 years, they all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 10 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Эту спокойную и ответственную женщину зовут Насиба. Она из замечательного городка Турсунзаде. Турсунзаде городок, где большинство жители занимаются животноводством. Таким образом, они зарабатывают на жизнь. Насиба тоже одна из тех жителей, которая очень трудолюбивая и удивительная женщина. Она работает медсестрой в больнице своего городка и одновременно занимается животноводством. Больше доход она получает от продажи животноводство, чем в больнице. Сейчас Насиба хочет, купит несколько голов скотов. В данный момент у неё нет достаточно денег, и поэтому она обратилась за кредитом, надеясь, что ей не откажут.
texts.en: This calm and responsible woman is called Hanifa. She is from the wonderful town of Tursun-zoda. Tursun-zoda is a small town where the majority of residents rear animals. This is how they earn a living. Hanifa is also one of those residents and she is a very hard-working and amazing woman. She works as a nurse in her town's hospital and simultaneously rears animals. She gets more income from selling animals than in the hospital. Now Hanifa wants to buy several heads of cattle. At the present time she does not have enough money, and so she has applied for a loan, hoping that she will not be refused.

loans.use: to buy several heads of cattle.

loans.name: Janel

texts.en: Janel owns and operates a transportation transport service  for many years to earn a living. He had support the family's daily needs with this income aside from their retail store.  Recently, he took a new loan to buy spare parts for his  motorcycle maintenance to used for his transportation business and a portion to buy additional goods for their retail store. He plans to buy sidecar for his motor for expansion of his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses will use the loan to buy fertilizers and fertilizers for his tea plantation. He is such a hardworking man with an aspiration of buying land to expand his tea plantation. The reason behind engaging in the businesses of tea growing and motorcycle transport was to get income to look after his family. He has been in the motorcycle business for the last two years and is proud to mention about the profits that have enabled him to improve on his standards of living and the family at large. He faces a difficulty of loss of soil fertility and pesticides which affect his tea plantations’ expected harvests.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fertilizers for his tea plantation.

loans.name: Concepcion Aguilar

texts.en:
I sell new clothes in the San Juan market in the town of Siguatepeque, but I also sell door to door to offices and places where my regular clients live and work.

Siguatepeque is a city of about 45,000 people. Located in the Central Highlands of Honduras, the climate is considerably more temperate than the coastal area and lower elevations.

loans.use: Buy inventory

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.en:
My name is Maria C. and I make shoes for women as well as men and women's hats too. I have had my leather-working store for 4 years and I have my husband's help making the shoes. I have a good clientel as many foeigners like my products and we live in an area heavily visited by tourists. My business generates enough income to support my family and my goal is to increase production. With the additional earnings I will be able to remodel my store and to buy a machine to cut leather as well as be abe to support my family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Maria C. me dedico a la produccion de zapatos para dama y fajas para dama y caballero, tengo mi talabarteria hace unos 4 años y tengo la ayuda de mi esposo para la fabricacion de los zapatos, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi producto le gusta mucho al extranjero y nosotros estamos ubicados en un pueblo muy visitado por turistas, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi produccion y con las ganancias que tenga poder remodelar mi taller y comprar maquinaria para el corte del cuero asi mismo mantener mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase leather, suede, thread, needles, soles, resistol, and razors

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is 27 years old and single. She is a returnee. During the war, she was in Iran where she trained to be a beautician and opened her own shop. When the situation got better in Afghanistan, she returned to Kabul with her family and opened a beauty salon there. She has a lot of customers, but lacks the finances to take full advantage of their business. She is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more cosmetics and salon supplies so she can expand what she offers in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and salon supplies

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en:
Ilgar has 7 years of experience in this business. He was born in 1973 in Salyan region,  Yenikand village. This hardworking person is married, and has a child.  He works very hard for the success of his family. He raises cattle.
Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy more equipment to help him with his work.

loans.use: To buy 2 pieces of equipment for his work

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda C. migrated from the district of Port Loko to the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone for business purposes.  He is fifty years old and is married with five children.  As an experienced business man, he changes his business inventory according to his customers demand.  With his previous loan, Dauda diversified his business activities.  He is assisted by his wife who sells goods in Makeni town and surrounding villages.  The couple is able to provide their children with basic needs and Dauda is determined to educate three of their children at the university level.  For the future of the children, he opened a family savings account.  He is requesting a second loan of $200.

loans.use: to diversify his current business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi Thuy

texts.vi:
The neighborhood around the University of Hà Nội, Xuân Hòa district, offers a lot of opportunities for business because of its population density. There are a lot of restaurants and rooms for rent to accommodate those university students. Apart from the need for food, living space and cultural exchange, getting on line is an undeniable necessity for the young crowd. Based on her market study, Ms Nguyễn Thị Thúy opened an internet cafe in 2003. Ms Thúy is 57 years old, her 3 children are all grown up and have a job so she has to hire 2 employees to help her run the internet cafe. Having a good, friendly customer service keeps the cafe busy. Her husband, a retired military officer, helps her out when she is busy. The revenue for the internet cafe is about 350 USD / month minus salaries for the 2 employees at 50 USD / month. Ms Thúy requests a loan of 575 USD to buy new equipment for her internet cafe.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Là một địa bàn rất thuận lợi cho việc phát triển kinh tế (gần trường Đại học sư phạm Hà Nội 2) nên trên địa bàn phường Xuân Hòa có rất nhiều những cửa hàng ăn, phòng trọ. Bên cạnh nhu cầu về ăn ở, việc giao lưu, trao đổi, tìm hiểu thông tin qua mạng dần trở thành một nhu cầu không thể thiếu được của giới trẻ. Theo xu hướng chung của thị thường, chị Nguyễn Thị Thúy V. đã mở quán internet vào năm 2003. 57 tuổi, 3 con đều có việc làm độc lập nên chị V. phải thuê thêm 2 nhân công hỗ trợ cho việc trông nom cửa hàng. Luôn giữ thái độ vui, vẻ hòa nhã với mọi người nên cửa hàng của chị lúc nào cũng đông khách. Chồng chị, một cán bộ quân đội đã nghỉ hưu đôi khi cũng giúp trông hàng khi chị có việc bận. Thu nhập từ cửa hàng là khoảng 300 USD/tháng trong đó lương của nhân công là 50 USD cho mỗi người. Chị V. đang xin vay 575 USD để đầu tư mua thêm máy mới cho cửa hàng.

loans.use: to buy computers

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan lives in south Lebanon in the region of Saida. Hassan is a 25-year-old barber who is intending engaged to be married. He would like a loan to purchase enough cosmetic products to generate revenues for his wedding. This is the third loan Hassan has requested from Al Majmoua, and he has a responsible history with them. Hassan would like a loan of $1200 to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia is married. Her husband, who is cosigning the loan, is a policeman. They have four children that depend on them.

Sofia owns a general store and has 4 years of experience in this endeavor. On the other hand, her husband has more than 20 years of experience working for the National Police.

The competition in the general store trade is very high, however, Sofia has the advantage of her experience that has allowed her to establish a steady clientele.

The current loan request is for the purchase of merchandise. The products that she buys are typical for a general store, such as consumer product for the use in the home. The prices fluctuate based on their seasonal availability.

Their credit history is good. They have already obtained two loans through this institution. Currently they are in the process of this third request with excellent references as to their reliability and timeliness.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Sofia es una señora casada, su esposo que es Policia quien firma como co-deudor, ademas tienen cuatro hijos que dependen de ellos.

Sofia tiene una tienda de barrio y cuenta con una experiencia de 4 años en este rubro.

Su esposo por otra parte tiene una experiencia de más de 20 años traajando para la Policia Nacional.

La competencia en este rubro es bastante elevada pero Sofia tiene la ventaja de contar con la experiencia que le ha valido para tener una clientela establecida.

La presente solicitud es para a adquisición de mercadería, los productos que compra son los típicos de una tienda de barrio que son productos de consumo masivo de la canasta familiar, los precios fluctuan según la escacez de los productos de la época.

Su comportamieno crediticio es bueno, ya han sacado dos créditos en nuestra institución, actualmente está en su tercera operación con excelentes referencias de puntualidad.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Fatima Del Socorro

texts.es:
Fatima A. is 28 years old. She is single with an 8-year-old child. Fatima works in the foreign trade zone in the city of Managua. Her workday begins at 6 a.m. and lasts until 8 p.m. Her cosmetics business along with the help she receives from the father of her child helps Fatima provide for her family. She lives with her parents who are elderly and who help her with the care of her child. Fatima solicits a loan for the insulation of the walls of her home which are made of zinc and cement. She needs to purchase plycem boards and wood for this alteration.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Fátima A. tiene 28 años de edad, soltera, con un hijo de 8 años. Fatima Trabaja como operaria en una Zona Franca de la ciudad de Managua, el día de Trabajo de Fátima está comprendido desde las 6.00 am hasta las 8.00 pm., es de ahí, de la venta de cosméticos y de la ayuda que recibe del padre del niño como Fátima alimenta a su familia. Vive con sus padres que ya son ancianos y quienes son los que la ayudan con el cuido de su pequeño hijo. Fátima solicita el crédito para forrar las paredes de su cuarto de habitación que actulamente son de zinc y cemento. Necesita comprar láminas de plycem y madera para poder hacer este cambio.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the insulation of her home

loans.name: Saum

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Saum and her husband have been married since1975. They have seven children, four sons and three daughters. One of their children is married and lives in Phnom Penh. Of the other six, four are full time workers and one is studying in a local school. Saum and her husband are have been farming since 1980. They grow tomatoes, wax gourd, papaya, and eggplant in the farm near their house. Saum and her family live on an island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 
Saum is requesting a first-time loan in the amount $500 from MAXIMA for expenses related to growing tomatoes and wax gourd.

loans.use: For expenses related to growing tomatoes and wax gourd

loans.name: Luz 3 Group

texts.es:
Clara Guadalupe is 35-years-old, and she has sold clothing in a small location in her home for 3 years. She goes to La Mesilla in Guatemala to buy her merchandise. She uses her income to support her children. She wants to invest the credit in the purchase of merchandise to avoid the expenses that are generated from traveling to La Mesilla. The other members of the group are Olga E. G., who sells clothing and decorative items, and Lucia G. G., who sells perfume.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

CLARA GUADALUPE, TIENE 35 AÑOS DE EDAD, DESDE HACE 3 AÑOS SE DEDICA A VENDER ROPA EN UN PEQUEÑO LOCAL QUE TIENE EN CASA, LA MERCANCIA LA VA A COMPRAR A LA MESILLA EN GUATEMALA, CON LOS INGRESOS MANTIENE A SUS HIJOS, CON EL CREDITO QUIERE INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MERCANCIA Y EVITAR EL GASTO QUE GENERA VIAJAR A LA MESILLA. LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: OLGA E. G. VENDE ROPA Y ARTICULOS DE DECORACION Y LUCIA G. G. VENDE PERFUMES.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to avoid transporation costs.

loans.name: Ifeta

texts.en:
Ifeta was born in 1957 and she is married. Her husband works in a private firm and his monthly income is 400.00KM. In the period when her husband is not working, Ifeta sells milk products and vegetables. They get additional income from the bureau in the amount of 150.00KM.

Ifeta wants to use this loan in the amount of 1200.00KM for buying stock food, in order to expand the cattle herd.

loans.use: For buying stock food.

loans.name: Julia Nansy

texts.es:
Señora Juliana belongs to the Las Brisas Comunal Bank, in the Calleria District of the Ucayali Department. She is 38 years old and the mother of three children. Juliana is separated from her husband. When Juliana received her first loan of 300 Soles from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a business selling groceries. Now she leaves early each morning to sell homemade meals, oil, detergent, smoothies, cleaning supplies, cologne, and other products in large and small quantities. Juliana spends her nights caring for her children. With a loan of 700 Soles, Juliana will buy 1 case of oil, 2 cases of soap, detergent and plates. She’ll pay back the loan in 4 months. Juliana is happy that her income is increasing now that she sells large quantities. She can now enjoy the level of economic stability that she’s always wanted.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juliana pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Brisas, ubicado en el Jr. Antonio Maya de Britto 333, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años, es madre de 3 hijos, es separada. Juliana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de abarrotes. En la actualidad ella sale muy temprano para ofrecer sus productos que son platos, aceite, tazas, detergente, licuadora, talcos, colonias, al por mayor y menor, en las noches atiende a sus hijos. Con este préstamo de S/. 700 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 caja de aceite, 2 cajas de jabón, detergente, platos. Juliana esta muy feliz por que sus ganancias aumentan, ahora vende al por mayor, puede gozar de una estabilidad económica que siempre quiso tener.

loans.use: Juliana will buy merchandise with the loan.

loans.name: Vek

texts.en: Vek L., 58, is married and lives with three of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer, making US$2 every day, and her husband grows vegetables, making approximately US$3 each day. They are also supported by two of the children who are employed. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and rising inflation has affected all Cambodians. These factors have made a difficult economic year for much of the country, Vek L. included. In light of the country’s economic difficulties, Vek L. is seeking to increase her income and expand her land. She is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase more land to grow rice. With this new land she believes she will see an increase in her income and her standard of living will be raised.

loans.use: Purchase farmland

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en:
Nazira is married. She is 30 years old . She is a hard worker and a very talented woman. She worked before in embroidery but she couldn't support her family very well so she changed her business to tailoring. She is working with her hands; doesn’t have any machines.

She has requested an individual loan to buy a new machine and a generator for her business so she can work faster and grow this new business to make a good income for her family in the future.

Nazira is very happy to be able to ask for this loan. She hopes to enlarge her shop in the future to become stronger in her business and help her husband. Her husband is a taxi driver and she wants to support him. She would like to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a new machine and a generator

loans.name: Mohab Allah

texts.en:
Mohab Allah is 20 years old. He graduated school one year ago, and began work at a retail shop left over from his father. His father had been running the family store for more than ten years, but was unable to continue, and Mohab had to take over.

Mohab, who is a hard worker, is requesting a loan to expand his store. He would like to complete his lease purchase and continue to extend his customer base to support his family. Mohab is very happy to be involved in the loaning process, and was overjoyed when he applied for AFSG. He would like to take the opportunity and thank any lenders who will help him and his family.

loans.use: To complete his lease purchase

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.ru: Сайидгулова Нозигуль жительница района Яван.Возраст  2 года, замужем ,имеет 3 детей. Клиентка имеет продуктовый магазин.Более 4 лет занимается бизнесом.Торговля является основным источником дохода ее семьи.Кредит берет для  пополнения ассортимента магазина.Планирует погасить кредит в тчении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nozigul S. resides in Yavan district. She is married and has three children. She has a grocery store, and has been in business for more than four years. This trade is the main source of income for her family. Nozigul would like to take out a loan to replenish her store’s inventory. She plans to repay the loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replenish her inventory

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita S. lives in Balkhu, Kathmandu. She lives in a single family home with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Rabi S., works in a private office. Her eldest son is in fourth grade and her other son is in second grade.
Mrs. S. runs a grocery store in Halumandhoka near Kathmandu Durbar Square. She sells noodles, biscuits, and snacks in her store. She will use her loan to buy more grocery items for her store.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items

loans.name: Abass

texts.en: Abass is a 27-year-old young man living in Chyah, a suburban area of Beirut. Previously working as a hairdresser, Abass decided to have his own business and opened the 'Just Hair' Salon in 2003. Catering to clients from all neighborhoods, Abass is managing his salon well and intends on improving his services. Today he requests a loan of $1000 to ameliorate the salon's decor and give a relaxing atmosphere to his clients.

loans.use: To improve the salon's decor

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: Lola tiene 41 años, vive sola, ya que es soltera. Se dedica desde hace 20 años a la venta de F., trabajaba anteriormente para otras personas, pero gracias a su arduo esfuerzo logró poner hace 10 años su propio negocio. A Lola le gusta mucho trabajar con las F., porque siempre le han gustado, ella sabe que tienen vida propia y que hay que cuidarlas, y gracias a ese cuidado es que mantiene a sus F. siempre lindas y frescas, logrando que la clientela la prefiera. Lola se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de F. para vender y así incrementar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lola is 41 years old, lives alone, and is single. For the past 20 years, she has worked selling flowers. She used to work for other people, but thanks to her hard work, ten years ago she was able to start her own business. She loves working with flowers as they are one of her passions. She knows that each flower has it's own life and she must take care of it. Thanks to the care she provides in maintaining her flowers, they always appear beautiful and fresh which is why customers prefer her flowers. This is Lola's second loan from Microfinanzas Prisma and she has always been very punctual with her payments. She will use the money to purchase a larger quantity of flowers to sell in order to grow her business and earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a larger quantity of flowers to sell

loans.name: Nabielah

texts.en:
Nabielah is a 43 year old woman who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Nabielah has owned a toy and gift store for four years. She has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Nabielah has requested a loan.
Nabielah hopes that the loan will help her improve her business which will improve her income. She is special in her work because she has a large variety of items in the shop. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others from her village. When she first started, the difficulty she faced was to please all her clients and have variety in her merchandise. Nabielah decided on doing her business because of her dedication to children and her experience in retail. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: Nabielah will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Dilbarniso

texts.ru:
Халимова Дилбарнисо Самандаровна, 1984 года рождения, замужем и имеет 2 детей. Чтобы пополнить семейный бюджет дополнительным доходом решила заняться предпринимательской деятельностью. Она арендовала торговую точку на рынке «Хайр», города Вахдат, для продажи женской одежды. Наращивая свой опыт предпринимателя, вырученные деньги с бизнеса, пускала в оборот. Данный момент в продаже имеются подарочные платки, разнообразные шали и шарфы.  Свои товары Дилбарнисо закупает на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. В этом бизнесе у нее 6 лет опыта.
 Для увеличения ассортимента хочет участвовать в программе «Кива» и получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони для увеличения товаров.
texts.en:
Dilbarniso Samandarovna H., born in 1984, is married and the mother of two children. Dilbarniso went into business in order to supplement her family income, and she rents a stall in Bahdat's Hayr city market in order to sell women's clothing. Building on her experience as an entrepreneur, she plows money back into the business. At the moment she has headscarves, neck scarves and shawls for sale as gifts. Dilbarniso purchases her goods at the Korvon wholesale market in the city of Dushanbe. She has six years of experience in this endeavor. To increase the range of goods in her inventory, she wants to participate in Kiva's program and to take out a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni in order to purchase good.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of scarves

loans.name: Ami Brigitte

texts.fr: Amavi brigitte habite le quartier de gblinkomégnon et a pour activité le commerce de plastiques te divers, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1993 et de façon ambulante, elle a déjà obtenu un crédit de 450000f qu’elle a déjà remboursé, elle sollicite un deuxième crédit de 500000f afin de pouvoir augmenter son stock, elle est veuve et a trois enfants, elle travaille dur pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amavi Brigitte lives in the Gblinkomégnon district. Her work involves commerce in plastics and various goods. She goes door-to-door and has been in this business since 1993. She has already been the recipient of a loan of 450,000 francs, which she has already repaid. She’s requesting a second loan of 500,000 francs in order to increase her inventory. She is a widow with three children who works hard to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastics and various goods

loans.name: Mrs. Sinath Khut Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people living in Boeng Leach village in Takeo province are asking for a village bank loan, and they will use it for various purposes. Mrs. Sinath K. is 28 years old and the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. She faces a problem because she lacks the money to buy rice seed to grow on the field. In order to deal with this problem, she decided to ask for a loan. Her husband, Mr. Long Mey, helps his wife. Mrs. Sinath K. has a child who is too young to work or study. 

Two members in this group have end-of-term loans, which means they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva. The rest of the group have monthly payment loans.

loans.use: To buy rice seed to grow on the field.

loans.name: Zalay Kha Group

texts.en:
Zalay kha is the group leader of the Zalay kha group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to receive money for his/her business.

Zalay kha and Rahayla want to take a loan for their carpet-weaving business. Narghas wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of selling barker shop. M. Faryad wants to take a loan for his businesses. They all want to see expansion and progress in their businesses and want to earn more money to support their families. With this loan, they can make their businesses larger, support their families better and make a better future for themselves and for their families. They are really happy with this loan process in this poor country.

loans.use: To increase their business

loans.name: Esteban Miguel

texts.es:
Esteban  es socio del Bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes 
Esteban es soltero, estudió para profesor de  educación primaria, pero no lo ejerció.  
Trabajaba como empleado en una tienda de abarrotes por años con el dinero juntado decidió comprar sacos de arroz y menestras  los vendió a los vecinos y decidió abrir en su casa una tienda de abarrotes. 
Esteban necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra mercadería y hacer pagos a los proveedores. 
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió a ahorrar, a ser solidario y mas de la cultura de crédito, le ayuda para orientar a sus clientas. 
El sueño de Esteban  es ejercer su carrera y seguir  creciendo en el negocio
texts.en:
Esteben is a member of his community bank, Virgen de las Mercedes. Esteban is single. He studied to be an elementary school teacher, but he has not taught. For years he worked as an employee in a grocery store. With the money he put together, he decided to buy sacks of rice and legumes and sell them to his neighbors. He decided to open a grocery store in his house. Esteben needs a loan of 1000 PEN to buy merchandise and pay his suppliers. Since he has been with Finca he has learned to save, to be supportive, gained more knowledge about loans, and how to direct his customers. Esteban’s dream is to work in his profession and to keep his business growing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and pay his providers

loans.name: Moniera

texts.en:
Moniera and Tirso M. are simple people who live peacefully in Barangay Nangalisan, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. They have been blessed with three children and know that parenthood is a great responsibility. The couple support their children, both in terms of basic necessities and education. They also provide their children with moral and spiritual support, and are doing their best to earn and save for their future.

Moniera manages a village store where she sells different grocery and frozen items. She buys most of her products in the Solano Public Market. She is seeking a loan to improve her business, increase her income and better support her family. She believes that the small amount she is asking to borrow will be a big help to her business and her family.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins K. is 27 years old. He is single and lives in his one-room apartment with his younger brother. He sells used footwear like slippers, sandals, shoes, and sometimes school bags. Collins has been in business for the last six years. He sells his products through hawking; he normally treks to sell in villages during their market days. Depending upon the amount of his goods, he employs up to three young boys who assist him in selling.

He needs the loan to enable him to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. He believes the loan will help him to be more resourced to purchase good quality and large quantity to upgrade his inventory. With the loan, he wants to purchase assorted used shoes, sandals and slippers in bulk. He would be grateful for your assistance, and he belongs to the village bank called ‘House of faith’.

loans.use: To purchase used shoes, slippers, and sandals etc.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Patricia tiene poco tiempo que se quedo viuda y bajo su responsabilidad tres hijos, quienes ya están creciendo y quieren su propio espacio.
Ella trabaja en la compañía de agua de la ciudad como secretaria sus ingresos son bajos y no cuanta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la mejora. Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que requiere para la elaboración de una recama la cual para los niños.
texts.en:
Claudia Patricia was widowed a short time ago and she was left to be the sole provider for her three children. They are growing now and they are needing more space. She works for a water company in the city as a secretary. She does not make enough from her job to pay to make a much-needed addition to her home. This is why she is asking for a loan to be able to buy the materials she needs to add a room to her house for her children.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a bedroom for her children.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita P. is a 52-year-old rice grower with three children. In the past, Enriquita worried about how she was going to afford her huge family expenses. However, her partnership with Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI), gave her capital to sustain her one-hectare farm. CEVI also helped Enriquita start up a sari-sari store (convenience store) business.

This time, Enriquita wants to apply for a loan of 8,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy good-quality rice seeds as well as fertilizers. Hopefully, this will eventually give her a bountiful harvest from her farm.

About CEVI
CEVI helps small business to grow. It provides its clients not just with loans, but with training and insurance cover as well.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Islom

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Ислом мужчина 50 лет. Женат имеет 3-х детей. Ислом работает водителем маршрутного такси.  Ему необходимо переоборудовать машину на газовую систему. Он делает рейсы с города в районы. С бензином ему обходилось дорого , так как бензин дорожал а доходов меньше , он повышал ставку цены, но клиенты предпочитают ехать дешевле.Получив кредит третий раз, он доволен, и планирует получить на ремонт машины в будущем.
texts.en:
Islom is a 50 year old man. He is married and has 3 children. Islom works as a van line driver. He needs to convert his car to run on hydrogen gas. He drives on routes from the city to the outlying neighborhoods. Gas increased his costs, since gas prices went up and profits decreased; he increased rates, but customers prefer to ride at a cheaper price. After taking out a loan for the third time he is happy and plans to take out another loan in the future to make auto repairs.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Convert automobile

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda, a member of Ushirikiano borrower group in Kola Morogoro, is the 36-year-old married mother of three children whose ages are 16, 13, and 12.  She also cares for two other dependents.  Three years ago, Emelda started her own cafe business.  She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 45000 Tanzania shillings.

This will be Emelda's first loan from BRAC Tanzania;  she is requesting the amount of 200,000 in order to buy more rice and wheat for her business.  With the additional profit she will gain from the use of this loan, Emelda hopes to save money to pay school fees, buy more food for the family, and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more rice and wheat.

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin is forty-six years old. He is married and has five children, two sons and three daughters, who are all still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for the family. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Godwin is a petty trader. He sells charcoal. He supplies it to retailers in his community and treks to supply it in other communities. Godwin has been in business for three years now and wants a loan to expand his business. He is hopeful to give all his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Busara Group

texts.en:
Vaileth is a member of the Busara borrower group in Sakina, Arusha. She is 28 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 13, and 7 years old.

Vaileth has owned a clothing business selling clothes for 5 years, she works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Vaileth`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 500,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Vaileth hopes to pay school fees and expand her business.

Mamtum is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the amount 450,000 Tsh in order to expand her clothing business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith tiene 45 años, en su barrio se caracteriza por su buen sentido del humor. Ella vive con su esposo y su hermana menor, quien sufre de discapacidad mental, motivo por el cual Judith trabaja arduamente. Su puesto de ropa está ubicado en la ciudad de Cañete, por lo que cada fin de semana tiene que viajar aproximadamente 3 horas desde su casa para ofrecer allí las más novedosas y llamativas prendas de vestir. Esta actividad la viene realizando hace 6 años y lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus clientes, que a pesar del tiempo que se tomen en sus compras, buscan dialogar con Judith, quien muestra siempre interés en sus problemas. Pero considera que lo más difícil es el tiempo de viaje hacia su puesto; por ello, en el futuro desea adquirir un puesto de venta en algún mercado de su ciudad y dejar de recorrer largas rutas para trabajar.
Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y para mantenerse dentro del grupo tiene que trabajar arduamente, pues la responsabilidad y compromiso son requisitos indispensables para formar parte de su banco comunal. Judith solicita la cantidad de dos mil quinientos soles, para comprar más mercadería, estando ya en temporada de primavera espera estar acorde a la exigencia de sus clientes.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Ith

texts.en: Ith K., 41, is married with 5 children. He lives with his wife and children in Battambong Province. To make a living, He operates his motor taxi in the town and at the markets every day, earning an income of US $5 per day as a primary source of income for the family. His wife is engaged in a business of selling fruit and vegetable at a market in the town, earning approximately an income of US $3 per day. The family is also assisted by three of her children who are currently employed in a local garment factory, and a cook at a restaurant. K. is seeking to improve his standard of living and pushes the other two school-aged children to study at a good school in the future. Therefore, he is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase new sewing machines for his children to operate a business on their own.

loans.use: buy sewing machines

loans.name: Cruz Donal

texts.es: Cruz Donal tiene 55 años, el es un hombre casado y junto a su pareja tienen 5 hijos mayores de edad. Su actividad económica es una librería, hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y mantener a su familia. Su negocio inicio porque él no tenía un trabajo estable y necesitaba proporcionarle a su familia el alimento diario, por lo que empezó por esfuerzo propio. Actualmente el solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de hojas blancas, folder, tijeras, lapiceros, borrador y calculadoras. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio lo suficiente para sobresalir más que la competencia.
texts.en:
Cruz Donal is 55 years old, married, and has 5 adult children. He has been managing a bookstore for more than 8 years. He enjoys working and supporting his family. With much effort, Cruz started his business because he did not have stable job and needed to provide for his family’s daily needs.

He is currently requesting a loan to use as operating capital to buy copy paper, folders, scissors, pencils, erasers, and calculators. He hopes to expand his business so that he will be able to surpass the competition.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase copy paper, folders, scissors, pencils, erasers, and calculators

loans.name: Yolanda María

texts.es:
En la ciudad  de Managua, la señora Yolanda M. dedica sus esfuerzos en su trabajo para llevar a cabo la reconstrucción de su vivienda porque ha sufrido muchos daños a medida que el tiempo ha transcurrido y también a medida que los fenómenos climatológicos le han afectado.

Es por este motivo que ella solicita el crédito para comprar a lo inmediato los materiales de construcción e iniciar con esta obra para brindarle a su familia un techo digno donde habitar.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Yolanda M. dedicates her efforts to her job so she can carry out rebuilding her home, which has suffered a lot of damage as time has worn on and also has been affected by weather events. It is for this reason she is requesting the loan, so she can purchase construction materials immediately and start the work that will provide her family a dignified roof to live under.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es: Norma Isabel de 29 años de edad es madre soltera de 2 niños de 7 y 12 años respectivamente los cuales estudian la primaria, trabaja para el MINED de Santo Tomas en una escuelita ubicada en la zona rural en la Comarca El Guabo, sale los domingos y regresa los viernes por la tarde con sus hijos, cuenta con el apoyo de su mamá quien le cuida a sus hijas mientras trabaja, ademas esta estudiando el 4to año de la universidad los sabados, pues desea superarse profesionalmente para obtener mejores ingresos que le permita ofrecerle a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida.  Esta solicitando su 2do credito para seguir mejorando su casa construyendo un cuarto anexo para sus hijas, pues estan creciendo rapido y necesita brindarles privacidad y espera seguir siendo beneficiada con Kiva.
texts.en:
Norma Isabel is 29 years old and the single mother of 2 children, ages 7 and 12, who attend primary school. She works for the MINED of Santo Tomas, in a little school located in a rural area in the El Guabo region. She leaves Sunday and returns Friday afternoon. She is raising her children with help from her mother who takes care of them while she is working. She is also in her fourth year in university, taking classes on Saturdays. She wants to improve herself professionally, in order to obtain a better income, so she can offer her children a better quality of life. She is requesting her second loan to continue improving her house by building a room for her children, since they are growing quickly and she needs to offer them privacy. She hopes to continue to benefit from Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction of a room

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn D.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. She is 30 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Purok 4, Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. Jocelyn has been in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell in the future. At Jocelyn's discretion, her loan amount has been lowered down. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 28 years old. She is married with one daughter, Abigail, who is six years old and in school. Elizabeth owns a retail shop, called Baraka G. Shop, where she sells sugar, rice, cooking oil and fat as well as general household items. She has been in business for five years, prior to which she was in farming. Elizabeth plans to buy sugar and shoes for sale, as well as sewing materials, such as cloths, and a sewing machine with the loan of KES 20,000. She hopes to buy more stock in the future and expand her business. Her dream is to grow her business from retail to wholesale. Elizabeth describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Yunior Joel

texts.es:
el joven Yunior Joel R. C. tiene 27 años de edad, vive en union libre con la joven Francis Ordoñez, Yunior se dedica a la venta de tomates, papas, yuca, repollo, chiles, zanahorias, patastes, pepinos, bananos, naranjas, platanos, cebollas etc.
tiene 2 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, para vender su producto se traslada en su vehiculo a diferentes municipios del departamento de valle, muchas personas le compran ya que el llega a la puerta de cada casa vendiendo sus verduras y frutas. 
su meta a corto plazo es tener un puesto de venta de verduras y frutas en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Nacaome, el tener un puesto en dicho mercado es muy satisfactorio ya que las ventas ahi son muy buenas, es un poco dificil conseguir un puesto en dicho mercado pero esta dispuesto a conseguirlo.
Yunior es un joven luchador y trabajador con muchas ganas de superarse.
texts.en:
Yunior Joel R. C., 27, lives with his life partner, Francis Ordoñez. Yunior has sold tomatoes, potatoes, yucca, cabbage, chilies, carrots, chayote, cucumbers, plantains, oranges, bananas, onions, etc. for the last two years. He drives to various municipalities in Valle department to sell his product. Many people buy from him because he comes to their very door selling his fruits and vegetables. His short-term goal is to have a vegetable and fruit selling stand in Nacome's municipal market. Having a stall in the market is very satisfying because sales there are very good. However, getting a stall there is a bit difficult but he is determined to get it. Yunior is a hard-working, tenacious young man with a strong will to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Gerardo tiene la edad de 54 años, es un hombre trabajador y sencillo, su esposa tiene una hija, la cual estudia contabilidad. Don Gerardo es contador y trabaja independiente el cual le labora a varias empresas pero ganando un salario bajo. Pero como son varias el se ayuda económicamente para la alimentación y otros gastos, pero para el ha sido difícil poder hacer las mejoras a su casa que es muy insegura. El presto en Afodenic para comenzar hacer la construcción  de su casa pero como el financiamiento es poco por  la disponibilidad que el cuenta,  solo logro comprar parte de los materiales de construcción ya que todo esta caro. Es por eso que con este financiamiento comprara más material como: bloques,cemento,tablas, clavos y otros para comenzar hacer las mejoras, ya que es difícil en los tiempos de invierno para el, ya que se pasa el agua. Da las gracias por el apoyo ya que solo es posible esta mejora con el financiamiento ya que no cuenta con capital propio.
texts.en:
Gerardo, 54, is an unassuming, hard-working man. His wife has a daughter, who is studying bookkeeping. Gerardo is a bookkeeper and works independently. This means that he works for several companies but at a very low pay rate. Because he works for several, however, it adds up to enough to pay for food and some household expenses. However, it has been very difficult for him to do any home improvements and his house is very unsafe. He got funding from Afodenic to start building his house but, because the loan was small due to his eligibility limits, he was only able to buy some of the materials because everything is very expensive. With this new loan he will buy more materials like: concrete blocks, cement, boards, nails, etc. to start the improvements because Winter is an especially difficult time for him because water gets into the interior of the house. He gives thanks for the support because these improvements are only possible thanks to the loans because he does not have his own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en: Diosdada M. is a 49-year-old married woman living in Brgy. Quezon, San Carlos City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by planting rice and vegetables for sale. Diosdada’s husband, Protacio, is 48 years old and makes his living as a farmer. They have eight children between the ages of 5 and 26 years old. Three of her children already have families of their own and the other five are in her custody. Some of her children are currently going to school and also helping their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Diosdada joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 with the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income and earns an average monthly income of 4,000 Philippine pesos from her business activities. Diosdada is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 11,000 was used to fund operations of her rice and vegetables plantation, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing, for her 11th loan, the amount of Php 12,000 to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. Diosdada is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sara Rosaura

texts.es:
La señora Sara Rosaura es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 49 años, es soltera, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 están en edad académica y los otros 2 son independientes, conoce a EDAPROSPO desde hace 8 años y ha demostrado ser leal a la institución. Se dedica a la venta de queso y se dedica al reciclaje de chatarras (latas, plásticos) y en otras temporadas cuando no vende queso trabaja cocinando en un restaurante, nos cuenta que se inicio porque siempre le gusto el comercio con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado tener una casa de 2 pisos en donde actualmente renta cuartos también compro una refrigeradora, muebles y aporto para la educación de sus hijos quienes son profesionales y está logrando mejorar su calidad de  vida. 
Sara nos cuenta que su gran sueño es poner un restaurante en su vivienda.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido para el techado de un cuarto de su vivienda. Sara está muy agradecida con los inversionistas por apoyar a todas las personas con bajos recursos y así  mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sara Rosaura, 49, is an enterprising woman; she is single and has 4 children, two of whom are school age and 2 are independent. She has been associated with EDAPROSPO for 8 years and has shown herself to be loyal to the institution. She sells cheese and recycles trash (cans and plastics). During seasons when she does not sell cheese, she works as a cook in a restaurant. She tells us that she started out in business because she's always liked commerce and her daily efforts have made it possible for her to have a two-story house where she rents out rooms. She also bought a refrigerator, furniture and provided everything her children needed for school; they are now professionals. She is managing to improve her quality of life. Sara tells us that her great dream is to open a restaurant in her home. The recent loan is to be used to install a roof on one of the rooms of her house. Sara is very grateful with the investors for supporting low-income people thus helping them to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a roof on a room in her house.

loans.name: Sabadell Group

texts.es: El grupo “Sabadell” esta representado por la señora Rosario y conformada por 11 miembros de los cuales 4 son varones y el resto mujeres todos son vecinos de la misma zona y conocen bien sus negocios. La señora Rosario es enfermera de profesión y trabaja en la clínica Copacabana en el turno de la noche durante el dia ayuda a su esposo en la venta de medicamentos en su farmacia, ambos tienen dios niños y son muy trabajadores, la señora Rosario destinara su crédito a la compra de mercadería para la farmacia y para la construcción de un local comercial en su domicilio para trasladar su farmacia su zona pudiendo para estar mas cerca de sus hijos y para ahorrar en el alquiler de la tienda. El resto del grupo se dedica a la venta de helados, cosméticos, detergentes, peluches, refrescos, golosinas y el resto son trabajo en industrias y fabricas.  Si bien la competencia en general es bastante amplia, el grupo cuenta con experiencia y también con clientes fijos que reconocen su trabajo y demandan sus servicios, por otra parte es importante el entusiasmo que ponen a lo que hacen. El presente crédito será utilizado como capital de operaciones, para la compra de Insumos, materiales y mercadería para ampliar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos permitiendo darles un hogar mas estable a sus familias. La expectativa que tiene el grupo es de seguir trabajando y contando sobre todo con financiamiento para poder alcanzar sus metas. El banco tiene bastante experiencia crediticia ya que no es la primera vez que obtienen un crédito, pero dentro de la institución van cursando su primer ciclo.
texts.en:
The “Sabadell” group is represented by Rosario and made up of 11 members, 4 men and 7 women, all of whom are neighbors from the same area, who know their businesses well. Rosario is a nurse and works the night shift at Copacabana Clinic. During the day, she assists her husband in his pharmacy. They have two children and are very hard-working. Rosario will use the funds to buy stock merchandise for the pharmacy and to build a commercial site at her home so that she can move the pharmacy to her neighborhood in order to be closer to her children and save on rental costs. The rest of the group members are involved in a variety of commercial activities; such as: sale of frozen treats, cosmetics, detergents, plush toys, beverages, snacks; others work in industries and as factory workers. They face considerable competition but the group has experience and regular customers that appreciate their work and ask for their services. In addition, the enthusiasm with which they do their work is noteworthy. The present loan will be used for operational capital: to buy ingredients, merchandise and materials to increase sales and income making it possible for them to provide more stable homes for their families. The group expectation is to continue working and being able to continue to count on financing in order to reach their goals. The bank has considerable credit history since this isn’t their first loan. However, it is their first with this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her pharmacy.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es: Es un grupo de personas conformada por 3 integrantes, como presidenta se encuentra la señora Juana A. C., el cual esta señora cuenta con 2 hijos, y sus oficios son la elaboración de canastillas de plasticos,vive con su esposo, ella trabaja para que pueda ayudar a su esposo a mejorar sus condiciones economicas, actualmente necesita un prestamo, ya que necesita ampliar su Capital de Trabajo, por lo que se acerco a las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR de Pologuá,  para realiar su respectivo tramite, conjuntamente con las pesonas que integran el grupo.
texts.en:
There are three members in this group. Juana A. C. is the president of the group. She lives with her husband and has two children. Juana makes plastic baskets; she works so that she could help her husband improve their living standards. She is currently asking for a loan because she needs to increase her working capital. For this reason, Juana and other members of the group approached asociación ASDIR de Pologuá, seeking to obtain the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital.

loans.name: Polota Kakira Group Of Jinja

texts.en:
N. Margaret has been driving a hard bargain running her eight-year-old retail business in Jinja and doing some small-scale farming.

At its beginning, Margaret’s retail business was bringing her enormous profits, so much so that she managed to construct rental houses in Polota, Jinja. The 41-year-old married mother of four children says that throughout her eight-year experience, she has never wavered in her determination to succeed in whatever she sets out to do.

Margaret managed to zero-in early on the many inevitable financial and other operational business impediments that have manifested themselves. At length she has got to a point where she makes profits to the tune of 50,000 shillings a week. It’s in her future plans to buy a lorry (truck). This she hopes will help reduce the transport costs she has had to come to grips with in her years of operation.

With the acquisition of this loan, Margaret hopes to give her business a new lease of life through the purchase of new garments, electronics and edibles.

loans.use: To buy new garments, electronics and edibles for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, mulches and staking poles for his plantation

loans.name: Meluan Ole

texts.en:
Meluan Ole K. is 53-years-old. He is married to Lantano K. and he is a father of four school-going children. 

Meluan farms on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last five years.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his first loan. He is planning to use the loan to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his twenty acres of wheat. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent more land for farming to increase his wheat output.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can be planting more wheat in large scale.

Despite his age Meluan believes he is hard working, and by having the right resources at his disposal he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: Chemicals and fertilizer for wheat farming

loans.name: Gaviotas De Chuixac Group

texts.es:
Doña Miriam Yaneth Jiménez Rodriguez, es una persona que ha superado vendiendo alimentos todos los días en la plazuela, por lo tanto ella se dio cuenta que, vendiendo alimentos a podido mantener a su familia y cubrir sus gastos D. su hogar, por tal razón ella tomo la idea D. formar un grupo D. señoras, para que ellas puedan superar también este grupo está conformado por dieciocho integrantes,  mujeres que se dedican en diferentes funciones como crianza D. animales, venta D. ropa, venta D. artículos D. consumo diario. 

Las integrantes del Banco Comunal, “Gaviotas D. Chuixac”, residen en el Paraje Chuixac Barrio Santa Ana, Momostenango, están conformados por mujeres, todas se conocen bien desD. hace más D. doce años, decidieron solicitar un crédito en ASDIR para poder mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y la D. su familia ya que estas personas son D. escasos recursos y es D. gran ayuda para ellas ampliar su capital D. negocio y mejoras sus ventas como también sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Mrs Miriam Yaneth Jiménez Rodriguez earns her living by selling food every day on the square. She realised that by selling food she was able to support her family and cover her household expenses, so she set up a group for mutual support. The group has eighteen members, all of them women, whose different activities incluD. livestock rearing, sale of clothing and sale of consumer goods. The members of the “Gaviotas D. Chuixac” group loan live in Paraje Chuixac Barrio Santa Ana, Momostenango. The women, who have known each other for over twelve years, request a loan through ASDIR to improve their living conditions and those of their families. They are low-income individuals and the loan will enable them to expand their business capitals, increase sales and improve their incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa T., from Culo, MOlave Zamboanga del sur, is 47 years old, married, and the mother of two children. To make a living, Leonisa grows rice,  selling it in the local community.  Engaged in her business for more than two years, she earns approximately earning 3000 PHP a month.  

Leonisa joined PMPC to gain access for financial services and to help improve her living situation and ability to engaged in other business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3000 from PMPC to use as additional capital for her business.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
P. Nguyễn Thị (20203060041) is a 57-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. P. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Thượng Thôn Nhóm 08 (Nhóm 08).

P. is married and has one school-aged child.  To make a living, P. owns & operates a business raising chickens for sale. P. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

P. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. The loan will be the first loan taken out by P. from SEDA.  P. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 64-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  Trương Thị L. (0) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her butcher shop.


3.  Nguyễn Thị

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Rasheed

texts.en:
Rasheed is a 25-year-old young man. Rasheed lives with his parents and cares for them. Rasheed's father owns a small piece of land and he helps Rasheed grow vegetables and fruits to sell. One year ago, Rasheed opened a small internet cafe to help his parents and save money to get married. Rasheed is also a college student, so his income is divided between helping his family, and paying for school and marriage expenses. 

Rasheed needed a $1500 loan to cover the rest of the wedding expenses, so he came to FATEN office in Nablus, where he stands in the picture, to take a loan.

loans.use: Cover wedding expenses

loans.name: Balakiyem

texts.fr: cette dame est âgée de 40 ans, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce  de détail de tissus; elle fait ce commerce depuis 2 ans déjà. elle y a associé le commerce de sacs de sortie de femmes et  exerce son activité de façon ambulante. elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. son stock est en baisse, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter  une vingtaine de tissus et 11 sacs de sortie de femmes.
texts.en:
Balakiyem A. is 40 years old, and for the last two years she has made her living through the itinerant retail sale of fabric and women’s purses. She buys her supplies in Lomé’s large market. Her stock is low, and she is requesting a loan through WAGES to buy 20 pieces of fabric and 11 purses.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fabrics and women's purses

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Maria Eugenia tiene 24 años. Esta no es la primera experiencia que obtiene en financiamientos pues siempre busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. Hasta los momentos ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable  con sus cuotas, Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Tiene más de 6 años con este negocio pues con el paso del tiempo ha logrado obtener experiencia y también aprender a relacionarse con sus clientes y satisfacer la demanda. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y trajes. Pues su juventud le da cierta ventaja ya que tiene muchos clientes que son jóvenes y sabe bien el tipo de ropa que les gusta.
texts.en:
Maria Eugenia is 24 years old. This is not her first experience obtaining loans; she always looks for ways to improve her income. So far she has shown herself to be very responsible with her payments. Her economic activity is selling clothes. She has been in this business for more than 6 years. As time has passed, she has gained experience and has also learned to relate to her customers and meet the demand. This loan is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses and suits. Her youth gives her a certain advantage because many of her customers are young and she knows what type of clothes they like.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Blanca Leonor Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Blanca Leonor E. es socia del banco comunal Tres Marías, vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre, en esta comunidad su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y también a la agricultura, mucha de su población buscan en la ciudad una mejor oportunidad de trabajo para mejorar sus situaciones económicas.
 
Doña Blanca tiene 51 años, es viuda hace 6 años y tiene 4 hijos de 30, 27, 22, 19 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven  independientemente y sus  dos últimos hijos estudian en la universidad, la casa en la que habitan no es de su propiedad por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora Blanca se dedica a la venta de comida rápida en un kiosco, lleva 10 años con este negocio, trabaja los 7 días de la semana desde las 4 de la tarde hasta las 9 de la noche. 

Se encuentra trabando con los créditos en la banca comunal hace 5 años y ahora con el nuevo crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en arreglar el  kiosco de su negocio.
 
Su mayor sueño es tener su casa y ponerse un mini mercado.
texts.en:
Blanca Leonor E. is a member of community bank, Tres Marías. She lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca in a community of the same name. The local community raises animals and works the land. Many of the local people look for a better opportunity working in the city to improve their economic situation. Blanca is 51 years old, and has been a widow for six years. She has four children ages 30, 27, 22, and 19 years old. Her first two children are married and live independently; her remaining children are studying at the university. Blanca does not have her own house and instead rents. Blanca sells fast-food from a kiosk for a living and has been doing this for the past 10 years. She works 7 days a week, from 4pm till 9 o’clock at night. She is able to work using the loans that the community bank has provided her for the past 5 years, and with this new loan from the Fundación Espoir, Blanca can reinvest into her business by revamping her kiosk. Blanca’s dream is to own her own house and set up a mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Revamp a food stand/kiosk.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen lives in a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan called Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. She lives in the area of 447-EB with her family.

She is a working woman who makes and sells chingairs (a kind of tray to keep bread in it). She makes the chingairs with thick rope and sells it in neighboring areas and in the markets as well. She learned this skill from her mother and now she is taking advantage of it by running her own business. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband.

She is married to M. A. who runs his own medicine shop in the market where he sells medicine to his customers. He has been running the shop for the past five years. He also supplies medicines to the medical clinics and earns a good profit on it.

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy medicines in bulk and increase his sales. 

She is hopeful that her husband will be able to expand his business and provide all kinds of medicines to his customers.

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy medicines in bulk to resell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca T. has four children. She sells onions and tomatoes at Abura by moving around the area. She has received a junior high education. Her husband is a mason. Rebecca will use the loan to purchase more onions and other foodstuffs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rebecca plans to save to buy land.

loans.use: To purchase more onions and other foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Peter Maina

texts.en:
Peter Maina M. is 45 years old and married to Mwendwa. They have three children. He has a retail shop that he has been running for one year with a profit of approximately KES 14000 per month.

He intends to use the loan to re-stock his shop with shopping bags, tire rubber, soaps, detergent, sodas and tea leaves. He has never borrowed from another MFI and this is his third loan from KADET Ltd., where he has been successfully repaying the previous ones. 

He hopes to expand his business and buy a piece of land and develop it in order to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To re-stock his shop

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca C. A. de 36 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, en donde vive junto a sus tres hijos de 15, 13 y 11 años de edad. Ella es madre soltera quien trabaja muy duro por sacar a sus hijos adelante y brindarles todo lo mejor y necesario. La señora Francisca posee una tienda en la que comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual tenga la capacidad económica de surtir su negocio, esto debido a que Francisca no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo, y es muy necesario tanto para ella como para sus hijos, ya que es este el negocio que les permite solventar sus gastos familiares. Ella desea poder surtir su tienda con productos como detergente, comida enlatada, pan, golosinas, bebidas y otros productos más, los cuales son de primera necesidad en un hogar y que también son los que se solicitan más en una tienda. Francisca espera mejorar las ganancias y de esta forma contar con una vida más estable.
